name: Health-Link Society
description: We desire to bring together pre-health students who are passionate about community service and healthcare outreach. We strive to make a meaningful impact by volunteering with local clinics, hospitals, and nonprofits, while also helping members gain valuable hands-on experience in the healthcare field.
summary: The mission of Health-Link Society at UCF is to serve and connect with the underserved, while also fostering professional development among undergraduate and graduate student members, with an emphasis towards preparing for careers in healthcare.

name: It Takes A Village
description: ITAV strives to provide community and resources for students, with a focus on non-traditional and transfer students who intend to pursue a graduate or professional degree. We work to stream-line resources and events that are useful to pre-grad/pre-professional students, and highlight research, volunteer, clinical, networking, and shadowing experiences for our members.
summary: The mission of It Takes a Village is to provide an expansive support network and resources to non-traditional students, with an emphasis on supporting students seeking further education post-undergraduate completion.

name: Knights Build
description:
The mission of Knights Build is to help affordable housing organizations build homes for our local community and nationwide. We fulfill our mission by Advocating, Fundraising, and Direct Service by working with organizations such as Habitat for Humanity Seminole Apopka to provide home building volunteer opportunities. 

 

This page is always up to date with events and socials! 

Join our GroupMe for more info: https://groupme.com/join_group/94582879/CXzjcboi 

Visit our Linktree! https://linktr.ee/knightsbuilducf

 

In order to volunteer with us, you must be a dues paying member. Dues are $20 for the semester. If you have questions, are unable to pay, need a different payment option, or have any other questions at all, please contact one of our officers - they don't bite! You can do so via GroupMe, or you can find their emails on the officers page of our website.

As a growing community on campus, our goals are building and rehabilitating homes in partnership with affordable housing organizations, raising funds for local affordable housing organizations, and advocating on behalf of people in need of affordable housing. Everyone deserves a decent place to live and we want you to help us make that happen!
summary: The mission of Knights Build is to help affordable housing organizations build homes for our local community and nationwide.

name: Tau Epsilon Phi Fraternity, Eta Tau Chapter
summary:
The mission of Tau Epsilon Phi is to impress upon its members and promote the true significance of fraternal relationship and
create and perpetuate principles of Friendship, Chivalry, Service, and Brotherly love and the spirit of self-sacrifice.

name: 4EVER KNIGHTS
description:
4EVER KNIGHTS (4EK) is an organization that serves as the bridge between students and UCF Alumni, hosting events, programs and campaigns to connect all Knights and create tradition in the process. Our mission is to educate students on the importance of establishing and maintaining a lifelong relationship with UCF through the power of philanthropy.

 

To apply to be a 4EK Ambassador, please visit this link: https://ucfalumni.com/4ekambassadors
summary: Our mission is to educate students on the importance of establishing and maintaining a lifelong relationship with UCF through the power of philanthropy.

name: A Heartfulness Meditation Experience
description:
Our objective is to equip UCF students with a set of inner practices for personality development and self growth. We offer meditation and relaxation training to the entire UCF community with support from certified Heartfulness Trainers.

Heartfulness: Living by the Heart

By tuning into our hearts, we learn to be centered in our highest selves.

We can learn to strengthen that connection and cultivate an inner knowing that wisely directs and guides our lives. With practice, we can grow to face the challenges of life with courage and acceptance. If we live by the heart, we can become what we’re meant to be.

Explore and experience.

Feel the lightness and joy of your true nature. Heartfulness meditation is simply taking the time every day to tune into that internal presence.

In a short while, you’ll learn to remain connected to that gentle support throughout the day.

Heartfulness meditation can students to learn how to:
1. Relax for physical well-being
2. Deepen your meditation
3. Simplify thoughts
4. Unwind the mind
5. Let go of stress, rejuvenate
6. Observe your deepest feelings
7. Make wise life choices
8. Find inner strength
9. Develop confidence and balance
10. Nurture relationships
11. Find joy within
summary: Our objective is to equip UCF students with a set of inner practices for personality development and self growth. We offer meditation and relaxation training to the entire UCF community with support from certified Heartfulness Trainers.

name: ABC - Associated Builders & Contractors
description:
Curious about construction? 

Join us now and pave the way to a promising future in the industry!

Explore the world of construction with ABC UCF !

As a UCF student organization, we are passionate about the construction industry and committed to preparing you for successful careers. Our offerings include:

  • Project Site Tours
  • Guest Speakers
  • Networking Events
  • Internship Opportunities
  • Construction Management Competitions
  • Leadership Positions
  • Socials and Mixers
  • And More!

 

Stay updated on all events and announcements by joining our discord. Visit our Linktree for Discord, Instagram, Social Media, Presentation slides, Calendar, and More!

To officially become a member visit our ABC UCF Membership Payment Form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScSn9pTCLgWe2dL1W3B2jRpHKZCLAbTjZWpE_96zUNy0sYXiQ/viewform
summary: Discover your path to success in the construction industry with ABC UCF Student Chapter. As a registered student organization, we connect like-minded individuals, offering networking opportunities, industry connections, valuable insights, and much more.

name: Active Minds
description:
Active Minds UCF is a chapter of the nation's leading nonprofit organization dedicated to helping young people be open about mental health. Our mission is to break the stigma surrounding mental health and let people know it's okay to need help! We host biweekly hybrid GBMs about different topics related to mental health and aim to create a supportive peer-led community on campus.

Fall Membership Applications are now CLOSED!

To become a member:

1. Select "Join" on KnightConnect

2. Complete and submit a Membership Application Form

3. Join our Discord

 

Membership Applications CLOSED and will reopen in Spring!
summary: Changing the conversation about mental health and letting people know it's okay to need help!

name: Actuarial Science Club
description:
UCF's Actuarial Science Club is a resource for students looking to: 

- Learn more about the actuarial career and professional requirements under both the Society of Actuaries and Casualty Actuarial Society 


- Network and participate in recruitment aimed at helping students secure jobs and internships in the actuarial field


- Learn more about opportunities to build relevant skills by participating in conferences and case study challenges


- Connect with other actuarial students to build a community aimed at providing support and guidance

IMPORTANT: Our KnightConnect page is not updated often. To follow our most recent activity, please follow our Instagram page (@actuarial_science_club_ucf) and join our discord (https://discord.gg/QXRT29MhbU).
summary: To provide support and fellowship for students interested in pursuing a career in the field of actuarial science.

name: Advocates for Interactive Media
description:
Our full membership and club officers will work together to find events, workshops and
conferences that can help to give our club a leading edge on staying in touch with our
professionals in the industry of interactive entertainment. We will hold events throughout the
year to workshop and present ideas on how to expand and understand the reach of interactive
media in entertainment, therapy, education and everyday life. We will also spend time doing
community outreach teaching skills necessary to work within interactive media as volunteers in
our community and mentors to students at UCF during events and workshops. We also want to
provide the opportunity for our members to have the option to prepare and present their projects
at conventions we attend for interactive media, entertainment, and game design.
summary:
Preparing graduate students for professional
careers in interactive media through networking, self-education, and community outreach,
empowering students by attending conferences, facilitating workshops, and advancing the reach
of interactive media.

name: African Students Organization
description:
The African Students' Organization or ASO, is committed to promoting African culture to the UCF campus and surrounding community through dance, music, poetry and more. We also provide a voice for African students while supporting them in their educational endeavors. At meetings, we actively focus on having group discussions about issues facing Africans, both here in the diaspora and back in Africa.

We also hold many spectacular events throughout the year that are meant to educate our community about the various wonders of Africa. Many times, we will partner with other UCF organizations to jointly show the uniqueness of our respective cultures while unifying with others.

ASO always welcomes anyone who has an interest in learning more about Africa, and seeks to be an integral social, academic, and cultural part of the college experience of everyone at UCF.

ASO Goals:

(1) To unite African students studying at UCF 
(2) Create a medium for African students to socialize and interact
(3) To enrich the UCF and local communities through unique African events, programs, and other community-based activities.
(4) To provide networking opportunities for and with African students inside and outside the African community.
(5) To correctly inform UCF and the rest of the world about issues affecting Africa and combat any misinformation about African peoples and countries.
(6) To provide a forum for the discussion and debate of matters of special interest to African liberation development.
summary: ASO is committed to promoting African Awareness at UCF as well as in the Orlando community. We also strive to support any African students at UCF and educate the student body and faculty members about African history and culture.

name: After The Sect
description: Life after leaving a high-control group (aka a cult) can be difficult, and that's why we're here: to provide support for folks in any stage of the transition process. Discord Server: https://discord.gg/vPKUeTfgFG
summary: The mission of After The Sect is to provide safe spaces and resources for those affected by high-control groups (aka cults), whether religious, political, or otherwise.

summary: The mission of Akshara is to elevate Indian classical dance on a national scale by providing more competitive and performance opportunities. Its focus is on fostering excellence and cultural appreciation in Central Florida.

name: Alpha Delta Pi Sorority
description:
Originally called the Adelphean Society, Alpha Delta Pi is the first secret society for women in the world and forged the way for women in the fraternity system. We were founded on May 15, 1851 at Wesleyan Female College – the first college in the world chartered to grant degrees to women.

Founder Eugenia Tucker Fitzgerald was just sixteen years old when she left her family to attend Wesleyan College. At such a young age and during a time when it was rare for women to go to college, she recognized the importance of women coming together for personal development and improvement. She and her five closest friends founded the Adelphean Society. In 1909, she wrote a letter to our Alpha chapter in which she states, “Whatever I have done worth remembering, I know that the founding of our society is one of them.”

https://www.ucfadpi.com/
summary: Alpha Delta Pi was the first secret society for college women in the world. Established at Wesleyan College in Macon, Georgia, the first college chartered to grant degrees to women, we were originally named “The Adelphean Society”.

name: Alpha Epsilon Phi Sorority
description: Alpha Epsilon Phi is a national sorority dedicated to helping women become the best they can be. We promote individuality; encouraging each member to discover and develop the talents and abilities that make her unique.
summary: Alpha Epsilon Phi is a national sorority dedicated to helping women become the best they can be. We promote individuality; encouraging each member to discover and develop the talents and abilities that make her unique.

name: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.
description: To cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women in order to improve their social stature, to maintain a progressive interest in college life, and to be of service to all mankind.
summary: Founded January 15, 1908, Alpha Kappa Alpha continues to strive for service to all mankind.

name: alpha Kappa Delta Phi International Sorority, Inc.
description: The sisterhood of alpha Kappa Delta Phi provides women with a sense of belonging that nurtures life-long friendships, develops self-empowered leaders, and strengthens communities through our pillars of service, scholarship, sisterhood, leadership, and Asian-Awareness. Since 1999, alpha Kappa Delta Phi's national philanthropy is Breast Cancer Awareness with a goal to raise awareness, educate, and help fund breast cancer research. Through our united efforts to spread awareness year round and during the month of October, our sisters have donated over $1M to help those that have been impacted by this disease.
summary: alpha Kappa Delta Phi is the first, largest, and only international Asian-interest sorority with over 60+ chapters and 9,000 sisters located at numerous universities across the U.S. and Canada.

name: Alpha Kappa Psi - Nu Chi
description:
Alpha Kappa Psi is the oldest and largest professional co-ed business fraternity founded in 1904 at New York University. Open to all majors, we are dedicated to providing a diverse platform to enhance leadership skills, expand professional networks, and engage in meaningful personal and career development. 

Through a variety of activities such as workshops and networking events, we extend beyond professional development with active participation in community service and philanthropic initiatives. Alpha Kappa Psi has a prestigious alumni network comprised of successful professionals and entrepreneurs across various industries. In essence, Alpha Kappa Psi is more than a Fraternity—it is a vibrant community shaping future business leaders!
summary: The premier developer of principled business leaders, we are a co-ed organization that promotes the ethics of business to a diversified student population. We are open to all majors as we strive to build professional development for all!

name: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
description: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Incorporated was the first Black Greek Letter organization established for collegiate black men. It was founded by 7 young men on the prodominantly white campus of Cornell University in 1906. Open to men of all diversities, Alpha Phi Alpha has become a pillar worldwide with prominent members such as Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., Cornell West, Hill Harper Frederick Douglas, Olympian Jesse Owens, Duke Ellington, and many more.
summary: Founded on December 4, 1906 on the campus of Cornell University in Ithaca, NY, Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. prides itself in manly deeds, scholarship, and love for all mankind. UCF was graced with the presence of the fraternity on June 16, 1979.

name: Alpha Phi Sigma Criminal Justice Honor Society
description:
Alpha Phi Sigma recognizes the academic excellence of Undergraduate and Graduate Criminal Justice students. The Goals of Alpha Phi Sigma are to honor and promote academic excellence, community service, educational leadership, and unity. Alpha Phi Sigma is the only Criminal Justice Honor Society certified by The Association of College Honor Societies and affiliated with The Academy of Criminal Justice Sciences.

Baccalaureate students shall be enrolled at the time of application in the institution represented by the chapter, have declared a major, minor, or equivalent in criminal justice or a related field, have completed three full-time semesters or its equivalent, have a minimum GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale, with a minimum GPA of 3.2 in courses in criminal justice related fields and rank in the top 35% of their class. A minimum of four courses of the above coursework shall be in the criminal justice field.

Masters students shall be enrolled at the time of application in a Master’s program in the Criminal Justice field in the institution represented by the chapter, have completed four courses, and have a minimum GPA of 3.4 on a 4.0 scale. Up to three undergraduate courses in Criminal Justice may be used to satisfy the four-course requirement. These courses must equate to a 3.4 GPA or higher, and the cumulative undergraduate degree program GPA must be a 3.2 or higher. In addition, all master's level coursework must equate to a 3.4 GPA or higher at the institution in which the student is enrolled.

Doctoral students shall be enrolled at the time of application in a Ph.D. program in the Criminal Justice field in the institution represented by the chapter, have completed four courses, and have a minimum GPA of 3.6 on a 4.0 scale. Up to three master's courses in Criminal Justice may be used to satisfy the four-course requirement. These courses must equate to a 3.6 GPA or higher, and the cumulative Master’s degree program GPA must be a 3.4 or higher. In addition, all Ph.D. level coursework must equate to a 3.6 GPA or higher at the institution in which the student is enrolled.

Completed applications must be submitted to the chapter advisor for verification and signature. Applications are due by October 1 for Fall admission and Feb 1 for Spring admission.
summary: To recognize and promote high scholastic standards and integrity in the criminal justice profession, and to establish the benefits of scientific research and continuing education.

name: Alpha Sigma Kappa - Women and Gender Minorities in Technical Studies
description:
Mission

Alpha Sigma Kappa - Women in Technical Studies® is a unique social sorority for women and non-binary people pursuing technical majors. Our sorority is composed of women and NBs who emphasize strong sisterly bonds with one another but also place importance on academics.We accept women/NBs in Engineering, Architecture, Mathematics, and the Sciences. While women/NBs have an ever-growing presence in these fields, we remain a minority in collegiate and professional arenas which can prove challenging. As a sorority, we offer women/NBs the opportunity to develop leadership skills, friendships, a sense of belonging, and a network of support.

We encourage friendship - between you and your fellow sisters, fellowship - through shared interests, and commitment - to yourself, the organization, and your community. Support is essential while pursuing a degree in these technical fields because we all encounter the same challenges. A variety of activities is planned throughout the year for our members, including social, philanthropic, and scholastic events, to encourage a fun relaxed atmosphere without jeopardizing academics.

Goals

The purpose and goal of the Chapter to promote friendship, academic achievement, unity within the organization, women/NBs in technical fields, and philanthropy within the community.
summary: Alpha Sigma Kappa - Women in Technical Studies® is a unique social sorority for women and gender minorities pursuing technical majors.

name: Alpha Tau Omega Fraternity
description:
Alpha Tau Omega is UCF's premier social and leadership fraternity. Since the chapter's establishment in 1971, ΑΤΩ has been a power house on Greek Park. The gentlemen of ΑΤΩ pride themselves in academics, intramural sports, campus involvement and sociability. This diverse group of young leaders pushes the limits every year with record-setting philanthropic events, Greek social events and innovative ways to improve the university and local community.

Located at 4419 Greek Ct., Alpha Tau Omega is currently the largest fraternity house on campus. For more information about the chapter, email ato@ucf.edu.
summary: Alpha Tau Omega is UCF's premier social and leadership fraternity. Since the chapter's establishment in 1971, ΑΤΩ has been a power house on Greek Park. The gentlemen of ΑΤΩ pride themselves in academics, intramural sports and sociability.

name: Alpha Xi Delta Womens Fraternity
summary: Alpha Xi Delta is a social organization. This women's Fraternity's motto is "Inspiring Women to Realize Their Potential." The sisters of Alpha Xi Delta pride themselves on inspiring each other to achieve their goals.

name: Amateur Radio Club at UCF
description:
The Amateur Radio Club at UCF strives to create an environment where anyone can learn the many aspects of amateur radio. Whether that will be in electronics (including AC and DC circuitry), communications, or even using the radio, we have room for anyone wanting to explore these interests and broaden their horizons in the art of amateur radio.

Our Linktree, which contains links to our Discord, wiki, and other resources: https://linktr.ee/k4ucf

If you use your @ucf.edu address when emailing us, you will get a faster response.
summary: The club strives to teach and advance the radio art, and to expand the existing reservoir within the amateur radio community of trained operators, technicians, and electronics specialists and hobbyists.

name: American Chemical Society
description:
ACS at UCF provides a wide range of professional and academic development activities for our members.  We regularly host speakers on a wide array of chemistry-related topics, including professors and industry spokespeople.  We help our members connect with research mentors, and provide tutoring for academic success.  We also host fun chemistry events, such as various experiments and ACS educational programs.

ACS at UCF also coordinates many volunteering opportunities for our members.  From running science experiments in the local community, to hosting booths for STEM day, to volunteering at the Orlando Science Center, we are always ready to help.  Our club prioritizes community outreach, and we have lots of opportunities for our members to volunteer.

Interested in joining?  Visit acsatucf.com to see when our meeting times are for this semester or send us an email at president.acsucf@gmail.com.

Meetings are held: Monday @5:00 PM in PSB 160

Our Current Officers:

President: Arianna Guemarez
Vice-President: Emilina Schmidt
Secretary: Myrah Bracero
Treasurer: Matthew Hiciano
Event Coordinator: Sobirjon Sharipov
Outreach Coordinator: Malia Jeukeng
summary: ACS at UCF is a student branch of the American Chemical Society.  We provide professional development, community outreach, and a tight-knit community for our members, whether they are chemistry majors or just really enjoy chemistry.

name: American College of Healthcare Executives at UCF
description: The mission of the American College of Healthcare Executives at UCF is to support students to achieve their professional goals related to Healthcare Executive positions and being the official intermediaries between ACHE nationwide and UCF. ACHE is a national organization with multiple independent chapters in each state and subsequent region. Our nearest chapter is the Central Florida chapter. You can be a part of this chapter as a student associate, and this is open to all students from different universities in the surrounding areas. However, as a UCF student, you have exclusive access to ACHE at UCF which supplements the diverse benefits you get as a student associate. As a UCF student, you can leverage dual membership to experience additional events and opportunities in addition to ACHE Student Associate membership.
summary: ACHE-UCF focuses on supporting future healthcare leaders within the UCF campus to achieve their professional goals related to healthcare executive positions and being the official liaison between ACHE and UCF.

name: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics
description:
Bridging the gap between students and the aerospace industry through projects, tours, workshops, events, and more! Join our Discord for updates and connect with members! https://discord.gg/phUHGKvG

 

We are the UCF student-chapter of the world's foremost technical society dedicated to the aerospace profession, AIAA.

 

Our student section is one of the largest registered student organizations (RSOs) on campus and the largest chapter of AIAA in the nation. We are primarily comprised of students majoring in Aerospace, Mechanical, and Electrical Engineering alongside Computer Science, but we welcome any interested students at UCF.

 

AIAA UCF's main activities include general body meetings, hands-on projects, social activities, community STEM outreach, tours, workshops, and guest speaker events. While our projects each have their own timelines, AIAA UCF holds at least one general body meeting a month; to keep with tradition, usually on the first Thursday of the month.

 

In 2025-2026 we continue to showcase our repeating projects of Rocket Design, Quadcopters, Hovercrafts, Aviation Vehicle Design (AVD), and Design Build Fly (DBF), along with two new experimental projects: VTOL and our very own high-powered rocketry project (Project Horizon). These projects all begin after our first general body meeting the first Thursday of September so be sure to show up for project presentations and an introduction to the club with free pizza.

 

More information about AIAA UCF and paying yearly dues can be found on our website!

For current members and interested students, please join our Discord Server for all updates!
summary:
Bridging the gap between students and the aerospace industry through projects, tours, workshops, events, and more! Join our Discord for updates and connect with members! <https://discord.gg/CTc2RtCn>

Must be a dues paying member to join KnightConnect!

name: American Lung Cancer Screening Initiative
summary: The mission of The American Lung Cancer Screening Initiative is to promote awareness for lung cancer screening for individuals at high-risk of developing lung cancer at The University of Central Florida and the larger local community through education.

name: American Marketing Association at UCF
description:
Welcome to The American Marketing Association at the University of Central Florida page!

 

Our members will not just be standing in the back and blending in the crowd.  The organization encourages everyone - of all and any majors -  to engage and interact with others, learn from business professionals through our interactive events, professional workshops, and network with others to share knowledge and further advance their career endeavors.

 

How do I join?

To become a member, please follow the steps on our site amaucf.org!

Then, fill out the membership form in our LinkTree!

Join our Mailing List!

Be the first to know when we are on campus by joining here!
summary: The American Marketing Association at UCF is the largest Marketing organization on campus with over 200 members. AMA strives to develop each students' personal brand and professional network so that, together, we can be Greater Than Ever Before!

name: American Medical Women's Association
description:
The American Medical Women’s Association aims to foster an enriching environment for women in science and the medical profession. We hope to create a supportive and collaborative community for all women pursuing careers in the health professions through events such as clinical skills workshops, resume building events, and hearing from inspiring female professionals.

 

Follow our Instagram for all updated information @amwaucf
summary: AMWA seeks to advance women in medicine and improve women's health. We achieve this by providing and developing leadership, advocacy, education, expertise, mentoring, and strategic alliances.

name: American Physical Society Chapter at University of Central Florida
description:
The mission and goals of the American Physical Society Chapter at University of Central Florida are similar to the mission and goals outlined by APS:

APS Chapters seek to support the development of undergraduates, graduate students and early-career individuals as colleagues and future leaders. To achieve these goals and build cohesive communities that will strengthen the discipline, we will:

  • Develop opportunities for networking and for career and professional development
  • Empower individuals to build and promote inclusive and equitable communities
  • Support learning and practice for all, including those from underrepresented groups
  • Inform and facilitate engagement on policy issues impacting the profession
summary: APS@UCF seeks to support the development of graduate students and early-career individuals as colleagues and future leaders.

name: American Red Cross Club
description:
To be a member of our club, you must use THIS LINK  to create an account with Red Cross, thus becoming a member of our club. Please follow our Instagram for updates: @ucf_redcrossclub
 

The American Red Cross Club at the University of Central Florida is a service-based club that encourages students to take part in charitable work by supporting the mission and lines of service of the American Red Cross.

The ARCC@UCF provides young professionals with meaningful opportunities for education, training, and volunteer/community service. ARCC@UCF volunteers can remain a part of the Red Cross family throughout their lives, learn new skills, and network with service-oriented individuals.
summary: The American Red Cross Club at the University of Central Florida is a service-based club that encourages students to take part in charitable volunteer work by supporting the mission and lines of service of the American Red Cross.

name: American Sign Language Club
description:
[To create a place for all students and those who seek knowledge and want to raise awareness of American Sign language, the Deaf Community, and Deaf Culture.]

An exciting place to make new friends and practice American Sign Language and learn about Deaf Culture. we welcome beginner and advanced signers alike! Whether you are just learning your ABC's, or are a seasoned signer, we welcome YOU.

The ASL Club mission is to create a place for all students, of all ages. We strive to create an exciting and fun environment where all people feel welcome, included, and important. We welcome hearing and Deaf alike, regardless of the person's level of competency in ASL. Our desire is not only to make a place for people to interact and make friends, but to shed light on, and raise awareness of Deaf Culture in our world today. We do this through the events we organize each year, which aid in connecting and unifying the hearing and Deaf communities.

For more information concerning everything we are about, visit our Instagram page: @ASLKnights

We look forward to learning with you, and creating exciting, enriching and unforgettable memories at the ASL Club @ UCF.

GO ASL KNIGHTS!

Past Guest appearances: 
- Deaf Actor Ryan Lane from "Switched at Birth"
- Deaf Comedian Richard Dahan
- Deaf Actress Marlee Matlin
- Deaf Actor, Winner of Dancing with the Stars and Americas next top model, Nyle DiMarco

Past Events: 
- Trip to Gallaudet University
- Trip to FSDB 
- FSDB Dance Troupe @ UCF

 

Join our discord to stay updated with the club at https://discord.gg/APawPwau
summary: An exciting place to make new friends and learn about American Sign Language and Deaf Culture. We welcome beginner and advanced signers alike! Whether you are just learning your ABC's, or are a seasoned signer, we welcome YOU!

name: American Society of Civil Engineers at the University of Central Florida
description:
ASCE UCF offers civil engineering students activities ranging from tailgates and social events to networking, resume building, and career advancement opportunities. Our general meetings include invited professional speakers who talk about their experience in the industry and often discuss available internships and jobs within their companies. Every year we attend the Annual Southeast Student Symposium, where we compete in over 16 competitions across all civil engineering disciplines! It is a great opportunity to gain some hands-on experience while getting to compete against other schools! Feel free to contact us at asce.ucf@gmail.com if you have any questions!

Please visit our website for all our information!

Join our free, No-Credit Webcourses class

*ASCE UCF does not use Knight's Connect as a primary mode of communication, please use our discord to interact with the club*

Become a member now!
summary: An organization that aims to promote professionalism, leadership and hands-on learning for civil, environmental, or construction engineering students. Follow us on Instagram @asceucf and Join our Discord https://discord.gg/s4S4U33Y to stay up to date!

name: American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers
description:
ASHRAE at the University of Central Florida is a student run organization with the purpose to help students get involved in the industry of the Built Environment. Engaging students in learning sustainable building, energy, and mechanical design. ASHRAE at UCF hopes to give students a competitive advantage when they graduate from college as it is directly connected to ASHRAE Central Florida Chapter as well as chapters all over the country and in other parts of the world. In college meetings, educational presentations are given about different areas of the industry such as: Energy Modeling, Energy Audits and management, Building Commissioning, and MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) Design. Student members also participate in tours of mechanical systems at UCF and in various establishments around Orlando (i.e. the Orange County Convention Center). ASHRAE at UCF is also invited to the local professional chapter's dinner meetings and networking events where students can network with local industry for great internship and work opportunities. Additionally, the student chapter has continuously attended ASHRAE's Winter Conference held every year in different parts of the country (Las Vegas, Chicago, New York City,...etc).

Senior standing mechanical engineering students have the opportunity to participate in the annual ASHRAE competition through UCF's senior design projects sponsored by ASHRAE.
summary: To advance the art and sciences of energy efficient building design to serve humanity and promote a sustainable world.

name: American Society of Highway Engineers
description:
Our Mission

To provide a forum for UCF student members interested in the highway industry

that supports education, innovation, and fellowship; promoting a safe and efficient

highway system for mobility now and in the future.
summary: To provide a forum for members and partners of the highway industry that supports education, innovation, and fellowship; promoting a safe and efficient highway system.

name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
description:
To become a member click here and to contact the officer team send an email to ucfasme@gmail.com

We are the American Society of Mechanical Engineers student chapter at the University of Central Florida. ASME is a national non-profit organization that enables skill development and career enrichment across all engineering disciplines. We encourage all majors to join and get involved!

As a student organization at UCF, ASME helps students develop their professional and technical skills by offering access to a wide range of activities such as projects, workshops, socials, tours, panels, and more! If you would like to get involved and learn more about ASME, come out to the next General Body Meeting where all upcoming events and information about the club is announced!

 

For more information and membership sign ups please visit our website!

http://www.asmeatucf.com/ 

 

Join our Discord to keep up to date with announcements and interact with the community!

Discord

 

Follow us on social media to hear about upcoming events and meetings!

Instagram
summary: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers student chapter at the University of Central Florida. ASME is a national non-profit organization that enables skill development and career enrichment across all engineering disciplines.

name: American Statistical Association at UCF
description: AmStat@UCF, a chapter of the American Statistical Association, provides a big tent for statistics within the University of Central Florida, forming a community of statisticians, data scientists, actuaries, and all who love statistics! Our chapter teaches members fundamental data science skills through workshops and gives opportunities to apply these skills with projects! Alongside having keynote speakers at our general body meetings and social events where our members can connect with other students, we aspire to make every member of our club better prepared for their careers, whether they go to graduate school or directly into industry or government.
summary: A club for all things statistics, data science, and actuarial science. Through workshops, projects, and other events, learn crucial statistics and data science skills within a space for all practitioners of statistics to socialize and collaborate!

name: American Vacuum Society at UCF
summary: As an interdisciplinary, professional Society, AVS supports networking among academic, industrial, government, and consulting professionals involved in a variety of disciplines - chemistry, physics, biology, mathematics, all engineering disciplines, etc.

name: AmeriCorps VISTA at UCF
description: AmeriCorps VISTA members are passionate and committed to their mission to bring individuals and communities out of poverty. Members make a year-long, full-time commitment to serve on a specific project at a nonprofit organization or public agency. They focus their efforts to build the organizational, administrative, and financial capacity of organizations that fight illiteracy, improve health services, foster economic development, and otherwise assist low-income communities.  Where will you do your year of service?
summary: meriCorps VISTA members are passionate and committed to their mission to bring individuals and communities out of poverty. Members make a year-long, full-time commitment to serve on a specific project at a nonprofit organization or public agency.

name: Animation Production Club
description:
Welcome to the Animation Production Club! We are a community of enterprising animators dedicated to creating animated films. Our goals include:

1. Build a community of like-minded artists and creators.

2. Provide hands-on experience in the animation pipeline.

3. Support the creation of independent projects to build your portfolio!

Anyone is welcome to join, regardless of major or experience. Come prepared to work as a team, and be ready to draw!
summary: Our club is dedicated to animation students and passionate enthusiasts to come together and produce animated short films!

name: Anime Spot
description:
This is the KnightConnect page for Anime Spot, the anime club at the University of Central Florida!

We are one of the largest and longest-running Registered Student Organizations located at UCF! Here at Anime Spot, we hold a variety of events ranging from themed anime viewings to activity nights. We also host our own annual Cosplay Knights events, Day of Cosplay! Whether you are looking to find your next show to watch, make new friends, or just share your love for art and cosplay, we offer something for everyone.

Our goal is not to just be another anime club, but to be a central hub for all anime and manga fans at UCF. We hope to see you at our next meeting!

 

Current Officers

President: Daley Eisenmann

Vice President: Sara Wise

Secretary: Alondra Quezada

Treasurer: Lorenzo Trocio

Marketing: Kiera Friedman

Cosplay Knights Director: Seth Malcolm

Cosplay Knights Vice Director: Vic Schneider

 

Our most active platform is our Discord server; join to meet other anime fans at UCF!

A-Spot Discord Server (Students/Alumni)


Follow us on Instagram for announcements and up-to-date information on our events!

A-Spot Instagram
summary:
We are Anime Spot, the anime club at the University of Central Florida!

We are a highly active club at the University of Central Florida that has been around since 2006. We host weekly themed anime viewings and other fun events!

name: Antioch Orlando College Ministry
description:
We are an on-campus college ministry which is a part of our local church, Antioch Community Church Orlando.
 
Our desire is to see college students transformed through knowing Jesus, being plugged into the local church, and impacting our city and the nations with the Gospel.
 
We meet weekly in what we call “Lifegroups” to connect, share how God is moving in our lives, encourage and pray for one another, spend time in worship, and have biblical discussions. Our Lifegroups meet different evenings of the week both on and off campus so there should be a good fit for anyone's schedule!
 
We also meet weekly with the rest of our church on Sunday mornings at 10:30am.
 
For more information on where we meet, what we believe and upcoming mission trips please check out our website:
AntiochOrlando.com
summary: Antioch Orlando College Ministry exists to transform lives and mobilize passionate followers of Jesus to make disciples in all nations with the gospel.

name: Apollo Community
description: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.

name: Arab American Student Association
description: Our club was founded with a main mission: to build a vibrant community for all Arab Americans at UCF, fostering empathy, understanding, and cultural awareness through active engagement and outreach throughout campus. AASA provides a platform for students to connect with their heritage, share their experiences, and educate the community about Arab culture and traditions. By encouraging dialogue and collaboration, AASA strives to bridge cultural gaps and build a more inclusive campus environment.
summary: Building a community for all Arab Americans here at UCF, and for those interested in learning more about the Arab culture.

name: Arboretum Beekeepers
summary: Maintaining the apiary under the supervision of our resident beekeeper. Members will get the opportunity to learn more about beekeeping and pollinators, and have hands-on experience with beekeeping and hive maintenance.

name: Argentinian Student Association
description: The goals of ARSA are to spread Argentinian culture among the  UCF community by hosting different events, and workshops with educational purposes. Moreover, we'll provide any available resources for Argentinian Students that need them. We want to create a community where everyone can be part of and where we can share the different traditions the Argentinian Culture has. Our mission is to create a community that promotes and celebrates Argentinian culture among the UCF community with Argentinian Students. Also, helping recently arrived Argentinian students with the adaptation process to a new country.
summary: Promote the Argentinian culture among UCF students and create a space where Argentinian students can keep with their traditions

name: Armwrestling at UCF
description:
Arm wrestling club located at University of Central Florida! Stay updated through our discord and instagram page for upcoming events/meetings. 

https://linktr.ee/armwrestlingatucf
summary: The mission of Armwrestling at UCF is to educate students about the growing, diverse and inclusive sport of armwrestling, and to help them to find opportunities and connections within the sport.

name: Army Reserve Officer Training Corps
description: Our program consists of members who come from a wide range of career fields while sharing the same overarching goal of developing Cadets and enabling them to reach their fullest potential. As a UCF Army ROTC Cadet, you will be given great experiences to build and develop lasting friendships, pushing yourself to overcome many different obstacles, and most importantly learning the skills necessary to lead and inspire others around you.
summary: UCF Army ROTC is dedicated to educating, developing, inspiring, and recruiting aspiring Cadets. We provide leadership, career progression, and interpersonal tact in a developmental environment. Our mission is to produce US Army Commissioned Officers.

name: Arnold Air Society
description: Arnold Air Society is a professional, honorary service organization advocating the support of aerospace power. We are dedicated to creating proactive, knowledgeable, and effective civic leaders through community service and education about national defense. It is made up largely of civilians and Air Force ROTC cadets interested in personal development, leadership, service, and support of our military personnel
summary: To work together to develop future leaders through community service, professional development, and education about our national defense.

name: Art Club
description:
This organization's goal is to provide an outlet for creative expression, establish an artistic community, and further development of our members abilities toward expressing themselves through visual imagery. We hope to bring many artists and admirers together for a common interest of the love for art in which they can  learn new skills, share their work, develop connections, improve their creative abilities and have a great time in our open and supportive community.

Announcements for our events are listed on our Discord below:

Art Club Server

Art Club Carrd
summary: The mission of Art Club is to provide an outlet for expression and creativity using art mediums in order to find common ground and develop artistic skills as a community.

name: Art History Club
description:
A club founded back in 2010 to encourage love of the arts through education and outreach! We want to create a space for students of all majors to share their passion and make new friends. Everyone is welcome! 

For more information, check out our Instagram at @arthistoryclubatucf or join our Discord groupchat, found in our Linktree. We hope to see you there!

Fall 2025: Thursday 5 pm - 7 pm
summary: Student-run organization formed back in 2010.

name: Artificial Intelligence Club
description:
AI@UCF offers a plethora of resources to help UCF students pursue interests in artificial intelligence, data science, and machine learning. We host introductory-level general body meetings, research paper discussions, and some project teams anyone can join to get hands-on experience. Anyone can join! No prior knowledge necessary. 

Our community Discord server is the central hub for all of our communications. Click the link below to stay updated and connect with our members! Thank you :)

JOIN HERE: https://ucfai.org/discord
summary: Fostering a hotspot for researchers and engineers passionate about computational intelligence and data science at UCF.

name: Asian Pacific American Coalition
description: The Asian Pacific American Coalition (APAC) was founded in 2005 to be a source of social and political advocacy concerning Asian Americans. Since then, it has worked tirelessly to help the Asian and Asian/Pacific Islander American community at the University of Central Florida. It is open to all UCF students, and not just those of Asian race. The main goals of APAC are to develop diversity and awareness concerning Asian and Asian Americans, create dedicated, educated, and well rounded members who will use their talents to benefit the greater community, create and participate in community service activities, and be a source of social and political advocacy. The way through which APAC achieves these goals are through a variety of leadership programs and worships, general body meetings, showcase events, and a strong membership body.
summary: The mission of the Asian Pacific American Coalition at UCF is to develop leadership, to be a source of political and social advocacy for issues facing Asian Americans, and to promote unity and a voice for the campus and community at UCF.

name: Asian Pre-Health Organization
description:
The mission of Asian Pre-health Organization is to create a united supportive community for Asian students pursuing careers in health professions, fostering networking, professional development, and cultural enrichment in the shared pursuit towards the common goal of attaining a career in the health field. We achieve this by abiding to The Three Principles of The Asian Pre-Health Organization:

  1. The First Principle is Unity. We strive to unite the diverse student body by fostering a friendly, supportive community that will cooperate through shared culture and comradery towards the common goal of attaining a career in the health field. We are Asian focused but also nonexclusive so anyone of any background can join.
  2. The Second Principle is Academics. We are dedicated to helping our members achieve academic success in the pursuit of achieving their career goals. This is achieved through weekly group study sessions, informational GBMs, guest speakers, workshops, and mentorship programs.
  3. The Third Principle is Service. We are committed to serving our members and the community. With every meeting, attendees will have learned or gained something from attending. Furthermore, opportunities to serve through volunteering or working in either the medical field or the community will be provided to our members.

Our goal is to help you no matter what career goals you may have or what your background may be. We value your time and promise that you will never leave an APO meeting emptyhanded. You will always either learn something, make friends, or secure opportunities from APO so please consider joining and look out for our next event on our Instagram @apo.ucf
summary: The mission of Asian Pre-health Organization is to create a supportive community for Asian students pursuing careers in health professions, fostering networking, professional development, and cultural enrichment.
categoryNames: ['Health Professions and Sciences', 'Medicine', 'Nursing', 'Sciences', 'Service', 'Medical Service', 'APIDA (Asian Pacific Islander Desi American)']

name: Asian Student Association
description:
The Asian Student Association, founded in 1998, is a non-profit organization at the University of Central Florida. We are here to provide a social and academic support network for the Asian American community at UCF. Our mission is to spread awareness of the cultures that make up this fast growing demographic and promote diversity throughout our organization, the UCF student body and faculty, and the surrounding community. The Asian Student Association serves its members by providing social and agenda based meetings while planning events during the year to accomplish its goal of bringing about cultural-awareness.

name: Aspect Dance Team
description: Aspect Dance Team is a group dedicated to covering choreography from popular Korean media. Members will gain proficiency in all aspects of a dance production by performing live and uploading filmed and edited dances to various social media platforms. Members will also get the unique opportunity to coordinate stage costumes with their peers to contribute to the visual aspect of the choreography. Participants will also gain skills relating to teamwork and sportsmanship by collaborating with their peers in practices and performances.
summary: Aspect Dance Team is a dance cover group for people with an interest in dances from popular Korean media. The group will focus on showcasing practiced covers either in live performances or edited videos posted to our social media platforms.

name: Association for Computing Machinery
description:
Official Computer / Programming club at UCF

Join our Discord: http://ucf.acm.org/discord

Check out our linktr.ee!

The student chapter of an international organization focused on advancing the education and research in the field of Computer Science and Computer Engineering.

Join the premiere organization in computing to gain leadership experience, participate in projects, network with other developers, professionals and start building your resume.
summary: ACM  is an international scientific and educational organization advancing computer science, computer engineering, and IT. The on-campus chapter offers events ranging from tutorials on programming topics to technical interview workshops and more

name: Association for Computing Machinery Special Interest Group on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques
description:
We are the UCF Chapter of ACM SIGGRAPH which stands for Association for Computing Machinery's Special Interest Group on Computer Graphics.  We are a group of digital artists, programmers and everything in-between that want to help our members in their digital careers whether it be VFX, game development, 2D/3D animation, and anything else by providing mentorship and creating relationships.

ACM SIGGRAPH is dedicated to the generation and dissemination of information on computer graphics and interactive techniques. We are a membership organization that values passion, integrity, excellence, volunteerism, and cross-­disciplinary interaction in all of our activities.
summary: ACM SIGGRAPH brings together students seeking a career in animation and VFX to help bridge the gap between student life and the professional world while offering fun networking events and professional development workshops.

name: Association of Environmental Professionals at the University of Central Florida
description:
The mission of the Association of Environmental Professionals at the University of Central Florida is to encourage members in the pursuit of environmentally related careers and to foster personal and professional development.

Goals

The goals are to provide an opportunity for members to become better informed on environmental issues of local interest and to provide a forum for encouraging and recognizing innovative, creative projects that address environmental concerns.  Goals also include the development of professional, networking relationships with other disciplines and professionals, including biology, planning, geology, engineering, landscape architecture, etc.

 

Join our discord: https://discord.gg/M8nebxhXyr

Follow us on Instagram: aep.ucf

name: Association of Latino Professionals For America
description:
At ALPFA UCF, success isn't just a goal; it's a reality we cultivate for our members. With a track record of guiding students toward their career aspirations and seamlessly integrating them into prestigious Fortune 500 firms, ALPFA UCF stands as a beacon of achievement and opportunity.

What sets us apart? We boast the distinction of being one of the largest, most diverse, and incredibly successful ALPFA student chapters nationwide. Our success is not by chance but by design, fueled by the unwavering mentality and work ethic of our exceptional members. As we champion each member's journey, our corporate partners play a pivotal role in fostering an environment of continuous growth.

Imagine being part of a network that spans over 72,000 members nationally. ALPFA's reach goes beyond the campus, connecting you to a vast pool of opportunities and like-minded individuals passionate about success in the world of finance and business.

We take pride in being more than a student organization; we are a community that thrives on collaboration, diversity, and collective achievement. Our members don't just join ALPFA; they join a family committed to empowering each other and making a lasting impact in their chosen fields.

Visit our social media pages below to catch a glimpse of the ALPFA UCF experience or explore our website for a comprehensive view of how we can elevate your academic and professional pursuits.

🌐 [ALPFA UCF Website]
📷 [Instagram]
👥 [LinkedIn]

Join ALPFA UCF and unlock the doors to a world of possibilities, mentorship, and success. Your journey to excellence starts here.
summary: The Association of Latino Professionals For America at the University of Central Florida (ALPFA UCF) is a professional development organization that seeks to build and grow the next generation of leaders and professionals.

name: Association of Pre-Certified Anesthesiologist Assistants
description: The mission of the Association of Pre-Certified Anesthesiologist Assistants is to elevate awareness of the vital yet often underrepresented Certified Anesthesiologist Assistant (CAA) profession. We are dedicated to guiding and inspiring future CAAs by providing comprehensive resources, mentorship, and support to help them grow into highly qualified and well-prepared candidates for CAA programs, ultimately contributing to the advancement of healthcare and patient care excellence.
summary: The mission of the Association of Pre-Certified Anesthesiologist Assistants is to elevate awareness of an unexplored yet much-needed CAA profession while developing prospective students into excellent and fit candidates for CAA programs.

name: Association of Pre-Nursing Students
description: The mission of the College of Nursing at the University of Central Florida is to offer high-quality undergraduate and graduate academic programs designed to prepare nurses to practice in a continuously changing healthcare environment; to provide innovative access to education and research; to develop nurse clinicians, leaders and scholars who promote the health of diverse populations in local, national and global communities; and to touch lives, lead by example and make a difference through clinical excellence, research and community service.
summary: APNS has the goal to educate undergraduate students in the nursing-pending major track on the UCF Nursing program and how to best prepare to apply, enter the program and nursing field in general.  Members are also involved in service projects.

name: Association of Pre-Physician Assistants
description:
Association of Pre Physician Associates (APPA) at the University of Central Florida is a student led organization focused on supporting and guiding aspiring Physician Associates as they complete undergraduate and graduate prerequisites. APPA fosters a collaborative environment where students grow academically, professionally, and personally while preparing for PA program admission.

This organization provides access to essential resources such as guest speakers, including certified Physician Associates (PA-Cs) and current PA students, academic advising, informational workshops, and PA program profiles. Members also participate in service initiatives, fundraising, and volunteer opportunities to strengthen community engagement and professional development. In addition, APPA hosts fun social events throughout the year to help members unwind, build friendships, and enjoy being part of a supportive pre PA community.

No matter your stage in the pre PA journey, whether you are curious about the PA profession or preparing for the GRE and applications, there is a place for you in APPA. Students interested in pursuing the PA profession are encouraged to join this network of motivated peers. Stay connected and updated on upcoming events by following us on Instagram: @appa_ucf.
summary: The mission of the Association of Pre-Physician Associates is to promote the underrepresented PA profession as well as to shape well-rounded students and assist them in becoming exceptional candidates for acceptance into a PA Program.

name: Astronomy Society
description:
*PLEASE NOTE: We do not use Knight Connect for connecting with members because the website isn't easy to use. Click here to join our Discord

The Astronomy Society is a registered student organization at the University of Central Florida, based out of the Department of Physics. Our organization is dedicated to fostering a deep appreciation for the mysteries of the cosmos while also providing valuable opportunities for students aspiring to take on leadership roles and build careers in astronomy.
summary: Our organization is dedicated to fostering a deep appreciation for the mysteries of the cosmos while also providing valuable opportunities for students aspiring to take on leadership roles and build careers in astronomy.

name: Audio Engineering Society
description:
To provide a community for individuals interested in sound, music, engineering etc. regardless of their major or interest.

For more information about meeting times and club activities, join our Discord.

https://discord.gg/Dwe4dDnBnf
summary: Audio Engineering is the one stop shop for all things related to audio, acoustic, sound, music, regardless of your major or interest.

name: Autism in Motion
description: AIM’s philosophy is to create a supportive environment where kids with autism have opportunities to take part in team sports and make meaningful connections with college coaches. AIM aims to create an inclusive atmosphere for kids to learn and play sports they may never have had the opportunity to experience before.
summary: The mission of AIM is to promote sports involvement as well as physical activity for children with autism and autism-related disorders while also providing mentorship and team-building opportunities.

name: AutoCAD Civil and Design Club
summary: The mission of AutoCAD & Civil Design Club is to equip students with AutoCAD skills through hands-on training, mentorship, and industry connections, bridging the gap between academic and real-world applications in engineering, architecture, and design.

name: Bachelors of Social Work Student Association
description:
The Bachelors of Social Work Student Association (BSWSA) is an organization that links undergraduate social work students to their community and peers to better enrich their educational experience at the University of Central Florida.
BSWSA members benefit from service learning projects, workshops, guest speakers and a community of friendly, like-minded individuals that will one day make up the profession of social work. 


The BSWSA encourages any student interested in social service, community resources, and social justice to join us. Follow us on Instagram at @bswsa.ucf
summary: The Bachelors of Social Work Student Association promotes the field of social work by enhancing the lives of individuals, families, and communities through community service and social interactions.

name: Badminton Club @ UCF
description:
Badminton Club is dedicated to students who either have a continuing interest in badminton or would like to unwind by trying a new sport. The club is open to anyone. Students who wish to come are free to play the sport with friends on their own or may ask any of the club board members for instructions and tips regarding the game. There is no need to worry about lack of ability; the students who have come to these meetings vary greatly in technical skill. We have all the equipment members need to play. 

Please follow us on instagram “badminton_ucf” for practices date and time. We also post announcements on upcoming tournaments and activities.
summary: Badminton Club is dedicated to students who either have a continuing interest in badminton or would like to  try a new sport. The club is open to anyone and encourage any new players to come try it out! We have all the equipment you will need.

name: Baja International
description:
Baja International focuses on developing the best professionals for engineering-related industries through a large-scale project that incorporates all aspects of engineering, business, and project management.

The mission of Knights Racing Baja SAE is to represent UCF through participation in Baja SAE's collegiate design series competitions and to provide UCF students with hands-on engineering experience and the opportunity to apply their theoretical knowledge.

While we compete in competitions hosted by the Society of Automotive Engineers, we are not exclusive to engineering majors. UCF students of all majors, regardless of background, are welcome and invited to join Baja.
summary: Each year, UCF Baja designs, builds, and competes a prototype off-road vehicle against over 100 different universities from across the world in the US Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE) Collegiate Design Series Competitions.

name: Ballroom Knights
description:
Ballroom Knights is a dance organization at UCF that aims to share the experience of ballroom dance. We welcome people from all levels to come together and simply enjoy dancing! No prior experience or partner necessary! Our classes and socials are free to all UCF students, where we teach and dance various styles such as Cha Cha and Waltz. We offer opportunities to dance in the Orlando community with organizations like USA Dance. Additionally, we offer a novice performance team and competitive opportunities. Follow us on Instagram or join our Discord server to stay updated!

Discord Link: https://discord.gg/BEfh98
summary: Ballroom Knights is a free ballroom dance club! We provide a space for everyone to start or continue their dance journey through ballroom dance. We provide free beginner lessons, social opportunities, a novice performance team, and a competition team!
