name: Bangladeshi Student Association
description: The Bangladeshi Student Association at the University of Central Florida enables Bangladeshi/Bengali students to celebrate their language, traditions, and holidays, as well as creating a safe space to discuss the country's history.
summary: Bangladeshi Student Association at the University of Central Florida strives to create a community of culture for Bengali/Bangladeshi students.

name: BAPS Campus Fellowship
description: The purpose of the organization shall be to unite students on University of Central Florida’s campus and provide opportunities to learn about Hindu heritage and culture. It will introduce the Hindu faith to the rest of the University of Central Florida community and will foster issues affecting Hindus through youth group discussions, campus events, and community service projects.
summary: The purpose of the organization shall be to unite students on the University of Central Florida’s campus and provide opportunities to learn about Hindu heritage and culture.

name: Baptist Collegiate Ministries
description:
BCM (Baptist Collegiate Ministries) is a Christian community at UCF with the Gospel as our center and scripture as our guide. Our mission is to bring in, build up, and send out students by showing them the joy of a life dedicated to knowing Jesus.

While BCM does stand for Baptist Collegiate Ministries, we are not exclusively Baptist. We receive support from the Florida Baptist Convention and Baptist churches. Any one and everyone is welcome no matter their background!

 

To best keep up with BCM, be sure to check out our website ucfbcm.com or follow us on Instagram at @ucfbcm!
summary: BCM is a Christian community at UCF with the Gospel as our center and scripture as our guide. Our mission is to bring in, build up, and send out students by showing them the joy of a life dedicated to knowing Jesus.

name: Baseball Club @ UCF
description: We are a student-ran organization in which students get to continue their passion for the game of baseball. We have created a fun and competitive environment that competes in the National Club Baseball Association (NCBA). We currently play against some of the top club talent in the country. Conference play consists of other universities such as University of Florida, FSU, University of Miami, USF, FGCU, Embry-Riddle, Stetson, and University of Tampa. We also play against non-conference opponents during the spring season as well like University of South Carolina and University of Alabama. If interested in being a member, a part of our media crew, or want more information, please reach out to us at clubbaseballucf@gmail.com.
summary: We are a student-ran organization in which offers students the opportunity to continue to play baseball. We currently compete in the National Club Baseball Association at the DI and DII levels. If interested, please email us at clubbaseballucf@gmail.com.

name: Basketball Club at UCF
description:
The Basketball Club @ UCF helps:

To build relationships and connect with students that love the game of basketball.

To develop a student’s skills as a basketball player.

To develop a student’s coaching abilities through basketball.

To continue a student’s passion to compete in the game of basketball.

Please click the 'World' icon below to be redirected to our Sport Clubs page on IMLeagues.
summary:
The Basketball Club at UCF is for anyone who is interested in basketball!
Competitive teams travel to play other university teams inside and outside of Florida.

Follow us on Instagram to stay up to date: basketballclubucf

name: Beach Volleyball Club @ UCF
summary: The mission of UCF Beach Volleyball Club is to foster excellence, camaraderie, and personal growth, our college beach volleyball club is dedicated to empowering student-athletes through skill development, teamwork, and a shared passion for the sport.

name: Bengali Student Association
summary: Bengali Student Association's goal is to celebrate the traditions and history of ethnically Bengali-American students through workshops, advocacy events, and cultural celebrations. Everyone is welcome!

name: Best Buddies
description:
Please contact us at UCFBestBuddies@gmail.com for questions regarding membership, upcoming events, or how to get involved!

 

Best Buddies International is a nonprofit organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, inclusive living, and family support for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).

 

The UCF chapter is a friendship chapter, focused on partnering up our members in one-to-one friendships. Pairs have the opportunity to hang out outside the club like any friends would, as well as attend our weekly socials and over 5 large-scale events, including the Talent Show, Hoedown, and annual Inclusion Week in the spring. 

 

As a part of our mission towards inclusion, we partner with other organizations on campus. Some of our highlights include partnering with Greek life, UCF athletics, ACS, LMSA, CHAARG, Knights Exemplar, the UCF Police Department, Active Minds, and Special Olympics.

 

Everyone has room for one more friend!
summary: Best Buddies at UCF works with individuals with and without disabilities, pairing members in one-to-one friendships and offering weekly socials, as well as over five large-scale events per year to foster an environment of friendship, inclusion, and fun!

name: Beta Alpha Psi Honorary Accounting Organization
description:
Beta Alpha Psi is an honorary accounting organization that strives to help candidates and members in their professional development and prepare them for successful careers in the accounting field. Each semester Beta Alpha Psi hosts a variety of events including: workshops, meetings, mock interviews and socials with accounting firms to accomplish this goal. 

 

Beta Alpha Psi offers you: 

- Professional reputation 

- Mentors

- Networking opportunities with firms and peers

- Soft skills development 

 

Stay up to date with the latest BAP news by liking our Facebook page: Beta Alpha Psi at UCF or check out our website: bapucf.com
summary: The primary objective of Beta Alpha Psi is to encourage and give recognition to scholastic and professional excellence in the business information field.

name: Beta Psi Omega Professional Biology Fraternity
description:
We are a co-ed professional fraternity dedicated to connecting people with a love for biology here at UCF. We are open to all majors, all you need is an interest in the biological sciences. We provide many leadership opportunities, as well as community service and research connections. Aside from professional development, we host many social events to help members build a supportive community on campus that is there for them not only in academics, but in life as well.

Check us out & message us on Instagram! @bpoucf

If you are interested in joining our fraternity, please come to our rush week events!
summary: The mission of Beta Psi Omega is to provide a supportive brother and sisterhood for students pursuing the biological sciences professionally and academically. We aim to further the advancement of biology as a profession while building strong connections.

name: Beta Theta Pi Fraternity
summary: The mission of Beta Theta Pi Fraternity is to develop men of principle for a principled life.

name: BeyKnights
summary: The mission of BeyKnights is to introduce Beyblade X competitions to UCF by providing a venue for Beyblade X tournaments on campus, and to introduce students both to Beyblade X and to each other by networking at the tournament.

name: Bhakti Yoga Club
description:
The Bhakti Yoga Club is dedicated to creating a safe space where we are all welcome to come and free the mind from the stresses of daily life and make a deeper connection with yourself through meditation, music, books, and food.  

For updates about our club just check out our linktree :)

https://linktr.ee/ucfbhaktiyogaclub

check out @bhaktihouseorlando on insta for updates and to get in contact with us
summary: Bringing people together of all cultural and ethnic backgrounds through transcendental chanting and dancing, and inviting eminent scientist/scholars/thinkers to talk about understanding ones constitutional position.

name: Big Sister Little Sister Mentoring Program
description: Big Sister Little Sister is a National Mentoring Program with a global impact. BSLS promotes life skills, mental health, and principles of self with a focus on personal and professional development. We strive to make a positive and lasting impact on school campuses, in communities, and in the lives of youth and women.
summary: A mentoring program amongst the students of UCF

name: Bioethics Club
description:
The Bioethics Club is a discussion-based organization. The purpose of this club is to allow students to explore and learn about the connection between ethics and scientific progress. During meetings, students will learn about and analyze various scientific scenarios, articles, hypotheticals, movie clips, etc. and be able to approach them from numerous different perspectives outside of their own. Our goal is to provide students with the ability to understand how morality differs (and why) from person to person, as well as provide them with the necessary processing abilities to navigate such difficult situations that they may encounter in their future careers. 

The best place to keep up with/contact us is through our Instagram, thank you!
summary: A discussion-based and majorly online club focused on expanding student awareness of the connection between ethics and scientific progress as well as personal moral and rational growth.

name: Biology Graduate Student Association
description: The Biology Graduate Student Association (BGSA) provides UCF biology graduate students extracurricular activities including regular seminars, journal discussions, and social events. BGSA is also a service organization participating in outreach events and environmental cleanup activities.
summary: To provide UCF biology graduate students extracurricular activities and representation to the department.

name: Biomedical Sciences Graduate Student Association
description:
The goals of BSGSA include:

1. Provide a forum for discussion of issues relevant to graduate students within the Burnett School of Biomedical Science and others in the university community.

2. Organize, promote and conduct activities beneficial to Biomedical Sciences graduate students and enhance their graduate education at the University of Central Florida.
summary: The mission of the BSGSA is to represent the interests of Biomedical Sciences graduate students in all administrative and legislative affairs.

name: Biotech Alliance of Medicine
description: The mission of Biotech Alliance of Medicine is to inform aspiring scholars about the advancements being made in medicine with the use of technology. With the help of professionals within the field, we hope to open the eyes of society to the endless possibilities provided through biotechnology.
summary: The mission of Biotech Alliance of Medicine is to inform aspiring scholars about the advancements being made in medicine with the use of technology.
categoryNames: ['Engineering and Computer Science', 'Health Professions and Sciences', 'Medicine', 'Sciences']

name: Biotechnology Laboratory Society
summary: The mission of Biotechnology Laboratory Society is to ensure exposure to design, experiment, and troubleshoot novel biotechnological experiments to develop a foundation to become successful in a career related to the biotechnology field.

name: Black and Gold Analytics
description:
Black and Gold Analytics fosters a vibrant community of sports data enthusiasts at the University of Central Florida, spanning all skill levels and academic backgrounds. Members engage in a variety of activities including project creation, academic research, and networking, all within a supportive environment that promotes both personal and collective achievement. We meet weekly to conduct research, share knowledge on sports analytics, and enjoy social events throughout the semester.

 

Membership is open to anyone from beginners to advanced data scientists. For newcomers, there are weekly workshops covering programming languages from the basics to more advanced topics. More experienced members have the opportunity to participate in research projects, enter competitions, and attend analytics conventions funded by the club, enhancing both their learning and competitive edge.

 

We appreciate all our members for their dedication and enthusiasm, which propel our community forward. Thank you for your commitment and contributions that enrich our collective experience and success.

 

Join our Discord: https://discord.com/invite/qh6GUqxRf5
summary: Black and Gold Analytics is a dynamic student organization at UCF that engages students from all disciplines in data science through projects, research, and workshops. The organization features three main branches: Sports, Business, and Health Analytics.
categoryNames: ['Engineering and Computer Science', 'Sciences', 'Graduate Studies', 'Miscellaneous Hobbies', 'Sports and Recreation']

name: Black Psychology Club
summary: Black Psychology Club seeks to bring awareness to the lack of representation in psychological spaces, through dedication to fostering a safe space for students with the provision of fellowship, advocacy, and community with zeal for psychology paradigms.

name: Black Student Awareness
description:
Through educational events and programs, the Black Student Awareness Club (BSA) strives to increase the awareness of issues surrounding the Black community on our campus, within the city of Orlando, and across the country. BSA speaks on current events surrounding our community, encourages the celebration of Black heritage, celebrates the accomplishments of Black people on and around the campus, and offers insight into the future of our black community.

BSA also emphasizes the promotion and support of African-American student organizations at the University as well as the development of outstanding Black student leaders.

The Black Student Awareness Club encourages and welcomes students to get involved and make a difference through education, empowerment and understanding. 

The Black Student Awareness Club welcomes all races to be involved in our attempts to honor, promote and preserve Black excellence on our campus.
summary: The mission of Black Student Awareness is to strive to increase the awareness of issues surrounding the Black community on our campus, within the city of Orlando, and across the country.

name: Black Student Union
description:
We are the Black Student Union at the University of Central Florida. Our purpose is to serve as the official voice for the black community at the University. We have three goals for our organization, and they are: 

  • To develop, implement, intensify, and perpetuate comprehensive programs. These programs will identify and deal with the problems of educational, political, and cultural dilemmas encountered by the UCF community with a focus on Black students while promoting a positive image of the Black culture to the university and outside communities.
  • To establish and promote open lines of communication between the Black students and university administration, faculty, staff, and alumni in order to enhance the disseminating and receiving such information.
  • To collaborate with other organizations to provide a diverse learning atmosphere to all UCF students.

Founded on October 29, 1969, the Black Student Union was the first multicultural student organization on the University of Central Florida campus. We strive to create a home-away-from-home environment for all members, and to encourage students to become campus leaders.

Make sure to follow us for all up to date information!

Instagram: @bsu_ucf

General Body Meetings

Wednesdays @ 6pm
summary:
We are the Black Student Union at the University of Central Florida. 

Our purpose is to serve as the official voice for the black community on campus.

name: Black Undergraduate Kinesiology Association
summary: The Black Undergraduate Kinesiology Association strives to be a family oriented community of kinesiology students through mentorship, peer empowerment, and career development while upholding values of inclusivity and community at UCF.

name: BlackStone LaunchPad
description: RSVP for events by visiting https://ucf.startuptree.co/
summary: The Blackstone LaunchPad at UCF supports students, regardless of level or focus of study. Located in the lobby of the Student Union, our LaunchPad serves as a hub for all students to develop a business mindset to be best prepared for professional success

name: Bold Campus Ministry at UCF
description:
Bold Campus Ministry is a dynamic and passionate Christian community dedicated to making a profound impact on college campuses across the nation. With an unapologetically bold approach to faith, this ministry seeks to empower students to live out their Christian values with confidence and conviction.

At the heart of Bold Campus Ministry is a commitment to authentic relationships. The community is built on a foundation of genuine care, support, and accountability, creating a space where students can explore and deepen their faith in a welcoming and nonjudgmental environment.

Worship gatherings with Bold Campus Ministry are characterized by lively and spirited expressions of faith. Through vibrant music, dynamic preaching, and engaging discussions, students are encouraged to encounter God in a way that is both meaningful and transformative.

Bold Campus Ministry is not just about internal growth; it's about actively engaging with the world. The ministry is involved in various outreach initiatives, social justice causes, and community service projects. Through these efforts, students have the opportunity to tangibly express their faith by serving those in need and advocating for positive change in their communities.

One of the distinctive features of Bold Campus Ministry is its emphasis on leadership development. Students are encouraged to step into leadership roles, empowering them to take ownership of their faith and become influential leaders on their campuses and beyond.

In summary, Bold Campus Ministry is a vibrant and empowering Christian community that equips students to boldly live out their faith, engage with the world, and make a lasting impact on their college campuses. Through authentic relationships, dynamic worship, community outreach, and leadership development, this ministry strives to inspire a generation of confident and passionate followers of Christ.
summary: By constructing an atmosphere where students can peacefully express their thoughts and perspectives in a creative manner, student peers will be able to view another perspectives on faith through constructive discussions and fun activities.

name: Botanical Society at the University of Central Florida
description:
The mission of Botanical Society of America is to create a community for students interested in botanical sciences. By forming a community of plant science students with the Botanical Society of America we will be able to offer professional development opportunities and help link students to internships and jobs. 

 

General Body Meetings on the last Wednesday of every month. 

Join our Discord for up to date club info! (https://discord.gg/fErqUW4WJ4)
summary: The Botanical Society at UCF aims to foster plant love among the UCF community! Our club activities include hikes, workshops, and occasional guest speakers. The focus of the BSA is to connect students with a similar interest in plants.

name: Bowling Club @ UCF
description: The Bowling Club @ UCF is a collegiate travel team that bowls competitively within all USBC teams. Every year we battle some of the biggest schools in bowling amongst the US Southeast and even venture across the nation for select events! We compete both Fall and Spring semesters with a nurturing but competitive team environment. Not a competitive bowler? No worries, our team is open to all and regardless of where you stand, we want to help you improve! Join us for practices Monday 7-9pm at Boardwalk Bowl located on Colonial Drive! Join our discord: https://discord.gg/gzyKMMnRrK
summary: The Bowling Club @ UCF sets to provide knights a fun atmosphere to bowl with a team, whether you are just starting out or have years of experience!

name: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu
description:
The Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Club @ UCF is run like a traditional BJJ gym with recreational and instructional purpose.

All levels of experience are welcome. There are no requirements to join.

Practice is held at the RWC @ Ferrell Commons, next to the UCF LEAD Scholars Academy. If you face away from '63 South, it will be through the second set of doors. 

As of Fall 2024, our schedule is Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Saturday--all 12:45-3:15pm. Please follow us on Instagram for the latest updates @bjjucf

 

Description of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu:

- Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is a relatively new and constantly evolving sport that gained fame exponentially due to its effectiveness in mixed martial arts. 
- Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu offers a fun alternative workout as well as a means to self-defense.
- The sport holds therapeutic value, especially when it comes to dealing with stress and pressure.
- It is often compared to chess as a mind game where the right know-how surpasses brute force.
summary: The mission of the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu club is to teach mixed martial arts to people, regardless of their age, sex, or skill level.

name: Brazilian Jiu-jitsu Knights
description:
Brazilian Jiu-jitsu Knights is a group composed of UCF students who train and are continuously learning the art and sport of Brazilian Jiu-jitsu.

We welcome anyone who wants to learn and train, regardless of your level of experience, come out to our practices to have some fun and learn BJJ!

Practice is held @ Ferrell Commons RWC

Spring 2019 Practice Times:

Tuesday: 1-2:30pm

Thursday: 1-2:30pm

Friday: 1-2:30pm
summary: Brazilian Jiu-jitsu Knights is a group composed of UCF students who train and are continuously learning the art and sport of Brazilian Jiu-jitsu.

name: Brazilian Student Association
description:
Bem-vindos a familia BRASA! :) 

💼 The Brazilian Student Association at the University of Central Florida (BRASA UCF), is a prominent organization dedicated to supporting Brazilian students in Orlando. With a strong focus on academic, professional, and social development, BRASA UCF serves as a vital resource and community for Brazilian students seeking to thrive in their educational journey.

🤝 We assist Brazilians interested in studying at UCF by providing guidance throughout the application process via our social media channels, sharing insights about life in the US and Orlando, and addressing any additional inquiries with UCF Global.

💼 We engage and support current Brazilian students at UCF by providing access to all available resources and events offered by the university and BRASA, ensuring a fulfilling and exceptional college experience. 

🤝 We promote Brazilian culture and facilitate academic and professional development by organizing networking events, social gatherings, panels, and community service initiatives for all students at UCF, fostering a vibrant and inclusive community on campus.

#BRASAUCF
summary: The mission of the Brazilian Student Association is to integrate and support the Brazilian community, while promoting cultural awareness about Brazil and the Portuguese language.

name: Bridges International
description:
Who we are

 

Bridges is a multi-ethnic, multicultural international student club for students of all nations around the world. While essentially a Christian service organization, our goal is to welcome and serve students of all faiths and backgrounds. Our community is based on these “Four S’s”: 

  1. Social connections among various cultures
  2. Service to international students in practical ways and to the community
  3. Spiritual resources and life topic conversations
  4. Student leadership opportunities to grow as global leaders for the future

 

Ways to get involved

 

We do english conversation hours, cultural events, small group get-togethers, evening social game nights on campus, holiday invitations to local American families’ homes, and more. We serve all UCF campuses by helping provide rides as needed to connect students from Rosen and Downtown campuses.

 

Come join us every other Friday evening at Bridges Cafe! 5:30-7:30@GlobalUCF

Students from many different countries hang out, play games, have snacks and coffee/tea, make new friends. Just for fun and community!
summary: Bridges International is a caring, multiethnic student community that engages with international students by providing service activities, social networking, and spiritual resources.

name: Campus Activities Board
description:
Our goal is to push the boundaries of campus events by providing diverse and unique entertainment for the UCF student body and the Orlando community. We are funded through the Activity and Service Fee, allocated to the Campus Activities Board through Student Government. Each of our eight (8) committee directors are responsible for the execution of a specific types of events relating to the respective committee. The overall function and direction of the organization are managed by the Executive and Associate Directors of the Campus Activities Board.

 

How to Get Involved

If you are interested in getting involved with the Campus Activities Board, email our CAB Associate Director, Lauren Walker, at cabassociate@ucf.edu for more information. 

 

Mission

Our mission at UCF's Campus Activities Board (CAB) is to foster a sense of community on campus by hosting unique events that effectively cater to our diverse student body and the Orlando community.

name: Campus Crusade for Christ
description:
Mission

Cru at UCF is a welcoming community that loves Jesus and wants him to be known on campus.  Our goal is that every student at UCF would know someone who loves Jesus.

Description
Welcome to Cru at UCF. Here you can find new friends, fun, laughter, leadership development, diverse students, community, mission, opportunities to serve the campus of UCF, teaching, discussion, live music, and all kinds of things throughout the week on campus and off campus!

You are invited to enjoy, participate and lead in this movement that exists here at UCF to build relationships and create spaces where you can experience the life and message of Jesus. 
 
Ways to Get Involved
 1. Cru Thursday is the weekly meeting of Cru @ UCF. We invite you to join us every Thursday evening as we seek to experience God through relationship and real-life teaching from the Bible. Our goal is to energize, encourage, and ignite a passion for loving God and others.
 
2. Community groups are the way that we connect with our living communities in smaller group setting. It's where we grow in our relationship with Christ and each other. These happen throughout the week.
 
For more details, visit our website or follow us on Instagram. Our handle is @cruatucf.
summary: We are a welcoming community of students and faculty that know Jesus and want him to be known.

name: CancerShield: Naturopathic Harmony
description: https://web.groupme.com/join_group/100110325/GRpVVuDb
summary: Our mission is to empower life through integrative wellness including nutrition education for cancer prevention. Focusing on the connection of food and body, our club strives to empower students with the knowledge and resources to live a cancer-free life

name: CAPS Peer Educators
description: We are here to educate the campus community on mental fitness and stress reduction. CAPS Peer Educators help guide students to the available resources on campus to help them stay mentally fit. Our goal is to connect with students to help reduce the stigma of seeking mental health services.
summary: CAPS Peer Educators are a group of student volunteers from all years and majors. We are here to promote UCF’s Counseling and Psychological Services to students and campus departments.

name: Career Services
description:
Looking for a full or part time job? Want feedback on your resume, cover letter, or interview skills? UCF Career Services is your one-stop spot for career readiness! Located conveniently on UCF's main campus in the CSEL building on Memory Mall, students and alumni are able to utilize our many services such as:

  • Walk-in resume & cover letter critiques
  • Practice interview sessions
  • Major exploration
  • Employer info sessions
  • Career readiness workshops
  • Job search resources
  • Knight Link

Career Services also hosts larger events each semester including:

  • Career Expos
  • Statewide Job Fairs
  • Employment Bootcamp
  • Graduate and Professional School Fairs
  • Majors Fairs
  • Education Career Fair
  • Externship Program
  • Nonprofit and Public Service Career Showcase

Many of our resources can be accessed online to benefit online students or regional campuses. Visit http://career.ucf.edu/resources.

Come by and see us anytime during our Drop-in hours Monday-Friday, 10am-3pm.

Your Future. Now.
summary: Career Services contributes to the UCF's goal of offering high quality  education and student development by providing centralized, comprehensive and coordinated career development, experiential learning and employer relations programs

name: Caribbean Students' Association
description:
Caribbean Students' Association at

The University of Central Florida

History

The Caribbean Students' Association at the University of Central Florida (CSA at UCF) has a short and colorful history. In April 1985, the idea for a Caribbean Club was concieved and acted upon by a few dedicated students, who spent many days trying to solicit enough signatures to officially activate the organization. The Caribbean Club, as it was called, served as a "home away from home" for the many Caribbean students at UCF. The club was formed with the purpose of fostering a cultural bridge between the Caribbean and the United States.

In the Spring of 1990, the club was reactivated. It was tough in the beginning, but the hardwork and persistence finally paid off in the Spring of 1992 when the Caribbean Students' Association was officially formed and the membership blossomed from 15 to 100 members. The hard work and persistence finally paid off.

 The Club meetings provide a relaxed atmosphere for students to meet and network. Students of all cultures were encouraged to share their Caribbean heritage while keeping the traditions of their Caribbean ancestors. Today, our membership has increased to over 300 students. Dedicated members are the key to the success of CSA.

In 1992 our Association at UCF became one of the five educational institutions that started the Florida Caribbean Students' Association and is one of the initial five organizations at UCF to become apart of the university's MultiCultural Student Center.

Today, CSA is one of the most active Student Organizations on the University of Central Florida campus.

 

CSA gives a special thanks to:

Las Adams, Elton Bracey, Victor Flores, Barry Brennen, Kisha Dunn, Tricia Phillip, Deanna Hoyen, Alfredo Barrett Jr., Patrice Phillip, Denise Green, Drumeco Lauritson, Gordan McKenzie, Jason Isree, Jey Singam, Yonette Forde, Sharon Cruz, Lisa Pitram, Andrea Brown.

 

Most of All:

Raymond Permaul

Lynette Permaul

Jameer Abass

Edmund Dabiedah

and

Anne Marie de Govia
summary: The purpose of the Caribbean Students' Association (CSA) at the University of Central Florida (UCF) is to unite people with a common interest in the Caribbean while educating the students of the cultural aspects of the Caribbean.

name: Catholic Campus Ministry
description:
Catholic Campus Ministry at the University of Central Florida is a community of missionary disciples whose relationships create a home for Christian life as a spiritual family living in the heart of the Church.

 

Our Core Values:

- Belief in Jesus

- Wholehearted Worship

- Relational Evangelization

- Brotherhood and Sisterhood

- Formation to Christian Maturity

- Transformational Community

- Renewal in the Holy Spirit

 

Join us on Slack, find Retreat Registrations, join our Outreach Teams, and much more through our LinkTree and Instagram

 

Join us weekly for Confession at 4:30pm and Mass at 5pm Tuesday-Thursday at the Catholic Center @ Northview during the Fall and Spring semesters. We close when UCF closes typically!
summary: Catholic Campus Ministry at the University of Central Florida is a community of missionary  disciples whose relationships create a home for Christian life as a spiritual family living in the heart of the Church.

name: Centaurus Horn Club
description: The Centaurus Horn Club exists to educate and excite the members of the UCF Horn Studio about the history and utility of the horn. Through regular rehearsals, performances, masterclasses, and more, the ensemble grows not only in their musicianship, but their supportive and collaborative environment.
summary: The Centaurus Horn Club is comprised of members of the UCF Horn Ensemble. The ensemble performs standard and new works for the medium and takes every opportunity to learn more about the horn in any setting.

name: Center for Community Partnerships
description:
The Center for Community Partnerships develops, facilitates and supports university-community partnerships that strengthen communities in Central Florida. A major thrust of the center is to develop long-term partnerships between the College of Health and Public Affairs, other colleges across the University of Central Florida, and the Central Florida community. 

The center focuses on the following areas:

  1. community engagement
  2. collaborative partnerships
  3. research and service
  4. long-term solutions to societal concerns

At UCF, center personnel work closely with college administrators, department leaders and faculty members to identify critical community priorities, faculty interests and capabilities, and internal and external partnership opportunities. In the community, they place a priority on engaging community leaders, with several goals in mind:

  1. to develop strong interpersonal and inter-organizational relationships
  2. to develop a keen understanding of issues facing community members, schools, and government and nonprofit organizations in the public sector
  3. to facilitate discussions on strategies to address critical community concerns
  4. to initiate long-term partnerships to address those concerns

The Center for Community Partnerships (CCP) strives to inspire students to play a role in the Orlando community through volunteerism. The CCP offers volunteer opportunities to UCF students at partnering organizations across the region.  

 

These volunteer opportunities provide students with a chance to make impact on their community and themselves through the power of service. By being civically engaged, volunteers will learn important skills such as leadership and communication.
summary: The center partners with public- and private-sector community leaders with the intent to develop broad-based community initiatives to address and resolve those pressing concerns.

name: Central American Latin Organization
summary: The mission of the Central American Latin Organization is to share and embrace similar yet different cultural experiences between students from Central America, but to share our culture with the rest of the students at UCF.

name: Central Asia Club
summary: The mission of Central Asia Club is to unite students from Central Asia and everyone interested in its history, culture, traditions, and language through engaging in activities and educational opportunities.

name: Central Florida Bassoon Society
description: Our mission is to provide extracurricular opportunities for learning and growth by organizing masterclasses, festival/conference participation, community involvement, and technical classes in Bassoon reed-making.
summary: Providing opportunities for musicians to learn, collaborate, and gain musical experience through community support.

name: Central Florida Cello Association
description: The goal of Central Florida Cello Association is to heighten the exposure of its members by interacting with successful individuals in the industry through masterclasses, recitals, and workshops. Members will also be given the opportunity to perform at venues they otherwise would not have access to in their early career, alongside being able to experience performances they otherwise would not have available to them.
summary: The Central Florida Cello Association is a group created by the UCF cello studio to allocate funds towards bringing in professional musicians for masterclasses and workshops that, not only benefit UCF cellists, but to anyone who may wish to sit in.

name: Central Florida Hillel
description:
Hillel at UCF Engages Students with Israel: 
Hillel at UCF views Israel as a core element of Jewish life and a gateway to Jewish identification for students. We provide every Jewish student with the opportunity to explore and build an enduring relationship with Israel through our Israel Fellowship, support of pro-Israel student groups, and Taglit-Birthright Israel.

 

Hillel at UCF Engages Students at a Critical Time in Their Lives:
Hillel at UCF strives to engage and support all Jewish students who are away from home for the first time in their lives. Knowing that more than one of two students comes from an interfaith household, we also support the many unaffiliated students along their Jewish journeys through an exploration of their passions and interests as Jews and as young adults. Through an intensive effort to get to know the broader Jewish student body, we are better able to foster the meaningful Jewish experiences of our students.

 

Hillel at UCF Supports a Life of Jewish Meaning:

Hillel at UCF creates a safe space for students to explore their Jewish identities, embark in Jewish learning experiences, and celebrate our Jewish heritage. 

 

Hillel at UCF Builds the Leaders of Tomorrow:

Hillel at UCF fosters the next generation of Jewish leaders by providing our Knights with leadership training, faculty mentoring, and by connecting students to each other and to the broader UCF alumni network.

Hillel at UCF Repairs The World:
Hillel at UCFinspires and provides students with opportunities to demonstrate a commitment to social justice, volunteerism, and community service through ongoing and special events that serve our local community, Florida and the entire world.
summary: Central Florida Hillel is the Center for Jewish life on campus at the University of Central Florida.

name: Central Florida Trumpet Guild
summary: The Central Florida Trumpet Guild is committed to educating the students and the community in the art of trumpet. The CFTG host the UCFs trumpet fest which brings in artists to perform and educate the masses on the art and skill that is the trumpet.

name: CHAARG at UCF
description:
2 out of 3 college women don’t feel comfortable going to the weight room… CHAARG is here to change that! CHAARG started because we saw the divide between the weight room + cardio machines… + noticed that many women did not feel confident in the gym! Our mission is to “liberate girls from the elliptical” + show them that fitness can [+ should!] be FUN… + that working out is better with friends!

 

Once you join CHAARG, you are welcomed into a supportive + empowering community of 10,000+ members! Every week, you’ll try a different fitness class — like: pilates, kickboxing, cardio dance, + more! When you workout, you’ll feel good — but, when you surround yourself with people to support you, you’ll feel even better. CHAARG combines great friends + fun workouts to help every member feel their best.

 

Memberships are open all year! Once purchased, feel free to come to any of our events! Join officially at shop.chaarg.com + make sure to follow us on Instagram @ucf_inchaarg to stay updated <3
summary: 2 out of 3 college women don’t feel comfortable going to the weight room… CHAARG is here to change that! Our mission is to “liberate girls from the elliptical” + show them that fitness can [+ should!] be FUN… + that working out is better with friends!

name: Chabad Jewish Student Group
description: With the vision to open the door of Judaism to all  students and faculty on the UCF campus, we have established The Chabad House, a place where Jews of all backgrounds and degrees of observance can enjoy exploring their Jewish heritage in a warm, welcoming and non-judgmental environment.  We focus on traditional Jewish values through the perspective of Chasidic philosophy. Our programs include but are not limited to: weekly Shabbat dinners and services, Weekly BBQ's holiday programs, social activities, and classes. with both an active student organization and Jewish chaplain, Chabad is committed to try and reach every Jew.
summary: With the vision to open the door of Judaism to all  students and faculty on the UCF campus, we have established The Chabad House, a place where Jews of all backgrounds and degrees of observance can enjoy exploring their Jewish heritage.

name: Chargin' Knights
description:
The Chargin' Knights Club is a community of students who are passionate about promoting sustainable transportation on campus and off campus. The club's main goal is to raise awareness about the benefits of using PEVs as a viable mode of transportation, while also emphasizing the importance of safety, maintenance, and environmental responsibility. The club hosts regular meetings and events where you can learn about the latest PEV technologies and safety practices, as well as participate in group rides with fellow members.

 

In addition, Chargin' Knights places a strong emphasis on environmental awareness and sustainability. By promoting the use of PEVs, the club aims to reduce carbon emissions and promote a cleaner, healthier environment. Members are encouraged to participate in community outreach programs and advocacy efforts to raise awareness about the environmental benefits of PEVs.

 

Finally, Chargin' Knights is dedicated to promoting proper maintenance and care of PEVs. Members are provided with resources on how to properly maintain their vehicles to ensure they operate in safe conditions and remain reliable for years to come.

 

Overall, Chargin' Knights is a welcoming community of students who share a passion for sustainable transportation, environmental responsibility, proper maintenance, safety, and group rides. Whether you're a seasoned PEV enthusiast or just starting to explore these vehicles, Chargin' Knights is a great place to connect with others who share similar interests and to learn more about the many benefits of using PEVs.
summary: The Chargin' Knights is a club that focuses on promoting sustainable PEV transportation, safety, maintenance, and environmental sustainability. Members can look forward to meeting members with similar interests and social group rides.
categoryNames: ['Engineering and Computer Science', 'Miscellaneous Hobbies', 'Social/Political Awareness', 'Sports and Recreation']

name: Chess Club
description:
Feel free to drop by our discord server https://discord.gg/nHFWMyhv5f

Weekly meetings Fridays 6-9PM on the first Floor of the Student Union near the main food court
summary: To improve our knowledge of chess, make friends, and play chess. No previous experience need, so beginners are welcomed! We are an USCF affiliated club and now form part of the Florida College Chess Foundation.

name: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
description:
Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship is a campus ministry here at UCF! We are a community of Christ followers endeavoring to show His love on campus, in the community, and around the world. We value worship, discipleship, fellowship, mission and prayer.

-

We are not a fraternity or sorority. Our Greek name, Chi Alpha, is derived from the Greek, Christou Apostolai, meaning Christ’s Sent Ones, and is taken from 2 Corinthians 5:20, which begins, “We are therefore Christ’s Ambassadors.”

-

Click here for our Google Calendar!

-

Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship at UCF is part of an international organization, Chi Alpha Campus Ministries, on over 300 campuses in the US and around the world. See www.ChiAlpha.com for more information about the organization.
summary: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship is a campus ministry here at UCF! We are a community of Christ followers endeavoring to show His love on campus, in the community, and around the world. We value worship, discipleship, fellowship, mission and prayer.

name: Chi Omega Fraternity
description:
Every year since 1895, ambitious collegiate women have made the decision to better themselves as Chi Omegas. As one of the largest women’s organizations in the world, our purposes are being pursued uniquely across the world each and every day. We strive to promote sincere friendship, academic excellence, high standards of personal integrity, dedication to others through service, credible career and personal development, and unwavering community involvement. Our values guide us to grow. They allow generations of women to work towards balance in our lives, on our campuses, and within our communities.  

Being part of Chi Omega is more than drawers full of lettered t-shirts, more than themed functions, and more than a few extra likes on Instagram. Chi Omega is a sisterhood. It is a house to call home and friends to call family. A place to turn tears into laughter. And a place to become the best version of yourself. I hope you get the chance to walk through our big red doors and meet the incredible women that make Psi Mu a home and ensure that Chi Omega is the sisterhood it was founded to be 127 years ago.
summary:
Chi Omega is an intergenerational women’s organization committed to our purposes:

Friendship
Personal Integrity
Service to Others
Academic Excellence and Intellectual Pursuits
Community and Campus Involvement
Personal and Career Development

name: Chi Sigma Iota Counseling Honor Society
summary: CSI is an international honor society that values academic and professional excellence in counseling. Our mission is to promote scholarship, research, professionalism, leadership, advocacy, and excellence in counseling.

name: Chi Upsilon Sigma National Latin Sorority, Inc.
description: Alpha Xi was founded at the University of Central Florida on January 9, 2006.  After a few years of hard work and dedication, we were welcomed to the Diversified Greek Council in 2009.  Alpha Xi has grown to over 60 women as of today.  The chapter concentrates on presenting relevant and controversial programming centered on social, political, educational, and cultural awareness'.  Alpha Xi also focuses on community service through our chapter philanthropy, Harbor House of Central Florida and our national philanthropy, I Have a Dream Foundation, amongst many others. Our goals also include maintaining high GPAs and actively contributing to the scholastic achievement of the Greek Community.
summary: Chi Upsilon Sigma is the first independent Latin sorority. Founded in 1980, our goals include maintaining high GPAs and actively contributing to the scholastic achievement of the Greek Community as well as servicing those in need.

name: Child Life Specialist Association at UCF
description: The Child Life Specialist Association at UCF is an organization that focuses on preparing students interested in the Child Life field. The organization will offer professional development, practicum and internship information, and insight into the life of a child life specialist.
summary: The mission of the Child Life Specialist Association at UCF is to provide students interested in becoming a Child Life Specialist a supportive and engaging environment while receiving information that will assist them during the practicum and internship

name: Children Beyond Our Borders
description:
Our mission is to provide opportunities for children and youth affected by armed conflict and social injustice to find peace, prosperity and well-being through education and empowerment. Every child, regardless of social status, race or gender, deserves a proper education. Every child deserves to live a stable life without barriers and without fear. Every child deserves to dream – and to dream big. Every child deserves a brighter future – a future that breaks boundaries and goes beyond borders.

Become a volunteer tutor with us!:

The school that UCF CBOB is volunteering with is a Title 1 School that has students that face hardships such as poverty, low-income, homelessness, abuse or neglect. We act as a mentor-like figure and empower these children by assisting them with homework and providing extra learning material for them! This volunteer opportunity is a weekly commitment. Please see Applications for days/times available for these opportunities. 

Still on the fence of joining? Being a chapter member includes:
- Access to over 20 internships with the non-profit organization
- Early access to our "Bound for Peace" service trips' applications 
- Networking with leaders of different backgrounds
- Monthly CWOB volunteering event 

- Community service for participation in activity time during biweekly meetings

- Weekly volunteering opportunity for tutoring program during Fall and Spring Semester


Most of all, children benefit from your membership by being provided:
- A mentor-like figure in their life
- Access to educational resources 
- Advocates to relieve their social injustice

To volunteer at Engelwood Neighborhood Center, click here.

To become a member fill out the following application here.

For our Linktr.ee, click here.
summary: Our mission is to provide opportunities for children and youth affected by armed conflict and social injustice to find peace, prosperity and well-being through education and empowerment.

name: Chilean Student Association
description:
The Chilean Student Association (CHISA) is a safe space for Chileans and anyone interested in our culture to come together as one to celebrate and learn about it.

Join us!
summary: The Chilean Student Association (CHISA) is a safe space for Chileans and anyone interested in our culture to come together as one to celebrate and learn about it.

name: Chinese American Student Association
description: The Chinese American Student Association aims to provide a community for Chinese-American students at the University of Central Florida, as well as introduce authentic Chinese culture to anyone interested in learning. We are excited to serve our members by providing a wide variety of culturally-immersive events, including monthly GBMs and other social activities! The Chinese American Student Association celebrates all backgrounds and embraces all cultures.
summary: A student organization formed to promote awareness of Chinese-American culture and identity among all members of the UCF community.

name: Christians on Campus
description:
Christians on Campus is composed of students on campus who desire to give the Lord the first place and to build up a community on the UCF campus to give every student the opportunity to grow spiritually, gain life-long companions, and develop academically while in college. Christians on Campus has many chapters on many campuses throughout the nation but does not take direction from any central headquarters or organization. Instead, the members practice to fellowship with other clubs from the various campuses in semesterly gatherings and yearly conferences. Through the decades of the Christians on Campus ministry, many graduates are kept connected to the students from the campus where they graduated, and are easily plugged into another campus should they move to a new city for work or graduate school. These alumni are very useful in mentoring new students due to their previous experiences as students and their current professional development.

Our goals are threefold:

Our first goal is to cause the students to see how critical these college years are for their own pursuit of Christ, their education, and for their development in spirit, soul, and body. In addition, the club desires to produce many mentors who could carry on the care for the younger, incoming students coming to UCF.

Secondly, our goal is to connect students with each other and with local Christian families and alumni throughout Central Florida and beyond to support the students in their spiritual condition, mental health, and academics.

Finally, to equip all the students in the realization of the divine truths according to the Scriptures (2 Timothy 3:16-17, 1 Timothy 2:4, 2 Peter 3:18), and for each one to realize the application of the Scripture in their daily living.
summary: Our primary mission is to bridge students into the homes of alumni and families around UCF and link students with over 80 registered student organizations across the nation to foster life-long companionships with other college-aged Christians nationwide.

name: Cinema and Film Appreciation
description:
We provide students with an opportunity to watch movies alongside fellow film lovers on campus in a social and theater-like setting. Our organization also has theater outings, film promotions, socials, and other fun events! 

Our organization was founded for fun, social events for students who share a similar passion in all things film and pop culture. Welcome to Cinema and Film Appreciation Club!
summary: We provide students with an opportunity to watch movies alongside fellow film lovers on campus in a social and theater-like setting. Our organization also has theater outings, film promotions, socials, and other fun events!

name: Circle K International
description:
Circle K International (CKI) is the premier collegiate and university community service, leadership development and friendship organization in the world. Our organization blends community service and leadership training with the opportunity to meet other students at service projects, conferences, and conventions. CKI offers members the opportunity to develop lifelong friendships, a network of resources within the Kiwanis family, and the knowledge that their leadership and service are making a positive impact on the world!

Join our GroupMe to get the most up-to-date information regarding meetings and events. [Link]

Follow our instagram @ucfcirclek for more updates and highlights from our events!

Linktree containing all interest form is linktr.ee/ucfcki

If you have any questions, please reach out to our president, Sara Knox, by email at ucfcki.president@gmail.com.
summary: Circle K International (CKI) is the premier collegiate and university community service, leadership development, and fellowship organization in the world.

name: Club Kreyol
description:
The mission of Club Kreyol is to be missionaries of the Creole culture by bringing awareness, drawing interest, and illustrating its diversity to UCF and the surrounding community.

Club Kreyol (CK ) represents nine Creole-speaking nations (Haiti, St Lucia, Martinique, Guadeloupe, Dominica, Mauritius, Reunion Island, Seychelles and French Guiana) and works to preserve Creole culture in this and future generations, inform and share Creole culture with others, serve the community and assists student with their transition into the University system, whether they are incoming freshmen or transfer students.

CK has bi-weekly general body meetings and hosts exciting and enriching events! Socials, bowling, skating, community service, volunteering, study nights, Kompa/Zouk nights, cooking and dance workshops, talent shows, forums, road trips and so much more!!

Our most popular and well attended event is Soiree Kreyol. Soiree Kreyol or "Soiree" is a formal cultural banquet and fundraiser that brings the Orlando and Creole community together to experience a showcase of culture and delicious food ending with a night of dancing! Guests from all over Florida come to Orlando to enjoy Soiree.

One word that represents Club Kreyol is family. In all that we do, we value the importance of creating a comfortable atmosphere where students can make connections that help them succeed in their careers and in life. Family is the foundation of society and the foundation of Creole culture and everyone is welcome in the CK Family.
summary: The mission of Club Kreyol is to be missionaries of the Creole culture by bringing awareness, drawing interest, and illustrating its diversity to UCF and the surrounding community

name: Coalition for Christian Outreach of First Presbyterian Church Orlando
summary: The purpose of CCO is to see the lives of college students transformed by the Gospel of Jesus Christ so they may be a blessing to the people and community around them. We do this through Bible studies, service opportunities, and social events.

name: Cognitive Science Club
description:
The mission of Cognitive Sciences Club is to foster opportunities for those interested in pursuing the interdisciplinary field of cognitive science and to offer a platform for members to engage, learn, and share ideas with other like-minded individuals and professionals from varying technical and non-technical fields, such as computer science, psychology, philosophy, anthropology, linguistics, neuroscience and the like. To accomplish this, we aim to facilitate knowledge acquisition through workshops by members and guest lecturers, networking opportunities, mentorship, and research opportunities.

Our goals are :

1) To create a community of shared interests to form networks and opportunities related to the cognitive science field whether it be psychology, computer science, mathematics, neuroscience, philosophy, linguistics, or anyone with a general interest in learning how the brain gives rise to the mind. 

2) To educate, increase awareness, and expand interest in a wide range of topics within the field of cognitive science.

3) Provide an environment that encourages and facilitates the acquisition of knowledge through research opportunities, fundraising, workshops, and guest speakers.

 

If you would like to be a part of the Cognitive Science community, join our discord! https://discord.gg/UBPDPQdq2R

 

Check out our Linktree for more about us:

https://linktr.ee/cscucf
summary: Cognitive Science Club is a student organization created to bring people interested in the cognitive sciences together and provide them with resources to learn more about the field and meet similarly-minded individuals.

name: College Democrats at UCF
description:
College Democrats at UCF is the representation of the Democratic Party on the campus of the University of Central Florida. We strive to promote the ideals of equality, equity, dignity, justice, integrity, and progress that define the Democratic Party. We are committed to creating an environment where we can celebrate the accomplishments of the Democratic Party while also demanding more and keeping our party accountable to the voters who believe in it. 

Our organization highlights progressive politics at the local, state, and federal level. We also invite lawmakers, local officials, candidates, and activists to come to General Body Meetings and special events. Our organization also has access to various internships, fellowships, and job opportunities!

Keep Moving Forward – it is a phrase so simple, yet defines us as an organization, and as a nation. It a phrase which tells us, that with every victory comes a new challenge, and with every challenge comes a new opportunity. 

Be sure to follow @ucfdems on Instagram for updates!
summary: The mission of College Democrats at UCF is to promote the ideals and principles of the Democratic Party by educating students and encouraging participation in the democratic process.

name: Collegiate American Choral Directors Association
summary: The mission of Collegiate American Choral Directors Association is to The mission of UCF Collegiate ACDA is to inspire excellence and nurture lifelong involvement in choral music for everyone through education, performance, composition, service, and advo

name: Collegiate Cyber Defense Club
description:
We are the University of Central Florida's only defensive and offensive Cybersecurity student organization. We learn, we teach, and we hack all the things.

We have meetings every Friday at 5:30PM in BA1-119 (Geared for absolute beginners & experienced people alike), along with seminars and workshops throughout the week. However, we don't post everything here all the time, so be sure to join the Discord and keep an eye on the announcements channel and events tab!

For more information on how to join, go here

Chat with us: Discord
summary: A computer security focused club that was founded in Fall of 2012 at the University of Central Florida. Our purpose is to foster an information security aware generation in Central Florida.

name: Collegiate Mathematical Society at UCF
description:
Our goal is to provide opportunities including, but not limited to:

1) Intellectual activities such as problem solving competitions, guest speakers, forums, campus social activities.

2) Dissemination of information about internships, career opportunities, and graduate school.

3) Increasing communication and interaction between and among students and faculty.

4) Community projects that broaden the public’s appreciation and understanding of the world of mathematics.

5) Contributing to the professional development of its membership by helping members attend conferences, encouraging members to conduct research, and assisting members with applying to REU's and graduate school.
summary: The mission of Math Club is to promote the understanding and appreciation of mathematics both within the club and the community at large, and broaden and enrich their participation in the world of mathematics.

name: Collegiate National Association for Music Education
description: NAfME Collegiate at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to advancing music education for our members, school, and the surrounding communities. We strive to promote the art of music through professional development, advocacy, fellowship and service.
summary: The mission of the Florida Music Educators Association is to promote quality, comprehensive music education for all Florida Students as a part of their complete education.

name: Colombian Student Association
description: The goals of ColSA are to bring Colombian students at UCF together to help and support one another throughout their academic experience at UCF; to provide a means for Colombian students to relax and enjoy their college experience; to help incoming students adjust to campus life; to showcase our heritage and culture to the student body; to promote harmony and build bridges of friendship and understanding between the UCF community and Colombian students; to be an inclusive organization that welcomes non-Colombian student membership; and to become a point of contact and exchange between Colombia (schools, universities, community, organizations, etc.) and UCF.
summary: ColSA's mission is to promote and support networking amongst Colombian students at UCF; and to raise awareness of the Colombian culture, history, heritage and current events among the UCF community.

name: Color Me Queer
summary: ColorMeQueer is a social organization for LGBTQ+ People of Color at the University of Central Florida. We aim to create a safe and inclusive atmosphere for all students by following the principles of the Three C's: Connect, Cultivate and Create.

name: Computer Hardware Innovation and Design Association
description:
Mission

Our mission is to provide academic support to all students in the Computer Architecture domain in order to hone their technical expertise to gain leadership experience, develop projects, network with other computer engineers, including students, faculty and professionals, and start building their resume. The organization provides programs that encourage academic excellence, innovation and personal growth by providing students with the tools, resources, guidance and inspiration to build their own future in the field of computer architecture.

Goals

Our goal is to provide UCF computer engineering, electrical engineering students and any students interested in computer hardware with development opportunities and leadership experiences through project development and networking at numerous conferences.

Connect via Discord group chat: CHIDA
summary: Our mission is to provide academic support to all students in the Computer Architecture domain in order to hone their technical expertise to gain leadership experience, develop projects, network with other computer engineers, including students, faculty.

summary: Mission is to create intentional programming that broadens the scope of educational opportunities for the academic attainment of all transfer students, many of whom identify as Hispanic/Latino. In addition, we aim to promote a meaningful collegiate.

name: Contemporary A Cappella Society at the University of Central Florida
description:
The mission of Contemporary A Cappella is to promote the growth, development, and awareness of a cappella music and techniques in the UCF and Orlando community through performances, outreach, and entertainment.

If you are interested in joining us, recommending a song, or just want to comment, please feel free to write us as well! Even if you don't sing, you can still join our organization and participate in workshops, socials, and other events.

name: Counselor Education Doctoral Students Organization
description: The Counselor Education Doctoral Student Organization (CEDSO) is the student association specifically for doctoral students in counselor education at UCF. Formed in 2008, the mission of the CEDSO is to promote the development of counselor education doctoral students in the areas of scholarship, teaching, and service through mentoring and collaboration opportunities.  The mentoring initiative began in 2011, with second and third year students volunteering as mentors for incoming first years.  CEDSO also applies to the SGA for funding to assist members in attending the ACES or SACES conference every fall.  Member collaboration is facilitated through semester meetings and social functions.  Additionally, CEDSO has recently launched a new Facebook page that can assist in answering questions for new and current students, including conference deadlines and member contact information.
summary: The Counselor Education Doctoral Student Organization (CEDSO) is the student association specifically for doctoral students in counselor education at UCF.

name: CREAR Futuros
description:
CREAR Futuros, which means “To Create Futures” in Spanish, is a peer-mentor based initiative designed to improve Latino student success at UCF. CREAR (College REadiness, Achievement and Retention) Freshmen will be paired with knowledgeable and highly trained upper-classman UCF Peer-Mentors that will introduce them to campus resources and offer insight on how to make the most out of their UCF experience.

 

What are the benefits of joining?

  • Join a National Network of Latino/a/x Leaders
  • Receive 1-on-1 Support from a Peer Mentor
  • Professional Development Opportunities
  • A fun, cultural environment!

What are mentee expectations?

  • 1 year commitment
  • Attend monthly virtual trainings
  • Attend biweekly one-on-one Zooms with mentor
  • Participate in monthly webinars
  • Communicate with mentor on a weekly basis
summary: CREAR Futuros, which means “To Create Futures” in Spanish, is a peer-mentor based initiative designed to improve Latino student success at UCF. CREAR (College REadiness, Achievement and Retention).

name: Criminal Justice Graduate Student Association
description:
The Criminal Justice Graduate Student Association (CJGSA) is a student-led organization that is committed to the professional development of criminal justice graduate students at the University of Central Florida (UCF). The purpose of the organization is to promote the development of criminal justice graduate students in the areas of scholarship, teaching, and service. This organization is aimed specifically at criminal justice Ph.D. students at UCF. The organization will encourage empirical research related to criminal justice and criminology. The CJGSA will also enhance communication between faculty and students through hosting workshops aimed at improving teaching and research effectiveness.

The organization’s mission is to facilitate communication between criminal justice graduate students, criminal justice faculty, the College, the University, and community partners to maintain a network of colleagues in the criminal justice field. Members of the organization will also develop and preserve relationships with the community through volunteering and community outreach opportunities. 

CJGSA membership is open to UCF criminal justice Ph.D. students only. However, the organization is committed to serving as a liaison between all criminal justice students and faculty at UCF. Some events hosted by the CJGSA will be open to criminal justice undergraduate and master's students in addition to Ph.D. students. Notifications about these events will be sent through students' UCF emails.

If you have any questions regarding our association, please e-mail: cjgsaucf@gmail.com
summary: The organization’s mission is to facilitate communication between criminal justice graduate students, criminal justice faculty, the College, the University, and community partners to maintain a network of colleagues in the criminal justice field.

name: Crocheting Knights
description: We are an organization dedicated to bringing together people with a passion for crocheting. We accept all different levels of experience and help new crocheters learn.
summary: An organization dedicated to improving crocheting skills and collaborating with others. We aim to create a calming environment for members to de-stress.

name: Crown to Crown
description:
Mission

The mission of Crown to Crown is to create a sisterhood of excellence through mentorship with young girls in our community by providing valuable insight, support, and friendship to encourage self-love, empowerment, and achievement.

 

Goals

1. Personal growth through the mentorship experience.

2. Development of self-love, confidence, individuality, goal-setting, and the strive for achievement.

3. Providing a positive and healthy environment.

4. Empowerment to make good life choices, reach goals, and dream big.

5. Fun!

 

Our Team

Taria Roberts| President | CrownedPresident@gmail.com

Kiana Blanc | Vice President of Membership | Crownedvp@gmail.com 

Fierra Philogene| Vice President of Campus Relations & Treasurer| Crowned2vp@gmail.com 

Alyssa Lee Brown|Secretary& Outreach Manager| Crownedsecretary@gmail.com

Trinity Turner| Public Relations |CrownedPrUCF@gmail.com
summary: The mission of Crown to Crown is to create a sisterhood of excellence through mentorship with young girls in our community by providing valuable insight, support, and friendship to encourage self-love, empowerment, and achievement.

name: Cuban American Student Association
description: We hope to participate in socials, service opportunities and involvement in cultural events, like Hispanic Heritage month and Cuban Independence Day. Our organization will benefit the student body by providing a safe space for students and being a bridge for others to learn about our culture. Follow us on Instagram @casaatucf and join our GroupMe for more updates.

name: Cycling Club @ UCF
description:
PLEASE CONTACT US VIA EMAIL OR IMLEAGUES. Sport Clubs use a new system (IM Leagues) for main contact. If you are interested in joining the club, please search through there or email us/find us on social media so that we can get you connected.

If you want to race road or mountain bikes, come join us!  Email or Message us on social media to find out about other local rides! name: D20 Knights
description:
We are a tabletop gaming club at the University of Central Florida. We play an assortment of games - everything from RPGs to CCGs. Bring in your favorite board game or your deck of Magic cards and start a game! Or maybe you're looking for players to venture into your dungeons... What ever your reason, join us for some game time!

Join us on our Discord (where most announcements are made and where a good amount of groups are found) 

https://discord.gg/yJSrqqT

Or come find us on our Facebook group 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/64015951332/
summary: To promote creativity, critical thinking and communication skills through the practice and enjoyment of Tabletop gaming.

description: The Dabke Student Organization is to bring the Arab culture closer and help students learn the traditional dances of their heritage. We strive to teach others also about our culture and the fun we have.

name: Delight at UCF
description:
Inviting college women into a Christ-centered community that fosters vulnerability and transforms stories.

Stay tuned on social media for meeting times and community events!

join our GroupMe! https://groupme.com/join_group/63334543/1UL0KUsN

Mission 
Delight seeks to establish a college community that grows together, serves together, learns together, and does life together while chasing the heart of God. Delight is intentional about learning from one another through stories and experiences while potentially discovering or continuing to grow in relationships with Christ.

Goals
Delight exists to be a place that any UCF collegiate woman can come and grow in relationships with others, ask difficult questions, and find a strong community of Christians and non-Christians alike. Delight provides an opportunity for the students of UCF to explore their faith in a nonjudgmental and open environment.
summary:

Stay tuned on social media for meeting times and community events!

name: Delta Delta Delta Fraternity
description: Tri delta is a Panhellenic Sorority with about 150 women. We have been on this campus for decades with a strong support system for one another and alumna base. Tri delta focuses on truth, self sacrifice, and friendship with a key focus on our philanthropy St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. Tri delta is extremely active on and on campus with many women active in other organizations. Tri Delta is more than just a sorority and will last so much longer than four years.
summary: Tridelta is a group of motivated women, empowering one another to be the greatest they can be during our collegiate years. We hold St. Jude close to our hearts, and are active in our community.

name: Delta Epsilon Chi
description: Collegiate DECA prepares emerging leaders and entrepreneurs in marketing, finance, hospitality, accounting, etc in colleges around the globe. This is done through role play competitions events that gives students experience in public speaking and real business scenarios. We have various guest speakers, competition prep, resume, LinkedIn, and powerpoint workshops throughout the semester.
summary: To provide leadership, educational, and professional development opportunities for its members and to promote student interest and involvement in the Collegiate DECA sponsored competitions and conferences.

name: Delta Epsilon Mu
description: The members of Delta Epsilon Mu are committed to serving the community by advocating health education and care, and through active participation in service activities, fundraising, and outreach programs. Members are given the opportunity to directly participate in health-oriented workshops and discussions, thereby attaining access to pertinent academic and career information through association with professors, advisors, career professionals, Alumni Members and fellow active members.
summary: Delta Epsilon Mu is a co-ed professional pre-health fraternity dedicated to serving the community and uniting students of diverse backgrounds with interest in the varying health fields through leadership, professional development, and brotherhood.

name: Delta Epsilon Psi
description:
Delta Epsilon Psi is a South Asian interest social and service fraternity established in 1998 at the University of Texas at Austin. Their mission is to foster brotherhood, nurture the development of leadership, and promote service to the community.

The fraternity was founded on the principles of brotherhood, discipline, and commitment. Brotherhood is about creating strong bonds of friendship, discipline is about striving for excellence in all aspects of life, and commitment is about dedicating oneself to the fraternity and its principles for life.

Delta Epsilon Psi is also dedicated to spreading South Asian culture, with many chapters hosting cultural events and participating in cultural activities on their campuses. The fraternity also encourages academic achievement, with many chapters offering scholarships for its members.

In terms of community service, Delta Epsilon Psi is heavily involved in various philanthropic activities. The fraternity has a close relationship with Breakthrough T1D (formerly JDRF), working to raise funds and awareness for Type 1 diabetes research. Additionally, the fraternity works with Be the Match to support the cause for stem cell transplant and research. Members of the fraternity often participate in volunteer work, fundraising events, and awareness campaigns to help fight this disease.

By 2025, Delta Epsilon Psi has grown significantly and now has many chapters across the United States. The fraternity's members are active on their campuses and in their communities, living out the organization's values of brotherhood, discipline, and commitment.

Delta Epsilon Psi continues to promote the advancement of South Asian culture, awareness of important social issues, and the development of leadership skills among its members. They continue to strive to make a difference in their communities and uphold the ideals upon which the fraternity was founded.
summary: Delta Epsilon Psi is a South Asian interest fraternity, founded in 1998, committed to fostering brotherhood, promoting leadership, and serving the community through cultural awareness and philanthropic initiatives such as Type 1 diabetes research.

name: Delta Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc
description: Delta Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc. is a 501(c)(7) non-profit organization that advocates Asian awareness and empowers women to lead through values-based programs and everlasting sisterhood. Delta Phi Lambda’s national philanthropy is osteoporosis education and prevention, emphasizing the importance of promoting healthy lifestyles and behavior in young women. Founded in 1998, Delta Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc. has grown to 25 undergraduate chapters in 16 states spanning the Southeast, Midwest, and the Northeast.
summary: Delta Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc.
