name: Delta Phi Omega Sorority, Inc.
description: The purpose of Delta Phi Omega shall be to foster unity among South Asian women, build community awareness, and gain a greater understanding of oneself and others. The sorority aspires to instill leadership traits, excel in all academic endeavors, to encourage an active relationship between the sorority and its respective university, and shall do so with the utmost compassion, dignity, and fortitude.
summary: Established in 1998, Delta Phi Omega has grown to over 50 chapters and colonies across the nation. We are one of the largest, strongest, fastest-growing sororities of its kind.

name: Delta Sigma Phi
description: Delta Sigma Phi at the University of Central Florida, is more than just a Fraternity- it's a lifelong brotherhood. A Delta Sig man is one of courage, action, and excellence. As one of the fastest growing Fraternities at UCF both by size and accomplishments, we push ourselves to become better men every day. If you are looking to make the most out of your collegiate career, Delta Sig is the place to go. Delta Sigma Phi: Better Men, Better Lives.
summary: Delta Sigma Phi is a social fraternity that was founded in 1899 and has been at UCF since 2011.

name: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
description:
On January 13, 1974 a group of women met with representatives of Florida Technological University (UCF’s former name) to determine which National Black sorority to affiliate with. By a majority vote meeting attendees decided they would affiliate with Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated. On May 16, 1975 the Mu Iota chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc., was chartered as the FIRST BLACK GREEK LETTERED ORGANIZATION of any kind on UCF’s campus.

The Sorority was founded in 1913 by 22 students at Howard University. These young women wanted to use their collective strength to promote academic excellence; to provide scholarships; to provide support to the underserved; educate and stimulate participation in the establishment of positive public policy; and to highlight issues and provide solutions for problems in their communities. 

The major programs of the sorority are based upon the organization's Five Point Programmatic Thrust:

  • Economic Development
  • Educational Development
  • International Awareness and Involvement
  • Physical and Mental Health
  • Political Awareness and Involvement
summary: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. is a private, non-profit organization whose purpose is to provide assistance and support through established programs in local communities throughout the world.

name: Delta Tau Delta
description: Delta Tau Delta is rich in history. Founded in 1858 in what is now West Virginia, Delta Tau Delta has stood the test of time. It has survived two world wars, a Great Depression and a great recession, the boom of undergraduates brought on by the G.I. Bill, and the reduction of Fraternity membership following the Vietnam War. If you decide to join Delta Tau Delta, you can feel comfort in knowing that more than 150 years of history and tradition will be there to greet you.
summary: .The mission of Delta Tau Delta is to be “Committed to Lives of Excellence” through our fundamental principles of Truth, Courage, Faith and Power.

name: Delta Zeta
summary: The women of Delta Zeta Sorority share a common purpose to make life fuller, more meaningful, and more rewarding by living through our three core values-- Sisterhood, Scholarship, and Service.

name: DermaGlow
description:
The mission of DermaGlow is to help students learn more about Dermatology's medical and beauty aspects. This program is for undergraduate students interested in various fields within Dermatology, including clinical practice.

https://linktr.ee/UCFDermaGlow?utm_source=linktree_profile_share&ltsid=2ced91b9-46ca-4453-b65b-9c39cbf700fd

name: Design & Code
description:
Our goal at Design & Code is to spread the word about web design and development. With industries today demanding more technical skills, we want to give everyone the opportunity to learn more about these topics and even expand on any previous knowledge. Some of the skills that we go over include:

  • UX/UI Design
  • Front-End Development
  • Back-End Development

Along with the subjects that we cover, we also offer engaging workshops, insightful guest speakers, opportunities to build projects with others, and a community built upon a passion for creating a better digital world for tomorrow.
summary: Design & Code is a club that specializes in web design, including art, programming and everything in between.

name: Diversified Greek Council
description:
On behalf of the Diversified Greek Council (DGC) and Greek Community, we would like to congratulate you and welcome you to the University of Central Florida! Your journey is just beginning and there is so much our university offers and one of the greatest opportunities is to become members of the Greek Community. We are excited to celebrate our 25 years with you all!

In the spring of 1999, DGC was created and was established as a council for culturally diverse Greek letter organizations. We pride on being an inclusive council whose mission is to promote scholastic excellence, cultural awareness, and community engagement. Currently we are home to nine different sororities and fraternities, each promoting diversity and spreading cultural awareness!

Although DGC does not have a formal recruitment period, DGC hosts an informational event called “Cultural Fair” at the beginning of Fall & Spring semester that allows students to meet our community, learn more about our chapters and values. We also host the "DGC Yardshow" towards the end of the semester where you can witness our traditions such as saluting, stepping and strolling.

We know you’ll find the home you’re looking for and we wish you a great year. Check out our Instagram @dgcucf for more information on our chapters and if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at dgc@ucf.edu !

We can’t wait to meet you and the legacy you’ll make here.
summary: In the spring of 1999, the Diversified Greek Council (DGC) was created on the campus of the University of Central Florida. It was established as a council for culturally diverse Greek letter organizations. We are currently home to nine organizations!

summary: Mission: Promote the professional development of doctoral level graduate students in clinical psychology; Provide a liaison between the students, faculty, and administration; Increase the spirit of cohesion between the university and the community

name: Dominican Student Association
description:
The Dominican Student Association at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment where students with roots in the Dominican Republic can feel a strong sense of community. Our mission is to provide a "home away from home" for individuals who share a connection to Dominican culture, creating relationships that are built on pride, unity, and support. Through exciting activities, cultural events, academic initiatives, and volunteer work, we aim to not only celebrate our heritage but also give back to the community while promoting academic and personal growth. We are a family committed to preserving and sharing the richness of Dominican culture, and what better way to celebrate than to be a part of DSA.

¡Qué orgullo ser Dominicano!
summary: The Dominican Student Association is dedicated to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment where students with roots in the Dominican Republic can feel a strong sense of community, support, and pride!

name: Downtown Student Life
summary: This student run board serves as a conduit for student to participate in co-curricular activities, campus advocacy, community engagement, and social justice on the of UCF Downtown and Valencia College Downtown campus.

name: Ecuadorian Student Association
description:
The Ecuadorian Student Association (ΣCSΛ) at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to promoting Ecuadorian customs, roots, and traditions among students while fostering personal growth and cultural awareness.

Our mission is to create a positive impact within the UCF community by educating others about Ecuador and its people while cultivating an inclusive and respectful environment that embraces diversity. We strive to achieve this through engaging events and activities that celebrate Ecuadorian culture and promote intercultural exchange.

If you are interested in becoming a member, please message us directly using the links below and we will provide you with the steps for you to join.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ecsaucf/

Linktree: https://linktr.ee/ecsaucf
summary: The mission of the Ecuadorian Student Association is to unite UCF students and alumni in an academic, social and professional manner while promoting the Ecuadorian culture and history.

name: Egyptian Student Association
description:
The Egyptian Student Association, or ESA, aims to connect, support and unite Egyptian students at UCF, making them feel at home. This would be achieved through the connections that Egyptian students would come to make through club meetings, activites and events. ESA also hopes to serve as a guide to Egyptian students through connecting them to UCF activities and events. 

In addition, ESA hopes to spread Egyptian culture around UCF through various events and activites encouraging other UCF students to learn more about Egypt's rich culture.
summary: The Egyptian Student Association, or ESA, aims to connect, support and unite Egyptian students at UCF, making them feel at home. In addition, ESA hopes to spread Egyptian culture around UCF through various events and activites.

name: Electric Bike and Light Electric Vehicle Association
description:
The mission of the Electric Bike and Light Electric Vehicle Association (EBLEVA) is to spread awareness of the environmental, health, and accessibility benefits of cycling, e-biking, and light electric vehicle (LEV) use while promoting safe riding practices, and public advocacy for electric bicycle and light electric vehicle usage within the UCF community, and Florida’s public recreation areas.

The members of EBLEVA believe that e-bikes and light electric vehicles provide solutions for two of our society's greatest challenges -- improving public health, and promoting sustainable environmental conservation efforts. Through public education and advocacy and by establishing community and industry partnerships EBLEVA aims to expand awareness of the e-bike and light electric vehicle industry while demonstrating how e-bikes and LEVs can benefit individual health, and the State of Florida as part of our culture of outdoor recreation and eco-tourism.
summary: To spread awareness of the environmental, health, and accessibility benefits of cycling, e-biking, and light electric vehicle (LEV) use while promoting safe riding practices, and public advocacy for electric bicycle and light electric vehicle usage.

name: Emergency Management Student Association
description: The Emergency Management Student Association seeks to bridge the gap between Emergency Management from a classroom perspective and Emergency Management in the real world. We give students access to many resources including hands-on experience and networking opportunities within the field of Emergency Management.
summary: The mission of EMSA is to provide a means for continuing Emergency Management education outside the classroom; to supplement a student’s education, cultivate relationships between peers, and to continue to professionalize the academic field of Emergency

name: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Club
description:
Welcome to EMTC - the Emergency Medicine and Trauma Club! Are you ready to dive into the high-octane world of emergency medicine and trauma care? If you're passionate about fast-paced decision-making, community involvement, and precision under pressure, then you've found your tribe!

At EMTC, we're not just a club, we're a dynamic community of future medical professionals eager to explore the exhilarating realm of emergency medicine and trauma care. Here's what you can expect when you join us on this thrilling journey:

High-Intensity Learning: Get ready for an adrenaline-fueled ride as we delve into the heart of emergency medicine. From rapid-fire decision-making scenarios to hands-on cadaver labs, we're committed to providing you with the real-world skills and knowledge you need to excel in this fast-paced field.

Community Engagement: EMTC isn't just about mastering medical techniques; it's also about making a positive impact on the world around us. Through volunteering events and community outreach programs, we'll show you how to use your skills to give back and make a difference in the lives of others.

Informative Sessions: Curious about different pathways into the medical field, including opportunities in the military? Our informational sessions will cover everything you need to know, from educational requirements to career options, so you can chart your course with confidence.

Fun Exercises: Who says learning can't be fun? From interactive simulations to team-building activities, we believe in keeping things engaging and enjoyable as we explore the exciting world of emergency medicine and trauma care.

Certifications: Want to boost your resume and expand your skill set? We've got you covered with opportunities to earn certifications that will set you apart as a future leader in the field.

No Experience Required: Whether you're a certified health professional or just starting out on your journey, there's a place for you at EMTC. All you need is a strong work ethic, a passion for helping others, and a willingness to dive in headfirst.

New Club, New Adventures: As a new club, we're still finding our footing, but we're excited to grow and evolve with each and every member. So come join us as we embark on this exciting new chapter together!

Are you ready to unleash your inner hero and join us at EMTC? Come on out and discover the thrill of emergency medicine and trauma care with a community that's as passionate and dedicated as you are. We can't wait to welcome you aboard!

 

Join our GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97662475/URTa4w4t
summary: The mission of Emergency Medicine and Trauma Club is to Empower individuals with life-saving skills. Bridging gaps in emergency care through education, training, and community outreach. Committed to swift, effective response in critical situations.

name: Engineers Without Borders
description:
Welcome to the official Knight Connect page for EWB at UCF!

Our mission: Engineers Without Borders USA (EWB-USA) is a nonprofit humanitarian organization established to support community-driven development programs worldwide through partnerships that design and implement sustainable engineering projects, while creating transformative experiences that enrich global perspectives and create responsible leaders.

Our vision: EWB-USA's vision is a world in which the communities we serve have the capacity to sustainably meet their basic human needs. Today, more than two billion people lack access to the most basic things -- clean drinking water, adequate sanitation, reliable passage to local markets and more.

Join our GroupMe for more info: https://groupme.com/join_group/102377822/y9CKRCvY
summary: To partner with disadvantaged communities to improve their quality of life through implementation of environmentally sound and economically sustainable engineering projects, while developing internationally responsible engineering students.

name: Entomological Society of Central Florida
summary: The mission of the Entomological Society of Central Florida is to provide education to the public regarding the importance of insects in their natural environment.

name: Entrepreneurship Club
description:
The purpose of the club is to foster interest in entrepreneurship, improve methods and techniques of business management, help students create their own entrepreneurial ventures, encourage sound
and honest business practices in the pursuit of entrepreneurial opportunities, and develop long-lasting relationships among students, faculty, and the business community. We provide resources to
student entrepreneurs to help them succeed in their entrepreneurial ventures.
If you ever wanted to start your own business or learn more about the innovation process, Entrepreneurship Club is a great place for you to find support, advice, and community!

 

The best ways to keep in touch with us:
Follow us on Instagram: @ucf.ec
Sign up for our newsletter: https://ucf.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_6Ek4lRw387pDCR0
We regularly update those two, but aren't always active on Knight Connect. Feel free to email us at ucfentclub@gmail.com or DM us on Instagram if you have any questions.
summary:
The purpose of the club is to foster interest in entrepreneurship. We're focused on building a community of entrepreneurs along with providing valuable resources such as workshops, speaker series,
and networking events.

name: Epilepsy Awareness Club
description:
Founded in Fall 2022, the Epilepsy Awareness Club at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to spreading knowledge and awareness, while also providing support, to those affected by epilepsy - a disorder that is often overlooked and affects so many, especially right here on our college campus.

 

Through hosting our events and fundraisers on UCF campus, we are able to bring awareness to epilepsy, as well as raise donations to aid in informing and research.

 

The EAC is also committed to collaborating with other organizations outside of our home campus and act as representatives for the students at UCF.
summary: 1 in 10 people will have a seizure sometime during their lifetime, and 1 in 26 will develop epilepsy, with recurring seizures. The EAC is dedicated to spreading knowledge and awareness about a disorder that is often overlooked and affects many.

name: Equestrian Club at UCF
description: The Equestrian Club features three teams: Eventing, Hunt Seat, and Western. While each team is part of the club, they all compete separately. The club meets once a month to discuss horse shows, fundraisers, and volunteering events. We volunteer 3-5 times per year at local animal rescue facilities, horse farms, food shares, and more.
summary: The Equestrian Club features three teams: Eventing, Hunt Seat, and Western. While each team is part of the club, they all compete separately. The club meets once a month to discuss horse shows, fundraisers, and volunteering events.

name: Esports at UCF
description:
At Esports at UCF we have the following goals:

  • To create a professional environment for student competitors. Currently, the most successful business model in the world of esports is the Esports Organization. This is what we will try to model ourselves after unless a better format is discovered. We aim to include and support teams across a variety of competitive video game titles, and promote professionalism and ethical conduct amongst our members.
  • To create an inclusive environment for everyone. We will include and support community members of all backgrounds and skill levels. We make sure to provide a variety of events and opportunities in order to keep people engaged and involved no matter what they joined the community for.
  • To establish a brand. We will promote our program, our teams, our events, and our community using every method available to us. This will include social media, securing sponsors, and improving our standing within the school.
  • To grow the competitive gaming community at UCF. We are aware that there are many students here at UCF who are interested in esports in some way, whether they are looking to become involved as a player, coach, manager, photographer, or simply an avid fan. We will become the hub for the esports community here at UCF, giving all interested students a place to come together and develop their skills and build relationships.

Click here to get involved!
summary: Esports at UCF is the official sport club for competitive gaming at the University of Central Florida. We take pride in providing our wonderful community with teams to cheer for, events to enjoy, new friends to meet, and more every week!

name: Every Nation Campus
description:
Every Nation Campus (ENC) is a church-based campus ministry that exists in over 80 nations around the world. We are multicultural, multiethnic, and we exist to honor God, love life, and make disciples.

We have weekly services with a message, monthly worship, life groups all throughout the week, and evangelism all year long! 


To find out more information on our meeting time and location, please refer to our Instagram @ENC_UCF
summary: ​Every Nation Campus at the University of Central Florida

name: Exercise is Medicine at UCF
summary: The mission of Exercise is Medicine at UCF is to promote physical activity as a vital sign of health and encourage the campus community to work together to improve health and well-being on campus through education, programs, and research.

name: FACES Modeling Troupe, Inc.
description: Each semester, FACES coordinates a unique fashion show that is sure to captivate and stimulate our community.FACES Prides itself of respect, individuality, family unity, dedication and most of all aiming for academic merit.
summary: Each semester, FACES coordinates a unique fashion show that is sure to captivate and stimulate our community.FACES Prides itself of respect, individuality, family unity, dedication and most of all aiming for academic merit.

summary: Fanm Kreyol Inc is a sisterhood that empowers Haitian women and strives to make an impact within the community and Haiti.

name: Fashion Society @ UCF
description:
What is Fashion Society?

We are an all inclusive club that is determined to create a safe space for any and all student creatives interested in the fashion industry. Our focus is on creating a judgement free zone and in making a positive difference within the industry, giving students of all majors the opportunity to dive into a successful career in fashion. We specialize in 9 main committees being Beauty, Design, Modeling, Photography, Production, Social Media, Styling, Web Design, and Zine. All of these committee work together throughout the year in order to produce a professional fashion show in the spring semester!

 

 About the Committees

Each committee focuses on a different area within the industry where members are given a creative space to work on their craft, together they demonstrate that the fashion industry is often a team of creatives. 

Design Committee: responsible for half of the outfits for our spring fashion show. This committee focuses on starting from a design sketch that comes to life through methods such as sewing, knitting, crocheting, etc.

Styling Committee: responsible for half of the outfits for our spring fashion show. This committee focuses on sourcing clothing pieces to create members' unique sketches.

Photography Committee: responsible for capturing the creative concepts for the chosen theme of the show. This committee includes all photographers and videographers who are looking to increase their portfolio and skillset with opportunities for promo shoots, workshops, and shooting our final show. (you will also be working with the Zine committee in the Fall semester to create our mini magazine)

Modeling Committee: responsible for walking in our spring fashion show. You will be coached on creating your perfect walk and building your confidence on the runway. There will also be modeling opportunities in the form of photo shoots. 

Beauty Committee: responsible for all makeup and hair looks needed for our spring fashion show and any promotional shoot done for the club.

Production Committee: responsible for all production works to ensure smooth operation of all fashion society events, most importantly our spring show. This includes creating the playlist for the show, coordinating all guests and models for the show, and maintaining our Eventbrite page for all merch/ticket sales.

Social Media Committee: responsible for maintaining our Instagram and TikTok accounts. This committee will be in charge of taking behind the scene pictures at all events, managing our Google Drive for all photos, and creating all posts/captions on strict timeline.

Website Design Committee: responsible for coding and creating our website where all our events, photos, and updates will be posted. This committee also will be updating the website as the year progresses, and you will act as a liaison between the website developers and the other committees for content.

Zine Committee: responsible for creating our mini magazine, from organizing photo shoots (with the help of Photography committee) to collecting student works to designing spreads. **NOTE: this committee is ONLY working in the fall semester. This will give you the opportunity to also work on the show in the spring semester.

Committees often participate interactively via sewing or DIY workshops, club-wide photoshoots, socials, and more! 

If you have any questions, please DM us on Instagram: @fashionsocietyucf. Be sure to follow our socials for any/all club updates!
summary: We are an all inclusive club that is geared toward creating a safe space for student creatives that find interest within the fashion industry. Our focus is on creating a judgement free zone and in making a difference within the industry.

name: Fellowship of Christian Athletes
description: Our goals would be to establish Bible studies, or “huddles” that are available to all coaches and all athletes throughout UCF’s sport programs (UCF Athletics, Club Sports, and Intramural Sports). We will do this by Engaging the hearts of coaches and athletes with the Good News of Jesus, the Christ, Equipping those coaches and athletes to do the same, and Empower them to lead others who will lead others!
summary: To lead every coach and every athlete into a growing relationship with Jesus Christ and His Church.

name: Figure Skating Recreational Club at UCF
description: The Figure Skating Club at UCF is designed to include all levels of skaters in the art and sport of figure skating. We strive to inspire students and help each other learn and grow creatively, athletically and socially in skating.
summary: The mission of the Figure Skating Club is to foster enjoyment and inspire a passion for skating. We exist to create opportunities for participation and accomplishments in figure skating.

name: Filipino Student Association
description:
The Filipino Student Association (FSA) at the University of Central Florida is a non-profit organization that promotes the Filipino culture throughout the UCF campus and throughout the community of central Florida. FSA promotes itself by holding meetings and hosting and attending a variety of events such as: Open Mic Knight, Def Talent Jam, Field Day, Sayaw, and Formal. We hope to reach out to the diversified community at the University of Central Florida and to encourage all students and faculty to attend our meetings and various events, as we stay committed to our slogan, "Your Home Away From Home."

Our mission is to unify the Filipino student community and other student communities by creating and maintaining a network of information and resources to understand Filipino heritage and to encourage a positive understanding of the Filipino culture.

If you are new, scroll down to our documents section to read up about membership and upcoming dates!
summary: The Filipino Student Association (FSA) at the University of Central Florida is a non-profit organization that promotes the Filipino culture throughout the UCF campus and throughout the community of central Florida.

name: Film & TV Producers Guild at UCF
description: The objective of the Film Producers Guild at UCF is to assist students in successfully executing creative projects through the development of project management skills, professional demeanor, producing and organizational skills. Our organization will also serve as a network for students in need of a producer for their productions.
summary: The mission of Film Producers Guild at UCF is to serve as a resource for the practice and application of entertainment producing skills in an academic and professional environment.

name: Filming on a Budget
summary: The mission of Filming on a Budget is to Give students an opportunity to work on funded films and submit the finished works to local film festivals under the club’s name.

name: Financial Forecasting Club
description: Our goal is to create a group of individuals passionate about financial markets and investing who can come together and collaborate on creating financial models and forecasts to expand their knowledge on financial forecasting and investing while helping others learn as well. We are currently trying to build a good group of members and will start having meetings and events in the fall semester.
summary:
A space for those to wish to expand their knowledge in the world of investing through collaboration on financial models and forecasts.

name: Financial Knights Association
description: The Financial Knights Association is dedicated to preparing UCF students for elite finance careers, including but not limited to investment banking, equity research, sales and trading, and private equity. We aim to connect students with industry leaders, providing the technical skills, mentorship, and exposure needed to excel in these competitive fields. Our goal is to equip students with the knowledge and experience necessary to thrive in high finance roles.
summary: The Financial Knights Association recognizes academic excellence among finance majors, offering mentoring and professional opportunities with a focus on numerous high finance careers, particularly through exposure to Wall Street firms.

name: Financial Management Association
description:
The Financial Management Association at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to providing business students with the opportunity to develop professionally through workshops, conference trips, networking events, and hosting weekly professional speaker events.

For the latest news and updates, check out our

Website: https://www.fmaknights.com/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fmaknights/

If you are interested in joining, show up to one of our Wednesday meetings in the Fall & Spring semesters (7:30-8:30 p.m; Location TBD) (everyone gets 1 free meeting before they have to pay dues).

If you have any questions, please reach out to Zach Simpson, Director of Membership at fma.ucf.membership@gmail.com for assistance.
summary: The Financial Management Association at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to providing the student body with the opportunity to develop professionally through workshops, conference trips, networking events, and hosting weekly speaker events.

name: First Generation Medicine
description: The mission of First Generation Medicine is to provide first-generation students with the tools necessary to become impactful leaders within the field of medicine (e.g., physician, dentist, nurse, PT, PA). First Gen. Med. empowers members through mentorship, volunteering, experiential learning, and more. Ultimately, our mission is to foster a diverse community that leads to personal and professional growth for our leaders of tomorrow.
summary: To provide guidance to first-generation students interested in pursuing a career in the medical field with a focus on promoting academic success, professional development, community service, and leadership skills.

name: First Love Church
description:
First Love Church UCF is part of the First Love Church, a vibrant, youthful Christian ministry founded by Bishop Dag Heward-Mills in Ghana. First Love is passionate about Jesus, soul-winning, and serving God wholeheartedly. The movement started with university students and has grown into a global church with thousands of members.

At UCF, we continue this mission by creating a welcoming space for young people to grow in faith, encounter God through worship, and be empowered by His Word. Our services and fellowship provide an opportunity for students to experience God’s love, deepen their relationship with Christ, and actively share the gospel on campus.
summary: First Love Church is a vibrant Christian fellowship rooted in soul-winning, worship, and the Word of God. As part of the global First Love Church, we create a welcoming space for students to grow in faith, encounter Jesus, and share His love on campus.

name: First Person View Knights
description:
The mission of First Person View Knights is to give UCF students a place to learn, design, and fly multi-rotor aircraft. We represent and place the University of Central Florida at the forefront of the Collegiate and Competitive Drone Racing scene.

Goals:

  • To introduce students to the realm of multi-rotors.
  • To further the knowledge of those already in the hobby.
  • To represent the University of Central Florida in the collegiate and general racing scene.

Join our Discord for more information!

Promotional Video
summary: The mission of First Person View Knights is to give UCF students a place to learn, design, fly, and research multi-rotor aircraft.

name: First Step
description:
First Step aims to fight against the stigma that underclassmen (especially freshmen) are not suitable candidates to obtain an internship. Many underclassmen think that they are "not experienced enough" when in reality, they may have just as much experience or just as good of a resume as upperclassmen. First Step believes that underclassmen are capable of achieving such positions and are just as ready for such learning and technical applications as underclassmen are. It is the idea that the underclassmen have time to accomplish their goals that "justifies" them to wait until they are juniors or seniors to get internships/research experience that mentally blocks the first years from thinking that they can achieve greatness within their first year of university.

Underclassmen have the capability of excelling in the industry as they stand. First Step hopes to inspire and lead them to all of the opportunities that are available through an engineering and computer science mentorship program. Here, members are grouped with peer mentors who have obtained research and/or internship experience in their early undergraduate semesters.
summary: First Step is an organization for mentorship of engineering and computer science students. Underclassmen will have he opportunity to be paired up with mentors who have gained research and/or internship experiences in their early undergraduate semesters

name: Flag Football Club at UCF
description: The flag football club provides opportunity for students to become more involved in the sport of flag football on the UCF Campus. We seek to teach students and athletes about the sport of flag football as well as provide a platform for those who played previously to continue playing. Members will be able to participate in practices, tournaments, social events, volunteering, and fundraising!
summary: Our goal is to provide a platform for women empowerment by building interest and endorsing participation in the sport of flag football.

name: Florida Engineering Society
description: To prepare engineering students of all disciplines for the high level of performance and responsibility that is required to succeed in today’s job market, while providing the opportunity to develop professional relationships with professional engineers, educators, and peers.
summary: To prepare engineering students of all disciplines for the high level of performance and responsibility that is required to succeed in today’ job market, while providing the opportunity to develop professional relationships with professional engineers.

name: Flute Club @ UCF
summary: The UCF Flute Club is an organization within the UCF Music Department comprised of students who have a mutual interest in music, its performance through the flute, as well as the education of music to others.

name: Forensic Science Association
description: Interested in Forensic Science? Join the Forensic Science Association! Members will have the chance to tour local law enforcement agencies, attend lectures and workshops with forensic professionals, learn about new forensic techniques, conduct interative experiments demonstrating forensic topics, and attend the American Academy of Forensic Science conference! Email us to be added to our list for more information about meetings, events, and more!
summary: The Forensic Science Association is a pre-professional organization at UCF that focuses on educating the Central Florida community about forensic science and providing support to forensic science majors by connecting them to incredible opportunities.

name: ForgetYouNot@UCF
description:
Mission

ForgetYouNot is dedicated to promoting community awareness about memory loss diseases, such as dementia and Alzhiemer’s disease through presentations, volunteering, research opportunities, and community outreach.

Purpose

Through a variety of opportunities and activities like the Art Therapy Program, students gain valuable knowledge about memory loss diseases, connect with others, and engage in meaningful community outreach. ForgetYouNot provides an educational and safe space for patients to find strength in a community of people who understand their challenges. We also offer members hands-on volunteer experiences and the chance to make a positive impact on individuals affected by these conditions.
summary: The mission of ForgetYouNot@UCF is to create community awareness about memory loss diseases, such as dementia and Alzhiemer’s disease through presentations, student volunteer and research opportunities, and community outreach.

name: Fraternity and Sorority Life
description:
At UCF we recognize 45 Greek organizations with a population over 3,000 undergraduate students.  Each organization offers something unique as they all share common values which lead to life-long bonds of friendship.  Greek organizations play a vital role in helping provide students with a wealth of experiences which complement the educational mission of the University.

How to Join

  • Must be a registered UCF student
  • Must have a minimum cumulative 2.5 high school or college GPA
  • Must be mutual selected by an organization through the recruitment process, for more information about how to join visit https://fsl.sswb.ucf.edu/how-to-join/

 

Councils

Greek Council

  • Serves as the unifying link between all chapters and councils and is responsible for annual Fraternity and Sorority Life events such as Greek Week, Greek Leadership Challenge, and Trick or Treat on Greek Street.

Diversified Greek Council (DGC) https://fsl.sswb.ucf.edu/diversified-greek/ 

  • DGC is comprised of 12 fraternities and sororities from a variety of cultural backgrounds and caters to those who want to get involved with others who share culture, beliefs, and interests. 

National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) https://fsl.sswb.ucf.edu/national-pan-hellenic/

  • NPHC is home to 9 historically African-American fraternities and sororities that foster brotherhood and sisterhood within the African-American community on campus.

Interfraternity Council (IFC) https://fsl.sswb.ucf.edu/interfraternity/

  • IFC consists of 13 organizations committed to enriching the collegiate and fraternity experience for over 1000 fraternity men on our campus.

Panhellenic Council (PAN) https://fsl.sswb.ucf.edu/panhellenic/

  • The Panhellenic Council consists of 12 women’s organizations who strive for excellence in every aspect to form an amazing community and enrich the lives of collegiate women.

Greek Park
Greek Park currently has 13 Greek facilities, with 3 houses being occupied by fraternities and 10 by sororities. Greek Park is a natural gathering spot for Greek students. A recent addition to Greek Park is the Office of Fraternity and Sorority Life Building.

Why Go Greek?

  • Academics:  All-Greek GPA averages are consistently/generally higher than the All-UCF GPA average
  • Leadership Opportunities: Members of the UCF Greek community are active in Student Government, President’s Leadership Council, Order of Pegasus, LEAD Scholars, Orientation Team, and Academic Honor Societies etc.        
  • Service and Philanthropy: Each year UCF Greeks log over approximately 80,000 hours of community service and collect over $645,000 for various local and national philanthropic organizations, and donate over 50,000 lbs. of food to local shelters
  • Social Life: Athletics and intramurals teams, sisterhood and brotherhood mixers and themed socials, formals and date functions.
summary: The mission of Fraternity and Sorority Life is to provide a quality and safe undergraduate fraternal experience that enhances student development through the active advising of student leaders.

name: Friends in Science
summary: The mission of Friends in Science is to provide a safe space for students in science majors. We will work on our mental health and well-being without any judgment.

description: Future Educators Association provides both professional development and social activities for individuals pursuing a career in education.

summary: Future Leaders of the Lodging Industry is a RSO on Rosen campus that aims to help students who wish to pursue a career in the lodging industry make connections in the industry, with guest speakers and site visits!

name: Future Technical Communicators
description:
Looking for a job after graduation? FTC can help!

The Future Technical Communicators (FTC) student organization here at UCF is dedicated to helping students pursue careers in technical communication. What exactly does that mean? We work together to master the skills we will need once we graduate to create any kind of documentation for technical processes. That can mean everything from writing instructions to designing user-friendly websites. This organization is primarily intended for students who are interested in pursuing careers in the technical communication field, although membership is open to students from all majors. 

 

Even if you are not familiar with the profession, technical communication might be the field for you! Do you have skills in any of these areas?

* Core skills in writing and editing

* Creative page design

* Photography and videography

* Technical illustration

* International communication

* Training and education

* Web and IT skills

 

Technical communicators serve as the bridge between technology and the outside world. We take complex information and make accessible and exciting! Technical communication spans many disciplines and the job market is huge. Unless technology stands still, it will always be a growth market. Since companies are beginning to realize that poor writing and poor communication hurt their bottom line, solving that problem taps into your core skills. There are over 45,000 technical writers in the U.S. alone!

 

FTC can also help you gain experience by obtaining an internship and part-time opportunities. Some of the companies include Lockheed Martin, Orlando Utilities Commision, Citrix, and many more. For additional employment opportunities please contact ucf.ftc@gmail.com or message us on one of our platforms. 

 

We are eager to see you at our next event! Make sure to connect with us on Discord, LinkedIn, and social media for more information.
summary: The Future Technical Communicators club (FTC) is dedicated to helping our members pursue careers in technical communication. We provide opportunities for networking, professional development, leadership, and more. Students of all majors are welcome.

name: Future Theme Park Leaders Association
description:
The Future Theme Park Leaders Association (FTPLA) is a professional student-run organization at the University of Central Florida's Rosen College of Hospitality Management. We strive to support the next and upcoming leaders in the theme park and attraction industry, worldwide. We do this by empowering our members to participate in numerous career building opportunities through networking with guest speakers in the industry, to visiting theme parks locally, nationally, and internationally. FTPLA witnesses incredible growth from its members through these career advancement opportunities. This has led to many members receiving internships and various, unique positions within our vast theme park industry by using skills garnered from FTPLA experiences.

 

 

FTPLA is the Rosen College's largest and longest running Registered Student Organization, and for more than 20 years, and many more to come, we plan to create waves and send ripples of leadership throughout the theme park industry.

 

 

FTPLA welcomes any and all students of the University of Central Florida- it's never too late to join the organization “for the thrill of it”
summary: The Future Theme Park Leaders Association (FTPLA) is a student-run organization at UCF's Rosen College of Hospitality Management focused on the study of the theme park and attraction industry for personal development and success for all of our members.

name: Game Development Knights
description:
Game Dev Knights (GDK) is a club all about preparing students with the skills they need to make games outside of the classroom. We hold one general body meeting at the beginning of the year, but overall we are an events-based club, hosting things such as workshops, socials, and speaker panels for our members to attend.

Check out our discord community! https://discord.gg/MMfdqExMVZ
summary: GDK assists the game development community at UCF by hosting Game Jams, guest speakers, industry networking, and hands-on professional experience. Check out our discord community! https://discord.gg/MMfdqExMVZ

name: Gamma Phi Beta
summary: To inspire the highest type of womanhood. We will build confident women of character who celebrate sisterhood and make a difference in the world around us.

name: GenCLEO@UCF
description:
Ready to turn your passion for the planet into real-world action? 🌍 Welcome to GenCLEO at UCF!

As a part of the renowned CLEO Institute, we're more than just a club; we're a movement dedicated to tackling the climate crisis through education, advocacy, and engagement. We empower students like you to organize and take meaningful climate action by combining social justice with science, respecting the Earth's limited natural resources, and providing hands-on training. You'll get unique opportunities to work with community leaders, engage with local and state government, and collaborate with other GenCLEO branches to create a more sustainable and just community, right here on campus and across Florida. 💚

Ready to be the change? Join our Discord and be part of the solution!

 

Join our Discord: https://discord.gg/S4YBdXZM
summary: The mission of GenCLEO is to promote climate education, advocacy, and engagement while working with community leaders to empower students to organize and take climate action.

name: Geotechnical Engineering Institute
description:
Mission

The mission of Geotechnical Engineering Institute is to provide an arena and organization to pursue, discuss, and collaborate research interests in an educational and constructive environment while developing leadership, interpersonal, and technical presentation skills required as a future professional geotechnical engineer.

Goals

  • Enhance awareness of the geotechnical engineering profession among students.
  • Provide an arena to discuss current events and new methodologies among peers.
  • Foster an exciting learning environment with a goal of professional development.
summary: GI seeks to pursue, discuss, and collaborate research interests in an educational and constructive environment while developing leadership, interpersonal, and technical presentation skills required as a future professional geotechnical engineer.

name: Gift of Life
description:
Please don't be afraid to reach out to us if you have any questions or would like to volunteer! We are always looking for new members. Join our Groupchat: https://groupme.com/join_group/60506953/WAN8xMCb

Gift of Life’s mission is to cure blood cancer through cellular therapy.

At Gift of Life we believe every person battling blood cancer deserves a second chance at life — and we are determined to make it happen. We are singularly passionate about engaging the public to help us get everyone involved in curing blood cancer, whether as a donor, a volunteer or a financial supporter. It all begins with one remarkable person, one life-changing swab and one huge win — finding a match and a cure.

On campus, our volunteers hold drives where we recruit young healthy donors to our registry who might one day have the amazing opportunity to voluntarily donate stem cells or bone marrow to a patient in need. Our work at UCF and other campuses has saved dozens of lives, and we are always looking for new volunteers to help us on this mission.
summary: Gift of Life’s mission is to cure blood cancer through cellular therapy. We hold donor recruitment drives to provide students with the opportunity to save lives by getting swabbed and added to our registry. If matched with a patient, they can donate.

name: Girl Up Orlando
description: Girl Up Orlando is an organization that strives to empower students by channeling their energy and compassion to raise awareness for the United Nations initiatives that help hard to reach adolescent girls. We want to bring together men and women from all different backgrounds to get involved and help out in whichever way they find suitable. We want to make sure that girls in developing countries are healthy, safe, educated, accounted for, and positioned to be the next generation of leaders through fundraising and advocacy.
summary: Girl Up Orlando is an organization that strives to empower students by channeling their energy and compassion to raise awareness for the United Nations initiatives that help hard to reach adolescent girls.

name: Girls Who Code at UCF
description:
Girls Who Code at UCF is dedicated to closing the gender gap in technology and computer science. Our goal is to inspire more girls to learn coding and pursue a career in the computer science field.

We value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We acknowledge that historical and institutional barriers—particularly racial bias and discrimination—play a role in the widening gender gap in computer science and who has access to opportunities in these fields. Girls Who Code focuses our work not only on gender diversity but also on young women who are historically underrepresented in computer science fields.

We want to provide our members with a safe space to learn, create and become part of a supportive community that will help them achieve their personal and professional goals.

Join our discord: https://discord.gg/9k8qtP7teX
summary: Girls Who Code at UCF's mission is to close the gender gap in technology and to change the image of what a programmer looks like and does. We welcome any student who wants to learn to code regardless of their programming background.

name: Glee Club at UCF
description: Glee Club at UCF is a non-competitive choir that meets weekly to rehearse group numbers and sing karaoke together. Our rehearsals culminate to our end-of-semester showcases where we show off all that our members have worked on for the past few months. Auditions are held every spring and fall so follow our Instagram for updates and check our KnightConnect page for more information on Glee events!
summary: Glee Club at UCF is a non-competitive choir that meets weekly to rehearse group numbers and sing karaoke together. Our rehearsals culminate to our end-of-semester showcases where we show off all that our members have worked on for the past few months.

name: Global Knights Society
description: The Global Knights Society is a club dedicated to easing the transition of life abroad for international students staying at UCF each semester. GKS is dedicated to ensuring every member feels welcome and connected within our organization. We host multiple events each semester that allow for members, our ambassadors, to bond with the exchange and learn about other cultures and norms. These events provide an opportunity to make life long, meaningful connections with people all across the world.
summary: The mission of Global Ambassador Program at UCF is to ease the transition of life abroad for international students participating in a study abroad program at the University of Central Florida.

name: Global Medical Brigades
description:
Global Brigades is the world’s largest student-led global health and sustainable development organization. Since 2004, Global Brigades has mobilized tens of thousands of university students and professionals through skill-based programs that work in partnership with community members to improve quality of life in under resourced regions while respecting local culture.

 

The mission of our Medical Brigade here in UCF is to provide comprehensive health care in rural communities with limited access to healthcare by having volunteers work alongside local licensed medical professionals. Our current focus is in Ghana, Honduras, Guatemala, Belize, Greece and Panama. Medical Brigade volunteers have the opportunity to shadow licensed professionals in consultations and assist in filling necessary prescriptions under the direction of a licensed pharmacists. Each of our partner communities receives a brigade every 3 to 6 months where hundreds of patients are provided one on one consultations, public health workshops, and given the proper medication or referral. Electronic patient records are collected through Data Informatics to monitor overall community health trends. Between brigades our in-country team maintains relationships with the communities to provide follow-up care and education. 

 

Volunteer brigade participation may vary based on the medical background and skill of the volunteer. Volunteers with little to no medical experience have the opportunity to assist during triage, shadow doctors during consultations, deliver educational workshops, and help pack medications under the supervision of a local pharmacist. All patient consultations as well as the prescribing of medications is done only by licensed doctors. Regardless of medical skill level, all volunteers contribute to the clinic. Furthermore, volunteers have the opportunity to learn about providing sustainable healthcare to rural communities who would otherwise have limited access.

 

To become a member fill out the following:

https://form.jotform.com/251405495897066
summary: Global Medical Brigades focuses on providing comprehensive health care in rural communities with limited access to healthcare by having volunteers work alongside licensed doctors, pharmacists, and dentists.

name: Global Medical Training University of Central Florida
description:
Global Medical Training (GMT) is an International Humanitarian Organization that provides free medical/dental services to medically deprived communities in Central American countries. Students will gain hands-on experience in a medical environment, observing and actively participating in patient care.

We HIGHLY recommend following us on Instagram for further updates: @ucfgmt
summary: Global Medical Training University of Central Florida organizes medical mission trips for undergraduate students in order to gain clinical experience while bridging the health care gap in marginalized communities.

name: Golden Key International Honour Society
description: Golden Key International Honour Society is the world’s largest international collegiate honor society for graduate and undergraduate students, and has strong relationships with over 400 universities around the world. Golden Key chapters are committed to implementing service projects and leadership development for all students on their campus. Members qualify when they are at the top 15% of their class, and are given access to a wide range of rewards, scholarships, travel and study abroad opportunities, and more.
summary: Golden Key strives to unlock the potential of each of its members by upholding standards of excellence on-campus and beyond. Elevated by our three pillars - Academics, Leadership, and Service - Golden Key sets the standard for achievement in these areas.

- Goals:

  1. Community: Embracing one other by sharing each other’s experiences and uplift one another’s circumstances
  2. Welcoming Environment: Celebrating and acknowledging different backgrounds and talents from all walks of life to bring a comforting environment to express themselves and help impact the community around us
  3. Personal Growth: Bettering each other’s decision-making skills with their walk with God, their career, relationships, finances, etc.
summary: The mission of Goodfellas is to help guide the men at UCF into the leaders that God called them to be by emphasizing community, promoting a welcoming environment amongst each other, as well as encourage personal growth.

name: Graduate Anthropology Association
description:
The mission of the Graduate Anthropology Association is to provide a setting where students can discuss current research topics in Anthropology and assist fellow classmates in conducting graduate level research.

The primary goals of the Graduate Anthropology Association will be to raise funds to assist graduate students in traveling to professional conferences, to hold public colloquiums with guest lecturers concerning current research topics in Anthropology, and to offer workshops that will be beneficial to Anthropology students. In addition, this group will work to provide undergraduate Anthropology students with opportunities to assist in graduate level research in Anthropology and mentoring.
summary: The mission of the Graduate Anthropology Association is to provide a setting where students can discuss current research topics in Anthropology and assist fellow classmates in conducting graduate level research.

name: Graduate Health Network
description:
The Graduate Health Network is a student organization on campus that strives to give one of a kind opportunities to students seeking a career in Healthcare Management. Each semester, we set goals to connect current health leaders to the needs of the current members that will enhance the understanding of their specific area of interest.

To balance out the ample amount of knowledge gained not only through our education through UCF but also the educational events on campus, GHN makes it a priority to have social and networking events each semester for all members and their guests to enjoy each others company, and foster a community within our MHA program here at UCF.

Don't miss out on a great opportunity for your career, or simply a great networking opportunity and join the Graduate Health Network TODAY!! Be sure to connect with us here through KnightConnect to become an official member and follow us on Social media to stay up-to-date with our upcoming events and activities!

Thanks for your interest in becoming a part of the Graduate Health Network, we’ll see you soon!
summary: The mission of the Graduate Health Network is to bring students in healthcare together who are interested in opportunities to develop their leadership skills while providing scholarship and networking opportunities in healthcare.

name: Graduate Student Association at UCF
summary: The mission of the Graduate Student Association UCF is to advocate, connect, and enrich graduate education and community through purposeful involvement, representation, and academic support.

name: Graduate Writers Association
description:
The Graduate Writers' Association (GWA) helps students transition from the university setting to a literary and professional career in the field of English. We offer options for you to create and participate in networking and professional development opportunities and can help you establish connections by sharing our knowledge of national literary organizations and more. The GWA provides you with funding to travel to the annual Association for Writers & Writing Program (AWP) national conference (and an additional regional conference) and other opportunities such as reading at our monthly PARCELS event. If you contribute $20 for annual dues, you will be included in our conference funding and invited to special professional and extracurricular events. The GWA represents a great, accessible way of getting involved on campus and becoming a professional in the field of English.

If you are interested in the GWA or have any questions about upcoming opportunities, we urge you to please contact the president at jordan.alexander@ucf.edu. Thank you so much—we are greatly looking forward to serving you!
summary: The Graduate Writers' Association (GWA) helps students transition from the university setting to a professional career in the field of English by designing and participating in networking and professional development opportunities.

name: Health Service Administration, Student Association
description:
Our Mission:

HSASA is an organization comprising students interested in pursuing careers in health care administration. The goal of our organization is to provide networking opportunities for students within the field. We invite professionals from various healthcare organizations to talk to our members about their careers as well as other pertinent healthcare topics. Also, we participate in numerous events throughout the year including socials, intramural sports, philanthropic events, and fundraisers.

 Any student, regardless of major or academic level, currently enrolled in classes at UCF may join our organization.

Please check the "Events" tab on the left-hand side to RSVP or to find out more information about upcoming philanthropic events and tour dates! Spaces are limited so please make sure to RSVP in advance.

For further information, contact hsasa@ucf.edu. To directly contact our president, Derric Esquivel, send an e-mail to de667145@ucf.edu.

Please direct all inquires and interest through our listed email
summary: Hearts for the Homeless Orlando seeks to contribute to the health and well-being of one of the most vulnerable populations in our nation through free blood pressure screening opportunities, general education, and outreach opportunities.

name: Her Campus UCF
description:
Her Campus UCF is a national online magazine for college women and professional development. We publish editorial and social media content on a weekly basis and hold campus wide events. At UCF, we have an editorial team, marketing team, social media team, and event planning team. Her Campus focuses on empowering college students, especially women, to feel confident about their academic career by creating a community on campus that helps develop social and professional skills needed to help you feel ready and confident in taking that next step toward your career.

At Her Campus UCF, you learn valuable skills, build your portfolio and resume, network with your peers and industry professionals and have the support of a national organization. At the same time you also become part of a close knit group of women right here at UCF. Beyond your individual team responsibilities, you will have the opportunity to participate in team bonding events as well as our on and off campus events. Follow us on Instagram (@hercampusucf) for application info, event updates, and more!
summary: Her Campus is the #1 online community for gen z, by gen z.  Written entirely by the nation’s top college journalists – with 3,000+ contributors and counting – HerCampus.com features national content on Style, Health, Love, Life, and Career.

name: Her Health
description: Her Health is an organization which aims to educate women about their reproductive health and rights, while promoting an inclusive space for all women. We attempt to de-stigmatize the talk surrounding women's sexual health by inviting speakers, such as gynecologists, and encouraging questions among participants in a judgement-free space. In addition, we give back to the community by hosting feminine hygiene product drives, and plan on partnering with like-minded RSOs on campus such as Period and PPGA.
summary: Her Health is an organization which aims to educate women about their reproductive health and rights, while promoting an inclusive space for all women. In addition, Her Health hosts seminars, drives, and community outreach events.

description:
Hola, mi gente! We are the Hispanic Student Association here at the University of Central Florida! As an RSO, our goal is to become a safe haven for all Hispanic students at UCF. We hope that they can find a home and community within the Hispanic Student Association, as we want them to be able to share the beauty that their cultures have to offer with no judgment. We also hope to share what each person has to offer culturally with the rest of the university so that everyone may gain knowledge and information. 

 

Follow us on Instagram @hsa.ucf for updates on meetings and other events!!

name: Holistic Living Organization
description:
HLO is a community of growth-oriented individuals who explore the connection of the mind, body, and soul through a holistic approach.

Our team vision stands to liberate the community of UCF from the single-dimensional approach to health which prevails in society today and to empower each other with the tools and natural solutions to break free from the shackles of mental, physical, social, and spiritual illness. 

 

We also encourage our community to individually keep their inner & outer environment clean so we can have space for more flow & growth.

 

We value OPENNESS: Open space, open mind, open heart

 

 

Discord: https://discord.gg/h6U9NApn

Instagram: ucfholisticlivingorg
summary: Explore a multidimensional approach to health through holistic tools and natural solutions, while building a community of growth oriented individuals in a safe space.

description:
We are the official Undergraduate Anthropology Club at UCF! We are passionate about anthropology and welcome anyone who shares this passion, no matter your major. We have lots of events throughout the semester, including anthropology trivia, movie nights, socials, museum tours, stone tool pumpkin carving, and more! Be sure to check back often for new events!

Also follow us on our socials below to keep informed on all the hominids action!

For more information, contact Jacob Gelman (President) at ja549890@ucf.edu or email us at hominidsanonymousucf@gmail.com! We are always happy to answer any questions you may have so please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Honors Congress
description: The Honors Congress exists to strengthen the Honors community by providing academic, volunteer and social outlets for Honors students. True excellence arises not from mere academics, but from a rounded character demonstrating a commitment to community involvement and integrity in all endeavors. With this in mind, the Honors Congress is committed to developing a diversified student body. The Honors Congress fosters a spirit of unity through the facilitation of social, academic and volunteer activities and cultivates a sense of community within The Burnett Honors College.
summary: Honors Congress is the official student organization of the Burnett Honors College.

name: HOPE @ UCF
description:
How to Join HOPE as a member: 

  1. Complete the 2025-2026 Membership Application
  2. Pay dues: Venmo, Credit, Debit, or PayPal. Click the links below! 

    $15 — 2 Semester HOPE UCF Membership

    $10 — 1 Semester HOPE UCF Membership 

    If you cannot use the above options, you can pay through cash at a general body meeting of HOPE.  
  3. Submit your request on Knight Connect to join as a member. 

Stay up to date: 

  • Follow on Instagram
  • Join on the HOPE GroupMe 

HOPE @ UCF was founded by two students who are passionate about peer support and preventing suicide. We believe that college can be an overwhelming time, and that we don’t have to go through it alone – through supporting one another, we become beacons of hope on our campus, in our friendships, in the workplace, and in the world. 

 

HOPE’s mission is to create a community where students of all backgrounds and fields of study feel supported, destigmatize conversations about mental health, build meaningful relationships, and engage in self-care and high-impact community service. 

 

A key goal of HOPE is for all of our members to take suicide prevention training, such as Question, Persuade, Refer (QPR), at least once during their time as a Knight! 

 

Our club offers: 

 

  • Mentorship program: Students are matched into groups of 3, with at least one upper-class student mentor. Each semester centers around a new theme related to mental health (self-care, volunteer service, building community, etc.) 
  • High impact volunteer opportunities: We prioritize opportunities where students gain hands-on experience with populations in need and serve their community in meaningful ways.  
  • Suicide Prevention Training: Our club hosts QPR sessions each semester and promotes opportunities in the community. 
  • Professional development events: We host guest speakers in the fields of psychology, mental health, and related fields for interactive workshops. 
  • Socials: Fun events for students to network, make friends, and practice self-care. 

Our goal is to unite students across professions who want to be mental health advocates in their communities.
summary: The mission of HOPE @ UCF is to to promote interprofessional-collaboration, advocacy, education, outreach, and service opportunities related to suicide prevention and mental health promotion.

name: Housing and Residence Life
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide residents with safe, inclusive housing communities that foster student success and well being through innovative living and learning opportunities.

name: Human Factors and Ergonomics Society - Student Chapter
description:
As the student chapter for the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society (HFES) at the University of Central Florida, we serve as the advocate and official representative of our members, and add to the prestige of our University and the discipline of human factors and ergonomics.  We strive to assist students with professional development, by providing unique networking opportunities, by bringing in guest speakers, and creating speaker panels for discussion.  Additionally, we disseminate information in order to increase awareness of human factors and ergonomics at the local, state, national, and international level.

Our organization provides a forum for discussion of issues relevant to human factors and ergonomics, in order to foster students' understanding and involvement within the field.  We assist our members in establishing and working toward achieving scientific, professional, and educational objectives based on tradition, innovation, and integrity.
summary: We are the UCF Student chapter of HFES.  Our goal is to facilitate discussion of our discipline, assist students with professional development, disseminate information, and to increase awareness of human factors and ergonomics.

We aim to deliver educational, training, and professional development resources to students around the country who are interested in pursuing a career in the newest branch of the US military.

name: Ice Hockey Club @ UCF
description:
Founded in 1997, the Knights Hockey program competes in Division II of the American Collegiate Hockey Association (ACHA) as a member of Collegiate Hockey South (CHS), and also represents the North American Collegiate Hockey League (NACHL). With 12 national championship appearances and two 3rd-place finishes, the team is recognized as both a successful and rapidly growing program.

The University of Central Florida Ice Hockey team is passionate about spreading the love of the game, not just on campus, but throughout the state of Florida. As professional hockey continues to thrive in the Sunshine State, interest in the sport at the collegiate level has grown alongside it.

As one of the top programs in Collegiate Hockey South, Knights Hockey prides itself on a commitment to excellence, competition, and community. The program offers players the opportunity to compete at a high level while building lasting relationships with teammates, coaches, fans, and supporters, fostering a family atmosphere that lasts a lifetime. Visit our instagram @icehockeyatucf and website https://www.knightshockeyatucf.com/ for more info!
summary: Founded in 1997, Knights Hockey has a proud history that includes more than ten National Tournament appearances and two 3rd Place finishes. Knights Hockey prides itself on its commitment to excellence in the sport of ice hockey and the close-knit family.

name: Impact Orlando
summary: The mission of Impact Orlando is to foster healthier lives internationally, through outreach, serving, education, and compassion.

name: Indian Graduate Student Association
description:
The goals and objectives of the Indian Graduate Student Club will be to cultivate the growth of international graduate students who may be interested in developing professional/social connections to enhance their technical, soft, and interpersonal skills through a professional environment.

To achieve our goals and objectives, we will be

  1. Promoting knowledge sharing from current students and alumni to the club members.
  2. Establishing a connection between current students and alumni.
  3. Serving as a mentoring body for new international graduate students admitted to the university.
  4. Promoting relationships between local business organizations and international graduate students.
  5. Providing the interested graduate students a platform to network with other graduate students professionally and socially through interaction and communication between fellow students and graduate faculty members.
summary: This club focuses on building a professional/social community amongst international graduate students and connecting them with UCF alumni.

name: Indian Student Association
description:
The Indian Student Association (ISA), a non-profit organization at the University of Central Florida, was established in 1995 with the goals and ideals of preserving and spreading the rich traditions and cultures of India. The Indian Student Association hosts a multitude of major events- such as Garba, Diwali, and Holi- and general body meetings (GBMs) to educate students at the University of Central Florida and the community about the unique cultures and practices of India. 

 

The mission of the Indian Student Association is to promote the cultures and social well-being of Indian- American students, international Indian students, and the Asian- American communities at the University of Central Florida.

name: Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers at UCF
description:
IEEE UCF is committed to advancing technology for the betterment of humanity. Our mission is to empower our members by fostering growth in engineering, computer science, professionalism, and community service.

 

Check out our website!

To get involved and stay informed about upcoming events, be sure to join our Discord community: Join our Discord

 

We offer a diverse range of technical workshops, covering everything from fundamental skills like soldering, microcontroller programming, and breadboarding, to advanced topics such as RISC-V computer architecture. These hands-on experiences are designed to equip students with the knowledge and confidence to excel in their fields.

 

At IEEE UCF, we continually challenge the limits of what student engineers can achieve, creating an environment where innovation and collaboration thrive. This year, we will be having eight unique projects that not only provide an enjoyable experience for our members but also significantly enhance their resumes.
summary:
The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers at UCF is your one-stop-shop for all things electrical & computer engineering, computer science, and industry oriented! 

Join us today to take advantage of all the benefits we will offer you

name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers - Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society at UCF
description:
Who We Are
Welcome to IEEE EMBS at UCF! We're the University of Central Florida's student chapter of the global IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Our community explores the intersection of engineering and healthcare, inspiring and empowering the next generation of biomedical innovators.

What We Do
At EMBS UCF, we offer a dynamic environment for students to dive into the vast and impactful field of biomedical engineering. Here's a glimpse of what we offer:

Projects:
Oxygen Concentrator Build! This fall, we're kicking off an exciting project to build a functional oxygen concentrator, providing hands-on experience in medical device design and development.
Workshops:
Gain practical skills with workshops covering topics like CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics), MATLAB, Machine Learning, and biosensors.
Guest Speakers & Networking:
Hear from leading professionals and connect with faculty, alumni, and industry leaders to explore career paths and opportunities.
Community:
Join a supportive and engaging group of students who share your drive and curiosity.

Who Should Join?
Anyone and everyone with a passion for innovation in healthcare! We welcome students from all majors—including Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Biology, Pre-Med, and more. If you're curious about how engineering can transform medicine and improve lives, EMBS UCF is the place for you.

Why Join Us?
Your time at UCF is a unique opportunity to shape your future. EMBS UCF offers you a platform to explore your passion, gain practical skills, expand your network, and make a difference in the healthcare field.

Join our Discord!
summary: The mission of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers - Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society at UCF is to advance biomedical engineering topics through hands-on projects, workshops, and collaborative initiatives and promoting innovation
