name: Interfraternity Council
description:
Proud to be one of the most encompassing and diverse organizations on campus representing over 1300 fraternity men, these members are held to a higher standard as we work together to build a better community and better men.
 
The UCF Interfraternity Council (IFC) is part of the North American Interfraternity Council (NIC). The NIC serves to advocate the needs of its members fraternities through enrichment of the fraternity experience; advancement and growth of the fraternity community and enhancement of the educational mission of the host institutions. The NIC is also committed to enhancing the benefits of fraternity membership.

At UCF, the Interfraternity Council consists of 12 active national organizations and is continuing to grow. All 12 organizations consistently go throughout their day exemplifying the university’s creed: Integrity, Scholarship, Community, Creativity, and Excellence. By thinking of these integral aspects of our university, each member of a fraternity in the Interfraternity Council will actively take part in philanthropic activities, community service, educational seminars and conferences, as well as social gatherings with other peers among the school.
summary: Representing 12 fraternities and over 1200 fraternity men, these members are held to a higher standard as we work together to build better men, better leaders, and a better community.

name: International City/County Management Association
description:
Please visit the following websites for more information on our affiliates:
 
ICMA - http://icma.org/en/icma/home
FCCMA - http://fccma.org/ICMA 
 
Mission:
 
ICMA at the University of Central Florida is a pre-professional student organization that strives to create excellence in local governance by developing students into public sector professionals. This will be accomplished through professional development, community outreach and teamwork.
 
 
Vision:
 
      Our vision is to impact the local community by developing students into future public sector professionals who value integrity, collaboration and community outreach.
 
 
Goals:
      
     To foster professional growth by:
                  - Promoting the exploration of local public administration careers through a speaker series and internship
                    opportunities.
                  - Building professional skills and preparation through workshops.
                  - Providing opportunities to network and connect with those currently working in local government through events.
                  - Providing opportunities for public service through community outreach initiatives in collaboration with local                               governments and other organizations.
summary: Join us at ICMA UCF and unlock your potential as a future leader in public service. Gain exclusive access to networking, career development, and real-world experiences that make an impact on your community and prepare you for success beyond UCF.

name: International Medical Outreach
description:
International Medical Outreach (IMO) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that is dedicated to the provision of service and education to underserved communities across the globe. Through efforts in education and volunteering, our mission hopes not only to improve upon the sustainability and efficacy of medical care in the areas we serve, but to instill in our members an ethos of multiculturalism and medical altruism that shall continue throughout their lives. By means of our members and mission, we hope to leave a lasting legacy of medical care, service, and compassion within all of the areas we serve.

Four times a year, our members have the opportunity to serve as part of a team on medical volunteer trips to various countries. On these trips, we are able to provide free medical care through the setup of pop-up clinics, aid in educating for children of the communities we serve, run donation drives, and develop presentations on health education to address the needs of the community. Our members provide assistance to physicians and other allied health professionals in both rural and urban clinics. Our efforts span over various underserved communities in Haiti, India, Colombia, Perú, Brazil, and Puerto Rico; where we have fortunately witnessed positive change on numerous accounts. 

Please email president@imoucf.org for more information!
summary: IMO is a student-run non-profit organization whose mission is to provide sustainability, cultivate medical and cultural awareness, and foster cross-cultural connections by embarking on international and local service trips.

name: International Relations Club
description:
The International Relations Club (IRC) focuses on providing members with academic and professional development for students at UCF. IRC's community helps one another learn about the various countries in the world, the greatest challenges facing international relations, and analyzes the future of international politics. Members are encouraged to ask questions, critically think about current events, and investigate why countries will do what they do and how to solve daunting challenges facing the world.

Feel free to check out our social medias for club updates

Instagram: @ucf.irc

Discord Group  (https://discord.gg/dwb32Xjv23)
summary: Do you love international politics and keeping up with current events? Does your five-year plan involve going to a foreign country and changing the world? Are you looking for ways to advance your career, travel, network, and make friends? Then join IRC!

name: International Student Association
description:
The International Student Association (ISA) is a diverse cultural entity at UCF. Our main mission is to unite all the diverse cultures around campus and promote awareness, understanding, and acceptance, while supporting international students as they get accustomed to the American life. 

ISA serves as hub for social interaction and cultural events, networking, skill building, and as an academic resource where international students may come together and connect with UCF students both foreign and local. We not only embrace, but celebrate cultural traditions, allowing students to feel a sense of home here at UCF. Our goal is to promote togetherness, unity, friendship, and diversity.
summary: The mission of ISA is to provide support to international students who are far from home; to connect with each other; to educate one another about variations and similarities among our cultures, while embracing our diversity.

name: Investment Club
description:
Investment Club @UCF is committed to provide students with hands-on experience in financial markets, portfolio management, and investment strategies, while fostering professional development through managing a student-run investment portfolio. Our goals include educating members on investment strategies and risk management, offering opportunities to apply theoretical knowledge in real-world settings, managing our student-run portfolio, hosting networking events with industry professionals, and encouraging collaboration and discussion on market trends and economic developments.

FIRST MEETING: September 8th, 2:30-3:00pm, SU221 (Student Union)

For Inquiries Email: ucfinvestmentclub@gmail.com

We are an organization heavily focused on the educational enrichment of Jamaican youths through our annual school supplies drive philanthropy. We are here to bring an authentic Jamaican experience to the UCF Campus. By joining JAMSA at UCF you will be offered a plethora of leadership opportunities and development plus a whole heap a fun!

name: Japanese Culture Club
description:
Welcome to the Japanese Culture Club at UCF!

 

We’re a club for appreciators of Japanese culture—both traditional and contemporary, niche and pop!

 

We provide educational programming to the student body through cultural presentations and activities. You can find us hosting events, tabling, attending workshops, volunteering, or just hanging out at Japanese-inspired spots!

 

 

Become a member and get access to our Discord server!

 

Keep in touch with us on our socials!

Instagram

Reddit
summary: The Japanese Culture Club welcomes Knights to learn about and appreciate the culture of Japan—both traditional and contemporary, niche and pop!

name: Japanese Heritage Student Association
description:
The mission of Japanese Heritage Student Association is to bring together students of Japanese heritage and build a community of like-minded students who may otherwise feel disconnected from their cultural background. Our goals include:

  • Community - Our primary goal is to facilitate a safe space for students of Japanese heritage to socialize and connect with one another.
  • Cultural Connection - Encourage members to connect/reconnect with Japanese culture and language by hosting relevant cultural activities.
  • Inclusivity - Although we are a club aimed for Japanese students, we strive to make our events inclusive to everyone and to share our culture with anyone who is interested.
  • Collaboration - we hope to collaborate with other related organizations and become a part of a larger network of Japanese and other Asian communities.
  • Longevity - JHSA aims to be a continued safe space for all Japanese students present and future.

 

よろしくお願いします。
summary: The mission of Japanese Heritage Student Association is to bring together students of Japanese heritage and build a community of like-minded students who may otherwise feel disconnected from their cultural background.

name: Japanese Language Club
description:
About the Japanese Language Club - 日本語部活について

Japanese Language Club (JLC) is a UCF student club for learners of the Japanese Language. With a large emphasis on real practice and community building, JLC stands as a place for all levels of Japanese learners to get together and encourage each other to reach fluency!

Real Practice

With weekly General Body Meetings as well as Kaiwa Table (Japanese Conversation Table), we hold frequent events in which Japanese learners can practice reading real native content and communicating through real-world scenarios. On top of this, several "special" GBMs are held in which learners can test their skills while participating in a fun activity!

Community

With the goal of bringing UCF's Japanese-learning community together, JLC holds fun social events themed around the Japanese language several times throughout the semester. We have several staple events, including Karaoke Night, Arcade Night, Orlando Japan Festival, Potluck, and Movie Night.

At JLC, there is something for everyone, and all language levels are welcome!

 

All announcements take place in the JLC Discord. Join now!

<JLC DISCORD>
summary: A club for studiers and enjoyers of the Japanese Language, with weekly meetings, study sessions, practice sessions, and external events to bring the Japanese language-learning community at UCF together.

name: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity Inc.
description:
• To unite college men of culture, patriotism, and honor in a bond of Fraternity;
  • To encourage honorable achievement in every field of human endeavor;
  • To promote the spiritual, social, intellectual, and moral welfare of members;
  • To assist the aims and purposes of Colleges and Universities;
  • To inspire service in the public interest.

name: Kappa Alpha Theta Fraternity
description: Founded in 1870 at Indiana Asbury (now DePauw University) in Greencastle, Ind., Kappa Alpha Theta is the first Greek-letter Fraternity known among women. In creating Kappa Alpha Theta, our founders were leading the way for women’s groups and for women in higher education. Our members are women of all ages: women who attended college in nearly every US state and Canadian province, women who live all over the world, and women with varied professions, faiths, and ethnic backgrounds.
summary: Kappa Alpha Theta (ΚΑΘ), also known as Theta, is an international fraternity for women founded on January 27, 1870 at DePauw University, formerly Indiana Asbury. Kappa Alpha Theta was the first Greek-letter women's college fraternity.

name: Kappa Delta Sorority
description: Kappa Delta Sorority's Epsilon Omicron chapter at the University of Central Florida is dedicated to fostering confidence and inspiring action among its members. The sorority emphasizes values such as integrity, honor, and lifelong friendship, providing a supportive environment for personal and professional growth. As part of UCF's Panhellenic Council, Kappa Delta actively participates in various campus activities, including philanthropic events, community service, and leadership development programs. Kappa Delta's philanthropic efforts focus on supporting Prevent Child Abuse America (PCAA) and the Girl Scouts of the USA, reflecting their commitment to community service and empowerment.
summary: Kappa Delta is a National Organization that inspires its members to reach their potential by offering opportunities for leadership, personal development, academic success and community service, all in the context of true friendship.

name: Kappa Kappa Gamma
description: Kappa Kappa Gamma is an organization of women, which seeks for every member throughout her life bonds of friendship, mutual support, opportunities for self-growth, respect for intellectual development, and an understanding of and an allegiance to positive ethical principles.
summary: Dream Boldly, Live Fully.

name: Kappa Kappa Psi Fraternity Eta Sigma
description: We, the brothers of Kappa Kappa Psi, believe that service to the college or university band program fosters responsibility, loyalty, and leadership; that a spirit of brotherhood is enhanced by the participation in a band program; that music is a universal language and truly the greatest of the arts; and that through fraternal participation, each member will strive for the highest.
summary: To Serve, To Lead, To Honor, To Strive.

name: Kappa Pi International Honorary Art Fraternity
description:
Mission

The mission of this society will be to form bodies of representative students who will, by their influence and artistic interests, uphold the highest ideals of a liberal education; to provide a means whereby students with artistic commitment meet for the purpose of informal study and communications; to raise the standards of productive artistic work among the students in the colleges and universities; to furnish the highest reward for conscientious effort in furthering the best interest of art in the broadest sense of the term, by election to membership in the society, based upon such meritorious work.

Goal

Our goal is to offer art students a society of like minded individuals in which success, talent, creativity and scholarship can be nurtured and grown. A place where students with a similar passion for the visual arts can enjoy the excursions, lectures, exhibitions and companionship that comes from being part of a group of purpose driven peers.
summary: We are an Art Honors Society that brings together exemplary art students to further their knowledge of the arts and strengthen their bonds with their peers through extracurricular activities and excursions.

As a values-based fraternity, it firmly opposes hazing and prioritizes a positive college experience through progressive membership development and education. This focus on personal growth and meaningful relationships empowers members to become impactful leaders and active community contributors, fostering lifelong friendships and essential skills that last beyond their college years.
summary: The Most Popular Fraternity in the World. A strong brotherhood built on the pillars of Scholarship, Leadership, Fellowship, and Service.

name: Kendo Club @ UCF
description:
Kendo, meaning "Way of The Sword", is a modern Japanese martial art of sword-fighting based on traditional samurai swordsmanship, or kenjutsu. Kendo is a physically and mentally challenging activity that combines strong martial arts values with sport-like physical elements.

 

Practice times for Spring 2025:

Practices begin Tuesday, January 21st

Tuesday/Thursday 9:30pm-11:30pm

Sunday 1:00-3:00pm

 

 

Practice will be held in the Group Exercise Studio 2 in the RWC (main gym).  
This room is located on the bottom floor of the RWC near the indoor basketball/volleyball courts.

Wear clothes that are easy to move in and breathable, or if you have hakama and gi make sure you wear it to every practice. Please show up at least 15 minutes early so you can change and practice can start on time. Make sure you eat and drink plenty of water before practice.

Can't wait to see you all there!

 

Please sign up on IMLeagues and complete the Sport Club Acknowledgement Statement and Concussion Policy before attending the first practice.

 

 

Feel free to join our club's discord server to stay up to date: https://discord.gg/4dTsMTzZT8
summary: Kendo, meaning "Way of The Sword", is a modern Japanese martial art of sword-fighting based on traditional samurai swordsmanship, or kenjutsu. Kendo is a physically and mentally challenging activity that combines strong martial arts values with sport-l...

name: Kinesiology Graduate Student Association
description: This organization will serve as a unified meeting ground for Undergraduate, Masters and PhD students in the program of Kinesiology at UCF, to learn about research, job and presentation opportunities in our field. We hope to hold public research forums, offer research demonstrations and help raise funds for graduate students to attend and present at professional conferences.
summary: The mission of the Kinesiology Graduate Student Association is to provide a forum where graduate students can discuss current research topics in Kinesiology and assist fellow classmates and undergraduate students in conducting graduate level research.

name: Knight Hacks
description:
We are Knight Hacks, UCF's Hackathon and Software Development RSO. Throughout the year, we immerse our members in tech by holding multiple workshop series, mentorship programs, and project competitions. Most importantly, we hold our annual Knight Hacks Hackathon for hundreds of students from throughout the nation, where we get participants excited about the industry and host a platform to interact with our sponsor companies. 

Want to get involved? Register for membership on Blade: https://blade.knighthacks.org
summary: We are Knight Hacks, UCF's Hackathon and Software Development RSO. Throughout the year, we immerse our members in tech by holding multiple workshop series, mentorship programs, project competitions, and our annual  Hackathon for hundreds of students.

name: Knight PALS for Autism
description: Knight PALS is a student organization at the University of Central Florida. Our goals are to provide support for neurodivergent individuals on campus and promote autism acceptance within the Central Florida community through self-determination enhancement programs, including workshops, social events, and trainings.
summary: The mission of Knight PALS is to promote autism acceptance and initiate inclusive programs for neurodivergent students at UCF and/or adults registered with UCF-CARD (Center for Autism and Related Disabilities).

name: Knight Riders Motorcycle Club
description:
Founded on Spring, 2012 The Knight Riders Organization is UCF's ONLY hub for life on two-wheels. We have a strong community of active members, and welcome riders of all ages and skill levels. The club boasts a diversity of: Sportbikes, Cruisers, Touring, Dualsport, Supermoto, and any two-wheel variation from all over Central Florida.

We, along with our sponsors, host a variety of events including but not limited to: Official Rides,
Bike Nights, Motorcycle Safety maneuvering courses AKA Moto Gymkhana, Track Days, Maintenance Days, and Moto-Eats. The schedules for these will be posted later in the official Knight Riders pages.

Driven by the passion for the motorcycle world, we emphasize and advocate motorcycle safety
above all. We are a bank of knowledge and an available resource for all our members for
anything motorcycle related, from passing the MSF course, to helping riders purchase their first bike, to maintenance guidance to fine-tuning all of their motorcycle riding skills.

Our purpose is to contribute to the Central Florida and the UCF riding community in the most significative way by sharpening our rider’s skills and making Orlando city a safer riding environment.

Social Media / Communications Channel:

Instagram: @UCFKnightriders
Facebook Public Page: @UCFKnightRiders
Facebook Private Group: UCF Knight Riders Motorcycle Group
Discord: UCF KnightRiders Motorcycle Group
Youtube: UCF Knight Riders Track Video
- Registration Form -

Official KR members enjoy all the benefits the club offers. These are:

 Free Official member T-shirt and sticker

 Discounted events such as the Track event (Best deal for a Track day experience)

 Free entry to Knight Riders sponsored events

 Free participation in club raffles

 Service and product discounts from our official sponsors

To become an official member the first step is to Follow this link:

Click on Membership Form and sign up, then one of our officers will follow up and arrange the payment of dues.

Membership Dues go as follows:

$25 for the Spring Semester (January-May)

$25 for the Fall Semester (August-December)

Please contact any of our officers in the Discord with questions or DM @ucfknightriders on Instagram.

See you on the road!
summary: The mission of the Knight Riders Club is to bring safety awareness and unity among motorcycle riders and enthusiasts in the UCF community.

name: Knight Runners
description:
We are the official running club at UCF!

Knight Runners is a club that accomodates both recreational AND competitive skill-levels and provides a community for runners at UCF. We practice each week Monday-Thursday at the RWC at 6:00PM, and we also meet up on weekends for local races, long runs, or travel events. You are encouraged to come as much or as little as you want! 

We are also a member of the National Intercollegiate Running Club Association. We participate in Fall and Spring out of state post-season competitions. 

Follow our Instagram (@knightrunnersatucf), or send us an email (knightrunnersucf@gmail.com) for more up to date information.

 

We hope to see you out there! (we are active in SUMMER)
summary: We are the official running club at UCF! If you like to run or are looking to get into running, then Knight Runners is the club to join! We are a recreational and competitive running club with a goal to accommodate most skill levels. Come check us out!

name: Knight-Thon
description:
Interested in Leadership in Knight-Thon

Knight-Thon is the University of Central Florida’s Official Dance Marathon benefiting Orlando Health Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children. Knight-Thon is UCF's largest student-driven philanthropy and each year we strive to raise awareness and funds throughout the Orlando community. In 2025, Knight-Thon raised over $626,000 for the children at our hospital! Help us as we strive to ensure real miracles continue to happen every day for local kids at our local hospitals.


Executive Director - Christopher Mundry | knight-thon@ucf.edu 
Communications Manager - Haley Keller | KTCommunications@ucf.edu 
Community Manager - Alyse Altberger | KTcommunity@ucf.edu 
Event Manager - Kailyn Chiuchiolo | KTEvent@ucf.edu
Finance Manager - Sofia Lisman | ktfinance@ucf.edu 
Membership Manager - Julia Sacks | ktmembership@ucf.edu 
Outreach Director - Bruna Melo | ktoutreach@ucf.edu
summary: Knight-Thon is the University of Central Florida’s Dance Marathon and largest student-run philanthropy benefiting Orlando Health Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children.

name: Knighted Bakers
description:
Knighted Bakers mission is to inspire curiosity, creativity, teamwork, collaboration, and unity in UCF students through common interest in baking. The club creates a safe, fun environment for any skill level to explore the processes of baking.

We meet every other week in the fall and spring with a mix of activity and themed meetings. No experience or personal equipment necessary! Feel free to check out our Instagram and Discord for specific meeting information!
summary: Knighted Bakers mission is to inspire curiosity, creativity, teamwork, collaboration, and unity in UCF students through common interest in baking. The club creates a safe, fun environment for any skill level to explore the processes of baking.

name: Knightendo
description:
Knightendo is a club for UCF students that enjoy Nintendo's properties whether it be the games, shows, historical retro consoles, movies, and more. Knightendo's main goal is to provide a place where people can enjoy and discuss Nintendo's products within the present or past. Knightendo also serves to host events surrounding Nintendo properties and games to bring people who love Nintendo together at UCF.

If this club interests you, join via this link for information on events, meetings and to meet fellow Nintendo fans: https://discord.gg/4CKxR4dtU6
summary: Knightendo is a club for UCF students that enjoy Nintendo's properties whether it be the games, shows, historical retro consoles, movies, and more.

name: Knighthawk Audubon
description:
Welcome! We are Knighthawk Audubon, a college campus chapter representing the National Audubon Society at UCF. Our primary goal is to foster interest in ornithology while creating opportunities to see and learn about birds for students. We want to create an inclusive and diverse environment for all students to work with the community as well as local Audubon chapters to inspire, promote, and facilitate the conservation of local and national avifauna and their ecosystems. We want to connect students with avian-related activities such as bird-watching hikes along with professional conservation opportunities provided by the National Audubon Society. We hope you will join us to help make the world a better place for birds and their environments!

 

Are you interested in joining us? Here's our membership info:

  • Join Knighthawk Audubon here on KnightConnect.
  • Join our GroupMe chat and follow our Instagram for additional club updates.
  • Pay membership dues: $15 for one school year or $10 for one semester. You can pay dues through CashApp ($knighthawkaudubonucf) or in-person via cash. When paying through CashApp, please include your name, UCF e-mail, and shirt size. 

Our meetings and off-campus events are open to all members, however, you'll receive numerous benefits as a dues-paying member such as:

  • Eligible to participate in carpools for our off-campus hikes, camping trips, and volunteer events.
  • Eligible to win our "Bird of the Month" raffle prizes.
  • Receive a rad club T-shirt.
  • Chance to earn an exclusive Knighthawk enamel pin.
summary: We are the Knighthawks, a campus chapter of the National Audubon Society. Audubon protects birds and the places they need throughout the Americas using science, advocacy, education, and on-the-ground conservation.

name: Knightmare Bhangra
description: The goal of Knightmare Bhangra at UCF is to have a vibrant and spirited dance group that seeks to celebrate the rich heritage of Bhangra while fostering school spirit, sportsmanship, and community engagement. As a dynamic ensemble of talented dancers, our mission is to entertain and inspire audiences at various university events, community gatherings in the Orlando area, and exhilarating dance competitions held at local, state-wide, and national levels.
summary: Spreading joy and cultural awareness through the vibrant art of Bhangra, uniting communities and celebrating diversity through spirited performances

name: KnightRaas
summary: We are a Traditional Indian folk dance team originating from Gujarat, India and our goal is to perform, compete, and spread our Garba Raas culture within our community.

name: Knights Association of Project Management
description:
Our goal is to help students with their overall professional development in whichever field they are in as well as prepare students for a career in project management by providing opportunities to learn, gain experience, and network with project management professionals.

As a member you will have the opportunity to participate in company guest speaker sessions, find opportunities in anywhere from marketing to recruiting, engage in targeted training and development sessions, network with other students, faculty, and employers, explore certification options, and assist in projects hosted with other student organizations on campus where you can practice your project management skills with hands-on experience.

 

Upcoming Meetings and CAPM Study Groups Fall 2024:

name: Knights Cheer
description: In Knights Cheer Club (KCC) our goal is to allow student members to maintain and improve their cheerleading ability at the collegiate level. We encompass several competitive teams at various skill levels to ensure the inclusion of all members. We also stress the importance of not only the physical aspects of cheerleading but also the fundamentals of what it means to be a leader, both on and off the mat. We pride ourselves on exemplifying the core values of being a UCF Knight.
summary: Knights Cheer seeks to provide an atmosphere for professional and athletic development for people of all skill levels in which students can improve their cheerleading and competitive abilities while also promoting teamwork and healthy relationships.

name: Knights Cricket Club
description:
Mission

The mission of Knights Cricket Club is to connect students who are interested in playing cricket and participate in cricket games with other colleges and local teams.

 

Goals

  • The goals of Knights Cricket Club is to improve the existing abilities of each player and develop new skills.
  • To work with athletes in attaining their individual goals.
  • To encourage a strong work ethic.
  • To encourage good sportsmanship and fair-play.
  • To experience the excellent competition American College Cricket (ACC)
summary: The mission of Knights Cricket Club is to connect students who are interested in playing cricket and participate in cricket games with other colleges and local teams.

name: Knights Disc Golf Club
description:
We are Knights Disc Golf! Want to learn one of the fastest growing sports in the world? Want to make new friends? We want to see you! 

Disc Golf is exactly how it sounds: golf with frisbees. But, it so much more than that - the opportunity to represent UCF on the college circuit, improve your skills, and get outside with friends. 

Come find us on Discord:
summary: The mission of Knights Disc Golf Club is to promote and play the sport of disc golf on campus, and in the greater Orlando area, amongst students attending the University of Central Florida.

name: Knights Emergency Medical Response Unit
description:
The mission of Knights Emergency Medical Responders is to support the health, safety, and wellness of our community by connecting campus first responders, and raising awareness of life-saving care. Members will gain medical knowledge, clinical experience, learn emergency skills, explore EMS career options, and create fun memories!

 

To be a part of club meetings, skills workshops, and other fun events join us on KnightConnect and follow us on Instagram @ucfkemru! If you are a certified EMS professional and would like to join our Response Unit that will gain hands on clinical experience, apply now with this form!

 

Co-Presidents and Founders: Rylie Manning and Sarah Quinones
summary: The mission of Knights Emergency Medical Responders is to support the health, safety, and wellness of our community by connecting campus first responders, and raising awareness of life-saving care.

name: Knights Exemplar
description:
Knights Exemplar supports UCF’s Inclusive Education Services (IES) students as they complete their Professional Service Credential requirements. The mission of the IES program is to provide learning experiences, within an inclusive educational setting, for young adults with intellectual disabilities, university students, faculty, staff, and community leaders. 

Members will serve as Involvement Ambassadors (IAs), a peer mentor of the highest quality. IAs are role models and persons of support to the IES student he or she works with. IAs support IES students in the areas of academics (i.e. tutoring, scheduling), campus activity (i.e. connecting with other RSOs, on-campus resources, attending football games), career exploration (i.e. career services workshops, resume creation, career and internship support) health and wellness (i.e. RWC workout partner, lunch meeting partner), all while gaining social skills through the building of positive and trusting relationships.
summary: Knights Exemplar strives to support and create campus connection, engagement, and professional development for all UCF Knights. Involvement Ambassadors directly support students connected with Inclusive Education Services (IES).

name: Knights Experimental Rocketry
description:
We design and build experimental rockets for international competitions. 

 

Our mission is to cultivate a passion for science, technology, and space exploration while developing hands-on skills that prepare students for the professional industry. 

 

We aim to establish UCF as the Premier Space University by winning various rocket competitions, including the largest collegiate competition in the world at the Spaceport America Cup IREC. 

Active Projects:
Spaceport America Cup IREC
Dollar Per Foot Liquid Propulsion
Satellite Ion Propulsion
Solid Propulsion Project
High-Power Rocketry Certification Program
Technical Skill Workshops

 

Check out our website at kxrucf.com to get involved!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WA_izRi_R8c
summary: We design and build experimental rockets for international competitions.

name: Knights for Christ
description:
Knights For Christ strives to promote First-century, New Testament, non­ denominational Christianity and to promote the spiritual well-being among all interested students by providing fellowship opportunities, Bible studies, volunteer projects, and other activities.

We have weekly Monday night meetings/devotionals, and fun fellowship/social events. Our main goal is to bring Christian students closer together in their Christian walk.
summary: Knights for Christ is an on campus, student-run organization dedicated to spiritual growth and Christian fellowship!

name: Knights For Initiatives in Robotic Student Teaching
description:
Mission

The mission of Knights For Initiatives in Robotic Student Teaching is to connect students interested in youth robotics programs with opportunities to volunteer with organizations in the Orlando community, network with professionals in the field, and interact with a community of like-minded students.

Goals

We hope to collect a pool of UCF students interested in providing youth with a skill development opportunity through robotics, utilize those members to advance the quality of youth robotics programs in the area, and inspire the next generation of the workforce through a wholesome, hands-on experience. We aim to improve the UCF community through service that will improve the greater Orlando community.
summary: Knights FIRST seeks to connect students interested in youth robotics programs with opportunities to volunteer with organizations in the Orlando community, network with professionals in the field, and interact with a community of like-minded students.

name: Knights for Refugee Medical Relief
description:
Knights for Refugee Medical Relief (KRMR) works as a community to provide medical and educational relief to refugees. Through volunteering opportunities and fundraising events, our members come together to help local and global refugees.

 

How do you become part of the KRMR family?

✺ Join our enthusiastic team with the common goal of strengthening and improving the lives of refugees by becoming an official member of KRMR by filling out the following link: KRMR Membership Form

✺ Join our club's group me to meet other members and maintain direct communication:KRMR GroupMe

 

For more information on KRMR and the current events of KRMR take a look at our Link Tree: KRMR Link Tree
summary: The main goal of KRMR is to prioritize the needs of refugee and migrant communities locally and internationally. We aim to provide volunteering opportunities that both develop the character of our members as well as support the refugee community.

name: Knights for Wildlife Conservation
description:
Knights for Wildlife Conservation (KWC) inspires student involvement in conserving the habitats of wild animals and plant life through volunteer activities. By raising awareness in the community, we educate the general public of the dangers presented to both local and global environments. We strive to empower others to make an impact on the environment and their surrounding communities. We also share networking opportunities to prepare students for continued involvement upon graduation. 

 

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN BECOMING A MEMBER PLEASE EMAIL US AT kwcucf@gmail.com ! We will not accept your membership request until dues are paid! If you have paid dues and are still not accepted, please email us as well. You can become a member at any time of the year. General Body meetings are open to interested students.
summary: The Knights for Wildlife Conservation (KWC) is a student organization devoted to educating others about animals and wildlife conservation through volunteering and outreach, as well as through promoting career advancement to our members.

name: Knights Fuel
summary: The mission of Knight’s Fuel is to positively impact our community by enhancing student knowledge and appreciation of nutrition, dietetics, and food science.

name: Knights Generative
summary: The mission of Knights Generative is to offer students a forum for experimentation with generative AI in the context of live audio-visual performance.

name: Knights in the Ring
summary: The mission of Knights in the Ring is to educate students in self-defense, combined with modern exercise, while providing a positive and welcoming experience.

name: Knights Kangna
description: The University of Central Florida's competitive and non-competitive Bollywood fusion dance team that aims to spread American and Indian dance culture by performing at competitions and campus events.
summary: Knights Kangna is a competitive dance team that showcases both Indian and American Dance culture. The team does this by competing at Bollywood Fusion competitions across the nation, as well as performing at events around Orlando and UCF's campus.

name: Knights Khayal
summary: The mission of Knights Khayal is to be a South Asian musical group that incorporates various languages around the world, in order to help foster a new wave of music as well as to inspire future musicians and bring a diversity of culture to our community.

name: Knights Law Review
summary: The mission of Knights Law Review is to develop members’ legal writing and research skills, while also providing career guidance and scholarship opportunities.

name: Knights Nakshatra
description: Knights Nakshatra is UCF's premier Indian Classical dance team, dedicated to sharing the rich cultural heritage and beauty of Indian Classical dance. The team showcases a diverse repertoire, incorporating four classical dance forms: Bharatanatyam, known for its intricate footwork and expressive storytelling; Kathak, with its graceful spins and rhythmic footwork; Odissi, characterized by its fluid movements and sculpturesque poses; and Kuchipudi, renowned for its dynamic energy and dramatic expressions. Together, these styles create a vibrant and captivating performance that highlights the depth and diversity of Indian Classical dance.
summary: Knights Nakshatra is UCF's premier Indian Classical dance team. With the goal of sharing the beauty of classical dance, Nakshatra incorporates four styles of Indian Classical dance: Bharatanatyam, Kathak, Odissi, and Kuchipudi.

name: Knights of Apollo
summary: The Knights of Apollo are dedicated to learning about the therapeutic applications of music and music therapy. Our mission is to provide volunteering opportunities, instrument workshops, as well as research opportunities in the field of music.

name: Knights of Distinction
description:
Successful graduates are those who are able to make connections between experiences both inside and outside the classroom and to apply what they have learned to new contexts. The Knights of Distinction program is designed to help you do just that.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=932GSfG1RPI

 

The Knights of Distinction program is designed to help students connect the dots between their experiences inside the classroom and beyond. The program provides a framework for students to plan effectively; seek out meaningful, high-impact learning experiences; and leverage those experiences to prepare for what's next after UCF.

 

This program is designed to help students:

•Identify goals and craft individual plans to reach those goals
•Engage in meaningful, high-impact experiences such workshops, internships, study abroad, undergraduate research, service learning, etc.
•Reflect on how those experiences prepare them for the next stage of their careers after UCF
•Showcase their work and achievements by creating a final ePortfolio
 

Students who achieve Knight of Distinction will earn:

• The formal "Knights of Distinction" designation on their transcripts

• Completion letter from the Program Coordinator

• A medallion to wear at graduation!

 

Visit our website for more information!

 

Apply today! We accept applications on a rolling basis.
summary: Graduate with DISTINCTION! The Knights of Distinction program encourages undergraduate students to PLAN, CONNECT, and REFLECT in the pursuit of their goals. Apply today!

name: Knights of Fiber Arts
description: We are a club that allows students interested in hobbies under the umbrella of fiber arts (i.e. knitting, crocheting, sewing, etc.) to meet and socialize with other students with similar hobbies. Through weekly, casual meetings, we get to know each other, form friendships, and work on our personal projects! We may occasionally have meetings at different locations, but often enjoy picnics!
summary: We are a club that allows students interested in hobbies under the umbrella of fiber arts (i.e. knitting, crocheting, sewing, etc.) to meet and socialize with other students with similar hobbies.

name: Knights of the Paw
description:
Knights of the Paw is UCF's official student club for fans of anthropomorphic animals in art and media, also known as 'furries'.

 

Post-con depression? Want to make furry friends? Nerdy friends? Well - you have us! At Knights of the Paw (“KniP” for short), we aim to hold events that share the joy of the furry fandom and do lots of opportunities for hangouts on/outside of campus. Overall, we are a group that will make you feel welcomed and give you a chance to feel more included here at UCF! Our core values are community, creativity, and philanthropy:

🦊Community🦊

We strive to enrich the lives of our members by offering them a place to make friends through a common hobby and offering social activities and workshops. We host many events - from casual food meetups to full on fursuiting events! Our members have a wide range of interests and majors to connect beyond furry. Our group is also largely LGBTQ+ and so this is a very welcome, open, and safe environment for all people from all walks of life!

🐲Creativity🐲

One of the biggest subgroups in the furry fandom are artists! Costumers, crafters, writers, musicians, and more make our hobby what it is. We encourage students to pursue their creative interests and celebrate their unique selves with art jams and activities!

🐯Philanthropy🐯

 

Furries actively seek to do good not only for our members but for our local community and beyond! We in KniP focus on charitable work through volunteering and fundraising for organizations such as the Pet Alliance of Greater Orlando and more.

 

Interested? Feel free to join our club as a member and get into contact with one of our officers! We are open to everyone - including non-furries - and wish to foster better understanding behind the fandom, as well as spark inspiration to our furry members and beyond!

 

(NOTE: Once signed up, PLEASE check your UCF email for further instructions to access our online platforms.)
summary: We are UCF's official furry club! We strive to connect and enrich the lives of those who partake in our fun and creative hobby through community, creativity, philanthropy, and more. We welcome fans, those curious, non-furries, and all of the above!

name: Knights of the Round Table
description:
Knights of the RoundTable is an advisory council that serves as an educational and administrative resource to all student organizations and as a network between the organizations and the UCF community.

We can help connect you to one of over 650 diverse registered student organizations on campus. If there is an organization we don't have that you want, we can help you start your own registered student organization!

 

 

2025 - 2026 Executive Board

Executive Director – Han Le | kort@ucf.edu

Assistant Executive Director-  Hunter Layfield | kortad@ucf.edu

Marketing & PR Coordinator - Juliette Rodrigue | kort_pr@ucf.edu

Programming Coordinator - Caelan Askew | kort_org@ucf.edu

Programming Coordinator - Anasofia Marin | kort_org2@ucf.edu

Leadership Coordinator - Kai Hughes | kort_lc@ucf.edu

 

KnightQuest

KnightQuest is a one-on-one consultation service that can help you get involved at UCF. We provide a personalized approach to your involvement through education on-campus resources that fit your personal needs or interests. Each consultation is designed to meet your individual interests regarding academic and campus resources, student organizations, and other opportunities.

Schedule a Consultation: https://calendly.com/kortoutreach

KnightQuest Consultant- Trinity Burch | kortoutreach@ucf.edu

KnightQuest Consultant- Rose Rodriguez | kortoutreach@ucf.edu

 

The Authorized Officer Webcourse for 2025-2026 is now available on the main page of KnightConnect!
summary: Knights of the Round Table is an advisory council that serves as an educational and administrative resource to all student organizations and as a network between the organizations and the UCF community.

name: Knights of the Turntables
description:
The Official Audio Entertainment Service of UCF

 

Knights of the Turntables aims to provide the UCF community with a fun, low-cost way of bringing DJ, music, emcee, and live audio services to events.

 

Complete with speakers, microphones, lighting, and more, Turntables can help you get the party started and help bring your event to the next level! Our services are available on Main Campus, Rosen Campus, and UCF Downtown.

 

Pricing starts at $125 for 4 hours or less and $25 for every hour after that, calculated from the time the DJ is requested to arrive at the event until half an hour after the event ends. Student Government Agencies and ASF-funded Departments are not charged.

 

BOOK US NOW      APPLY TO BE A DJ
summary: The Official Audio Entertainment Service of UCF

name: Knights Order
description:
⚔️ Originally founded by project management students, Knight Order is open to all majors.

💡 We bring students together to collaborate on projects, support one another, and network.

📋 Whether you want leadership experience or to connect professionally, Knight Order is a great opportunity for growth.
summary: The mission of the Knights Order is to cultivate leaders from all fields, uniting diverse talents to tackle global issues and link outstanding individuals to esteemed firms, empowering students for societal betterment.

name: Knights Pantry
description: The Knights Helping Knights Pantry is committed to serving the UCF students by providing basic needs for free including food, clothing, and personal hygiene items to foster continued academic success thus increasing retention.
summary: The Knights Helping Knights Pantry is committed to serving the UCF students by providing basic needs for free including food, clothing, and personal hygiene items to foster continued academic success thus increasing retention.

name: Knights Powerlifting
description: Knights powerlifting works to support strength athletes. Powerlifting entails the three big lifts: squat bench and deadlift. We welcome any student that loves fitness, want more information on powerlifting, or are looking for a supportive group of people that share a passion and love for strength training.
summary: Knights Powerlifting is a group of motivated UCF students who participate in powerlifting recreationally and competitively.

name: Knights Pre-Law Association
description: Our club strives to gather pre-law students to form a supportive network of like minded individuals who wish to achieve a career in the law field. Our members have access to networking events to connect members with career focused individuals in the law profession. We help to connect students to internships, careers, and volunteer experience in the law field. Our members have access to LSAT preparation by their peers through group study sessions. We plan to have current or past Law students speak on their experiences with members so they have an idea what to expect in the coming years. We want to help members know their options post-graduate and have support from one another when applying to Law School. We also plan to hear from different speakers in the Law profession to allow students to figure out what exactly they would like to have as a career in the future, as well as allowing them to network.
summary: We are The Knights Pre-Law Association. We are a group of like minded individuals who are planning to pursue a career in the law field. We strive to give pre-law students the proper resources and support they need to be successful.

name: Knights Records
summary: The mission of Knights Records is to foster the growth of emerging artists and future music industry professionals within the UCF and Orlando communities by operating as a mock music label.

name: Knights Rock Band
description:
Knights Rock Band is a student-led organization dedicated to bringing musicians and music lovers together to jam, perform, and connect with the local music scene. We provide a welcoming space for musicians of all skill levels to gain real band experience, collaborate with others, and improve their musical abilities while also helping listeners engage with live music culture.

Club Goals & Efforts

  • Facilitating Live Music Collaboration – We host jam sessions, open mics, and band meetups to allow musicians to play together in a relaxed, supportive setting.
  • Developing Performance Experience – Our club organizes live music events where members can showcase their talent on stage.
  • Encouraging Band Formation & Promotion – Creating a system to help students find bandmates, experiment with different genres, and gain exposure through performance opportunities and club promotions.
  • Fostering a Social & Supportive Community – Our events are designed to connect musicians, listeners, and music lovers through shared live music experiences.
  • Connecting Members to the Music Scene – We arrange group outings to concerts, local venues, and festivals to help members engage with Orlando’s live music culture.
  • Providing Hands-On Skill Development – Developing workshops that emphasize playing together, refining techniques, and learning through experience.
  • Exploring Multiple Genres – While rooted in rock, we embrace a diverse range of styles, including funk, blues, alternative, and more.

With regular events, club resources, and a strong community of musicians and listeners, Knights Rock Band is the perfect place to grow as a performer, build connections, and enjoy live music.
summary: Knights Rock Band connects musicians and listeners through live jams, performances, and social outings. We provide hands-on band experience, promote local music, and create opportunities to engage with Orlando’s music scene in a fun, collaborative space.

name: Knights Satellite Club
description:
Knights Satellite Club is UCF's center for satellite and space systems development. We provide opportunities for students from all colleges who are passionate about space. Our primary focus is engineering and science, but all are welcome. It takes more than engineers to run a space program!

 

Projects
KSC operates several projects to provide hands-on experience to our Members. We are currently developing two suborbital, balloon-based CubeSat test platforms that will fly up to 100,000 feet. We are also in the early phases of an orbital CubeSat mission. To communicate with these satellites, we are working on satellite ground stations on UCF's Engineering Building and Physical Science Building. We also build payloads for amateur rocketry projects in collaboration with other UCF RSOs.

 

Workshops
KSC offers several workshops each semester. Leading up to career fairs and internship application periods, we hold professional development workshops to provide Members with valuable information and advice from recruiters and industry professionals.

 

Industry Tours and Conferences
KSC partners with local Florida aerospace companies to offer industry tours giving Members valuable insights into their future career and direct connections for internship applications. We also provide opportunities to attend conferences such as the SmallSat Education Conference at Kennedy Space Center and the Small Satellite Conference in Salt Lake City, Utah.

 

Socials
KSC holds socials throughout the year. In the past few semesters we have gone berry picking, played mini golf, gone tailgating, and visited Blaze Pizza, All My Tea Boba, and Fuzzy's Taco Shop. We are planning on more events such as paintball, bowling, and more restaurant visits.

 

How to Get Involved?
We hold regular project meetings open to all students. The best way to get hands-on is to jump in and attend a project meeting! We also hold General Body Meetings (GBMs) once a month during the Fall and Spring semesters to provide general information and project updates to all KSC Members. GBMs also feature talks from industry professionals and free food!

To stay up-to-date on events and projects, join our Discord!

 

Membership Steps
To become an offical KSC Member and be eligible for all workshops, tours, conferences, and elections, follow the process below:
1. Complete Membership Form
2. Pay dues
3. Click join on our KnightConnect page

 

Leadership
All KSC activities are student led and organized. Our leadership structure consists of elected Board Officers who serve for an entire year, and appointed Committee Chairs who serve single semester terms. Further leadership positions are available within Committees and Projects. These opportunities are open to all KSC Members who are excited about building UCF's student CubeSat program!
summary: Knights Satellite Club is UCF's center for satellite and space system development. We provide hands-on experience to all students through projects, workshops, and industry tours. KSC is a multidisciplinary club and welcomes students from all colleges!
categoryNames: ['Business Administration', 'Engineering and Computer Science', 'Sciences', 'Optics and Photonics']

name: Knights Special Events Society
description:
We are a free, student-run organization, the student club associated with ILEA (International Live Events Association). KSES exposes UCF students to the event industry and is an excellent opportunity to learn more about possible career paths with events.
 
We have monthly meetings, including local industry guest speakers, site visits, workshops, volunteer activities, tours, etc! Some of last year's meetings included guest speaker Lindsey Brinson from Camping World Stadium, a tour and information session with Bill Dewitz from Encore, and while doing several site visits to places like Camping World Stadium, Orlando Convention Center, and Vu Orlando! Our meetings are a great way to immerse yourself in the event world and will allow you to learn and network with local professionals from all realms of the industry.
 
Since we are the ILEA Orlando student club, KSES members have the fantastic opportunity to become an ILEA Student Member. You can be an ILEA Student Member for all four years, and we highly recommend it for Juniors and Seniors; student membership, however, is open to everyone! The benefits of becoming a member are endless and include being able to attend ILEA meetings, being a full member of the national society, and networking- to name a few! KSES will also notify you of numerous volunteer opportunities with ILEA so you can gain experience, which is a critical aspect of being successful in the event industry. The typical annual ILEA membership cost is approximately $500, but as a Student Member with KSES, the price is significantly reduced to only $50! Being an ILEA student member is not a requirement for KSES, but we strongly encourage it as it will provide you with excellent opportunities and is great for your resume and future success.
summary: The mission of Knights Special Events Society is to provide members and stakeholders collaborative networking, education, professional development, inspiration and outward awareness, and credibility to ensure a thriving global creative events profession.

name: Knights Vote
description:
What is Knights Vote?

The mission of Knights Vote is simple: to igknight a passion for civic learning, democratic engagement, and voter engagement in our Knights community. Knights Vote is committed to making voter engagement a priority across Knight Nation!

 

Knights Vote Committee

The Knights Vote committee is a collaborative, nonpartisan team across the university that will create campus voting goals, provide valuable perspectives, and champion democratic engagement for the university. Knights Vote will be comprised of key stakeholders across the university and Orlando community.

 

Our Goals for 2024

  • Increase voter participation rate to 80% or higher for the 2024 election
  • 500 Knights will sign the Knights Vote pledge to vote
  • 10 Registered Student Organizations or student leadership groups on campus will host voter-education and voter-engagement programs prior to the 2024 Presidential elections

Why YOU should get involved

According to the National Voter Engagement Week group, “studies show you are more likely to vote if you make a plan to do it. Think through how you’re going to vote, when you will go, how you will get there, and who will join you.
summary: The mission of Knights Vote is simple: to igknight a passion for civic learning, democratic engagement, and voter engagement in our Knights community. Knights Vote is committed to making voter engagement a priority across Knight Nation!

name: Knights' Chariots
description: The mission of Knights’ Chariots is to unite Auto Enthusiasts in a community where members share experience, knowledge, and passion for all vehicles.  Be safe, have fun, create a common automotive enthusiast culture, and network with fellow students and facilities.
summary: We strive to provide a haven for automotive enthusiasts of all kinds and benefit the surrounding community through the collaboration of automotive interests!

name: Lake Claire Apartments
description: To provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth.
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.

name: Lambda Alpha Epsilon Pre-Professional Criminal Justice Fraternity
description:
Lambda Alpha Epsilon is a co-ed pre-professional fraternity established in 1937. UCF's Delta Zeta Omega chapter at was founded in 1992. LAE alumni work throughout the country in a wide array of criminal justice agencies, including teaching CJ at the collegiate level. As a pre-professional fraternity, LAE prides itself in offering its members networking and community opportunities, fun social events, Bigs and Littles, and the opportunity to create friendships with individuals that pride themselves in the same interests: Public Service!

          Every other week, LAE brings in a guest speaker, allowing its members to bond as a family and learn more about the plenitude of pathways one can take in CJ. Guest speakers in the past have included, but are not limited to, Orange County Sheriff's Office, FBI Terrorism Task Force, DEA, Orange County Corrections, Miami Beach Police Department, Victim Services, FDLE, and much more.

          In the past, LAE has put together SWAT roundup, FBI hazmat training, and our annual Public Service Conference. These are just a few of the opportunities LAE prides itself in sharing with its members, all in an effort to help them feel more confident about their career choices post-graduation.

          LAE is also very involved in its community with organizations such as Harbor House, Second Harvest, and Clean the World. We also host an annual Domestic Violence Awareness Charity Auction in October. Though a career-based fraternity, LAE encourages community and fellowship with its members by organizing events such as icebreakers, bowling nights, group workouts (possibly intramural sports), volunteer events, and Fall/Spring Formals.

          Requirements: Members must maintain a 2.0 cumulative GPA, complete 10 hours of community service every semester, attend socials, partake in fundraisers, professional, and academic events, pay a semester fee, and meet bi-weekly 6:00 PM in our assigned location. All of this must be done to stay in Good-Standing.

For more information and further updates, follow our Instagram @ucflae. Please note that dues and contracts must be turned in before membership will be approved on KnightConnect.
summary: LAE is a Pre-Professional Criminal Justice Fraternity which embraces all majors in the Public Service fields. Through professional events, community service, and socials, we foster an environment for service-minded individuals to bond and network.

name: Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Inc.
description:
"Latin by Tradition, Not by Definition"

In the spring of 1999, after many years of trials and tribulations, 15 outstanding ladies established the Beta Theta Chapter. This made it the 31st chapter of Lambda Theta Alpha, the first Latin organization in the nation. Its purpose is to cater towards the needs of women on the UCF campus.

Along with the accomplishment of the establishment of a chapter, the Founding Sisters of Beta Theta Chapter also established and fought for recognition of the Diversified Greek Council by the Greek community at UCF. This was a monumental accomplishment for Beta Theta chapter. Once the Diversified Greek Council was established and recognized, other multicultural Greek organizations were able to start a chapter on campus.

On November 4, 2000, Line One was added to Beta Theta. This group of ladies had realized a long-standing goal of theirs when they were welcomed into the Lambda Theta Alpha sisterhood. Eventually, eleven ladies succeeded and became what is known as “The First Dynasty.” From then on the legacy of Beta Theta continues to grow with high quality ladies that are determined to leave a mark on campus and in the community.

Through various community service projects and educational programming, Beta Theta is making a difference. We are determined to give back, not only UCF but, the Central Florida community. Whether it is telethons with Arnold Palmer Hospital to help raise money for the cancer wing, or giving out food to the homeless, our sisterhood strives to help those in need. Beta Theta also does workshops on issues that can affect everyone, such as self-defense, as well as enlighten others on people and various walks of life. It is our hope to break down barriers within our community and to dissipate ignorance. We strive to become leaders and inspire other women to stand up for their beliefs and never stop reaching for their dreams.

Mission: The purpose of Lambda Theta Alpha shall be to provide a sisterhood based on Unity, Love, and Respect. To develop strong leaders who will then provide and practice political, social and cultural activities. Promote unity through charitable and educational programs. Maintain a higher standard of learning and serve as a voice for all students.

Colors: Burgundy and Grey

Principles: Unity, Love and Respect

Goals: Scholarly excellence, empowerment of Latinas and the universal woman, cultural and political awareness, and community activism.

Important Facts:

  • Founded at Kean University, in NJ in December of 1975.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha was the first sorority ever created to cater towards the needs of Latinas in the nation.
  • The purpose of the organization is to create a support group for women in higher education and unite the community on campus.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha was established as an academic sorority.
  • LTA is not an exclusionary organization.
  • The LTA National Philanthropy is St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha has a unique call, a hand-sign, and performs traditional salutes, chants, and strolls (party walks).
  • Lambda Theta Alpha is a member of the National Association of Latino Fraternal Organizations (NALFO).
  • Lambda Theta Alpha is a fully insured organization which covers all of its chapters.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha has established Alumnae Chapters.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha has established Graduate Chapters.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha has established chapters throughout Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Puerto Rico, Missouri, Texas, Virginia, Washington, Wisconsin, Delaware, Iowa, Tennessee, and Ohio
  • Lambda Theta Alpha is proud to be recognized as the 2000-2001, 2002-2003, 2003-2004, and 2009-2010 recipient of the Sorority of the Year award from NALFO.
  • Lambda Theta Alpha is proud to participate in the White House's Initiative on Educational Excellence for Hispanics
summary: Lambda Theta Alpha is the first Latin sorority in the nation. LTA prides itself on being an academic sorority based on the principles of unity, love, and respect. Since their founding in 1975, their mission has been the empowerment of women!

name: Lambda Theta Phi Latin Fraternity, Inc.
description:
The mission of Lambda Theta Phi is to empower the Latin male through scholarship, Brotherhood, opportunity and protection of identity and equality.
IDEALS
1. To establish a brotherhood
2. To establish and maintain a high standard of learning
3. To raise the standards of morality and develop character
4. To respect culture and practice chivalry
5. To promote the spirit of man’s dignity and self-identity
summary: The first Latino Fraternity on the UCF campus and in the United States. We're a group of professional students focused on academic excellence and assisting the community. The ideals of this brotherhood are Unity, Respect, Brotherhood, Culture, and Pride.

name: Late Knights
description:
The goal of Late Knights is to provide UCF students with a place to enjoy themselves and unwind with fun, safe, and on-campus events late at night. Late Knights host Weekly Small Scale Events and Monthly Large Scale Events. Our events range from pool parties and paint knights to giveaways and trivia competitions. We feature free food, prizes, and unforgettable entertainment.

 

Our Weekly Small Scale Events are held on Friday nights and select weekends starting at 7 PM and our Monthly Large Scale Events are often held on Friday or Saturday nights from 8 PM on. 

 

Registered Student Organizations can benefit from Late Knights by either reserving a table to promote and recruit members, or by sponsoring or co-programming an activity at a weekly or monthly event. Each event consistently attracts over 500+ students. We love to share our Late Knights Platform with RSOs, please contact ucflk@ucf.edu for more information. 

 

How To Get Involved

If you are interested in getting involved or volunteering with Late Knights, please fill out the 2024-2025 Late Knights Council Application underneath "Forms". You can also email our Associate Director at lkad@ucf.edu for more information! 

 

Mission

The mission of Late Knights is to function as a student run agency under the Office of Student Involvement (OSI) whose purpose is to promote safe and unique entertainment options, community engagement, and genuine memories through campus events for all.

 

Contact Us

name: Latin Rhythm
description:
At Latin Rhythm we look to help students learn more about Latin culture through its diverse styles of dance. We teach you how to find your rhythm in the music as we move from basic to advanced styles of Bachata and Salsa!

We Offer: 

Classes taught by our own students

Workshops with professionals dancers from around the area

Chances to join our performance teams

Socials to try out all you've learned in class

 

We teach all year long.

This Summer classes are Tuesday 6:30-9:30pm and Wednesday 6:30-8:30pm. On Tuesday we teach an hour of LA Salsa and an hour of Casino Salsa with an hour to social dance at the end. On Wednesday we have an hour of Bachata and an hour of social dance.

In Fall and Spring classes are held every week on Tuesday and Wednesday.

 

If you have any questions or want to be notified of our future events join us in our Discord and follow us on our Instagram!

 

If you want to organize an event with us, contact us through our Instagram, or email us at latin.rhythm@live.com

 

Discord Link: https://discord.gg/KNhyWzD6KV

Instagram: @latinrhythmucf
summary: Latin Rhythm is an organization whose goal is to expand our members knowledge of Latin dance and to guide them through its rich culture. Not only will you learn to dance but you will meet tons of new people that share your interest in dance!

description: The Latino Medical Student Association at UCF is a space for Latino pre-health students to grow, connect, and thrive on their path to medicine. Through mentorship, leadership opportunities, and community, we support each other in reaching our goals and navigating the journey to becoming future healthcare professionals. Whether you're just getting started or already deep in the process, LMSA is here to uplift and empower you every step of the way.
summary: The Latino Medical Student Association at UCF unites and empowers pre-health students through service, mentorship, and education to uplift Latino students pursuing careers in healthcare.

name: Latinos In Action at University Of Central Florida College Chapter
summary: The mission of Latinos In Action at University of Central Florida College Chapter is to Empower Latino youth to lead and strengthen their communities. Providing students with the opportunity to exercise their leadership skills and develop.

name: LEAD Scholars Academy
description: Welcome to the LEAD Scholars Academy. This office provides students with various opportunities to learn more about themselves, develop new leadership skills, and become student leaders through programs and events, including Campus-wide Leadership Workshops, Leadership Retreats, and Leadership Conferences.
summary: LEAD Scholars Academy (LSA) will establish an environment that will provide comprehensive leadership education, development, and civic engagement opportunities for the UCF community.
