name: League of Women Voters of UCF
description:
The LWVUCF is dedicated to educating students about civic engagement, public service and voter responsibilities. The following are goals of the organization:

  • Partner with local community and civic engagement agencies and organizations in providing non-partisan voter education through speakers, forums, workshops and campus engagement.
  • Provide opportunities for students to register to vote and learn about updated voting laws and procedures
  • Engage in civil discourse to develop and implement solutions to community and social issues.
  • Provide community service and philanthropy opportunities
summary: The mission of The League of Women Voters at UCF is to help defend democracy on and off campus and empower students to become civically engaged year-round by increasing access to voting information for all.

name: Lebanese Student Association
description: The association is committed to benefiting the Lebanese, the non-Lebanese and the non-Arabic communities while promoting Lebanese culture and heritage, thus adding to the diversity of the campus, as well as increasing public awareness about Lebanese. We focus on promoting a sense of identity among Lebanese students, so as to portray a common image throughout UCF and creating an atmosphere for bettering academic performance and intellectual development of Lebanese students within UCF’s community.
summary: The Lebanese Student Association aim to unite and serve the Lebanese community on campus while educating the general student body of the University of Central Florida about Lebanese culture and society, and holding cultural and educational events.

name: Legislative Scholars Internship Program
summary: These students have the ability to learn the in's and outs of the Florida legislative process and public policy making. They have the chance to work directly with legislative staff or lobbying firms while gaining valuable Non-Partisan governmental exper

name: LGBTQ+ Services
description:
The UCF Student Government established the Lesbian Gay Bisexual Transgender Questioning/Queer (LGBTQ+) Student Support Services to connect our diverse student population to opportunities, resources, and each other. Funded by the Activity and Service Fee, its mission is to achieve the vision of a stronger, healthier, and more equitable world for all individuals including LGBTQ+ people and their allies. Student Government continues to support this area, ensuring it remains a welcoming space for all students. LGBTQ+ strives to support the community by:

  • Fostering greater opportunities for students to succeed at UCF.
  • Helping organize programs and experiences geared toward educating the UCF community about issues surrounding the LGBTQ+ community.
  • Creating a forum where LGBTQ+ history and culture is acknowledged, discussed, and celebrated.
  • Creating a space where resources can be created and explored in the future.

LGBTQ+ Student Support Services is a resource office open to all students, including LGBTQ+ students and allies. We are an entry point for anyone looking for resources relating to sexual orientation or gender identity. LGBTQ+ Services’ grand opening was celebrated on October 11, 2011 which was also National Coming Out Day.

Lavender Council

A student advisory board that serves as a liaison between students, faculty, and staff and LGBTQ+ Student Support Services. They work to make UCF a more accepting and welcoming campus by developing and advising on student-centered programs. They strive to make UCF a more equitable campus through programming and events to educate the UCF community about issues regarding the LGBTQ+ community.

Pride Commons

Located in Ferrell Commons across from 63 South, Pride Commons is a place for UCF students looking for resources, a community, a place to hang out, or a quiet place to study. It is open to all students of all genders and sexual orientations. The Pride Commons is staffed by Civil Discourse & Engagement Staff members, the Multicultural Student Center Executive Board, and student assistants.
summary: LGBTQ+ Student Support Services is a resource office for LGBTQ+ students, allies, and anyone interested in LGBTQ+ issues. We are an entry point for anyone looking for resources relating to sexual orientation or gender identity.

name: Libra Community
description: To provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth.
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.

name: Lifestyle Medicine Interest Group of Health Professions & Sciences at UCF
summary: The mission of Lifestyle Medicine Interest Group of Health Professions & Sciences at UCF is to provide information about the specialty of Lifestyle medicine, and educate members about evidence-based practices used in order to prevent chronic diseases.

name: Lighthouse Haven
description: The mission of Lighthouse Haven is to uplift and empower pediatric cancer patients through meaningful connection, creative experiences, and personal mentorship. Inspired by the steadfast presence of a lighthouse, Lighthouse Haven aims to be a place of comfort and hope as they navigate life’s most challenging moments.
summary: The mission of Lighthouse Haven is to uplift and empower pediatric cancer patients through meaningful connection, creative experiences, and personal mentorship.

name: Lights, Camera, Action! UCF Film Creators Club
description:
Lights, Camera, Action! is a club that welcomes students of all majors to collaborate and produce original films to screen at our biannual film showcases.

Our meetings include fun film-related activities and trivia, 1 hour film challenges, and opportunities to meet film majors in UCF. We encourage people to scout members for their film crews in order to create films for our biannual festival!
summary: Lights, Camera, Action! is a club that welcomes students of all majors to collaborate and produce original films to screen at our biannual film showcases.

name: Loop at UCF
description: The goals of Loop at UCF are to provide leadership opportunities for members through workshops, mentorship, and peer-to-peer learning; to host industry professional speaker events that connect members with product leaders and expandcareer knowledge; to organize Product Management Ideathons and case competitions that foster hands-on experience in problem solving, teamwork, and innovation; and to build a strong alumni and industry network that supports internships, career opportunities, and long-term professional growth.
summary: The mission of Loop at UCF is to create a strong talent pipeline of product managers from UCF into the tech industry while fostering a vibrant alumni network that supports future leaders.

name: Love You the Same Foundation
summary: The mission of Love You the Same Foundation is to expand access to healthcare to people of all socioeconomic backgrounds, through volunteering and political means.

name: LUNA Interest Group
description:
The mission of LUNA Interest Group is to encourage young women to take initiative in improving the lives of others and giving back to their local communities. LUNA strives to provide an inclusive environment that fosters cultural diversity, Asian-awareness, and educationally inspired grounding for women of all different backgrounds.



Fall 2025 Interest Form

name: Marine Biology Education and Awareness Club
description:
MBEAC is a club that works to educate students, no matter their major or background, on the world of marine biology. Our main goal is to emphasize that learning about marine biology can and should be exciting and interactive, through fun social events, group study halls, field trips, casual volunteer opportunities, and body meetings. We also offer career outreach opportunities to members, like guest speaker visits at our body meetings, grad school preparation workshops, class schedule planning discussions, and an opportunities board in our Discord server.

Check out the links below to get involved. We hope you'll join us!

linktr.ee/marinebioucf
summary: MBEAC is a club working to promote education in marine biological topics, provide career outreach opportunities for students, and create a social understanding of the importance of our planet's oceans.

name: Marine Environment Robotics
summary: The mission of MER (Marine Environment Robotics) Knights is to provide an environment for students to grow their knowledge in robotics in marine application. They will contribute their experience to real world situations through competitions and more.

name: Master of Social Work Student Association
description:
Thank you for your interest in the Master of Social Work Student Association (MSWSA) at UCF! The goals of our organization is to create a supportive environment where MSW students can connect with one another, practice self-care, network and engage in professional growth opportunities through MSWSA-sponsored meetings and events.

 

You must be an actively enrolled student in UCF's Master of Social Work program to apply.

 

Membership includes a t-shirt and participation in MSWSA-sponsored events. 
 
Apply to become a member here: MSWSA Application
 
The one-time membership fee is $10. Cash, Check, Money order or Venmo @ucfmswsa payments can be given to our MSWSA Advisor, Mrs. Mays. Please email Jessica.Mays@ucf.edu to coordinate drop-off. 
 
To receive your t-shirt and participate in events, you must pay your $10 membership fee AND accept your Knights Connect invitation that will be sent to your UCF email. 
 
All MSWSA communications will be sent to your UCF email, as well as Discord. To stay updated, follow us on Instagram: @mswsa.ucf and please join the Discord here:https://discord.gg/5z8bjHRtGW

 

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact MSWSA@ucf.edu. Thank you!
summary: To enhance the graduate education experience through social service activities and community involvement.

name: Material Advantage
description:
To promote the understanding and application of Material Science and Engineering materials in terms of research, design, reliable manufacture, use and economic and social benefits. This is accomplished via a unique global information-sharing network of interaction among members in forums and meetings, education programs, and through publications and electronic media. some of the Goals are listed as follows:

  • Networking and making contacts vital to members' interests
  • Provide state-of-the-art means for disseminating information pertinent to the community
  • Promote technology transfer and, thereby, the economic health of our industries
  • Provide means for the professional development and career maintenance of members
  • Assume a leadership role in Material Advantage community by promoting collaboration and alliances among materials societies and organizations in order to strengthen the technological basis of the profession and our members
  • Participate in the development of students for entry into the Material advantage chapter
  • Encourage professionalism, ethical behavior, and concern for the environment
summary: Our objective is to promote the understanding and application of the interdisciplinary field of Materials Science and Engineering in terms of research, design, reliable manufacture, economic and social benefits.

name: Mediation Team
description:
Students will learn the process of Mediation, learn how to deliver a mediator’s opening statement, work with and be part of a team atmosphere, learn how to solve issues between parties constructively according to the law.

 

Interested in Joining? Please email sa746701@ucf.edu or christy.foley@ucf.edu for more information.
summary: Help students learn the process of mediation, honing their skills to compete in tournaments.

name: Medical Mentorship and Shadowing Program
description: Through learning modules and mentorship, the Medical Mentorship Shadowing Program (MMSP) provides participants with a deep understanding and preparedness of the activities and requirements needed to be a successful candidate for the M.D. program at the UCF College of Medicine and other medical institutions. The MMSP connects students who have a strong academic record and a passion for medicine with faculty members and community physicians for insightful discussion and experiences. We believe that mentor relationships, when paired with facilitated learning sessions, will help qualified students better prepare themselves according to medical school admissions requirements and inspire them to pursue a career in medicine or another health-related profession.
summary: The mission of MMSP is to empower future healthcare professionals through mentorship and learning, providing the knowledge, skills, and experiences needed for medical school and impactful careers in healthcare.

name: MEDLIFE
description:
MEDLIFE Orlando, founded in 2013, is a branch of the international non-profit organization MEDLIFE. MEDLIFE is a secular, volunteer-run global health organization whose mission is to help families achieve greater freedom from the constraints of poverty, empowering them to live healthier lives. Our patients did not choose to be poor, but they do choose to strive for a better life. MEDLIFE stands beside them in this pursuit.

https://medlifeucf.wixsite.com/home

name: Meeting Professionals International
description:
MPI stands for Meeting Professionals International, and MPI Knights is the student chapter of the larger MPI Orlando chapter.  We create numerous opportunities for our members to network with industry professionals, participate in different site tours, attend panels with guest speakers, and learn through the workshops we host. In addition, we strongly value the connections our members make with one another and provide social and fundraising events to foster and grow the community that is MPI Knights. 

MPI Orlando, our parent chapter, is “an organization dedicated to your personal and career success where you’ll connect with the innovative learning, passionate people and big ideas that will empower you to become an agent of change and reinvent the world”. Becoming a member of MPI Knights will help you build connections with MPI Orlando to attend their monthly meetings, education sessions, and networking events to meet industry professionals and learn more about the event industry.

To stay up to date with everything we're doing, follow us on Instagram @mpiknights!
summary: MPI Knights is a student organization that partners with our local professional chapter to offer students education, networking, and convention experience in Orlando. We have events for students in the hospitality, event and entertainment industry!

description: The Men of Integrity Founded January 11, 2003 serves to be a pivotal aspect of the community. As a co-ed minority organization we strive to foster the ideals of manhood, perseverance and service while advocating human rights. We are here to build an element of family to those who so dwelling. We strive to foster a mindset of mentorship, leadership, professionalism, unity and most of integrity to the service that we provide to our community.
summary: Men of Integrity is a co-ed community service-based organization which also focuses on the development of minority males instilling the ideals of leadership, pro-activity, and independence.

Follow Out Instagram for questions and updates. @CLUBSOCCERUCF !!!

 

We are a competitive soccer team here at UCF. We mainly play against schools within the Southeastern United States as well as from across the country. The team has had much success in the last three years building a respectable reputation in the south east region. If you are interested in trying out for the team, please get in contact with one of our officers. We offer tryouts the second week of each spring and fall semester.

name: Men's Ultimate Frisbee Club @ UCF
description:
Men's Ultimate Frisbee at UCF is a traveling, competitive sport club. The sport of Ultimate is physically demanding but tremendously fun. It complements certain rules of American football and soccer with those that make Ultimate unique. The club boasts two highly successful teams: the Dogs of War (A-team) and Havoc (B-team). Regardless of skill, a spot is always guaranteed on the team. If you play, you'll notice a tremendously quick improvement and will have experiences you'll never forget.

 

PRACTICE TIMES:

Tuesday: 8 to 11 Turf Field 6

Thursday: 5 to 8 North Grass
summary: Men's Ultimate Frisbee at UCF is traveling, competitive sport club. The sport of Ultimate is physically demanding but tremendously fun. It compliments certain rules of American football and soccer with those that make Ultimate unique. The club boasts t...

name: Men's Volleyball Club at UCF
description: The Men's Volleyball Club at UCF is a competitive volleyball team that competes in both local and nationwide tournaments.  The club practices three times a week and participates in other activities outside of volleyball such as community service events and fun socials. We normally have 3-4 teams per semester, A team being composed of the most skilled players, B team being the next best team, and then C team is normally a developmental team where players learn the skills to move up to our A and B teams. Over the past 10 years, our A team has consistently been ranked within the top 25 teams in the nation at the end of each year by NCVF. In this past season 2023-2024, as well as the 2019-2020, A team battled their way to the highest ranking in our team’s history, 2nd in the entire nation according to NCVF rankings. Our A team not only won 1st place in the Silver Division I at the NCVF, but they also went undefeated and won first in the 2024 ECVA Division I Championship. 2024-2025's B team finished 3rd place overall in D3AA at nationals in Phoenix, Arizona, placing the highest in B team's history. We hope to compete and bring home more podium finishes at Kansas City in 2026!
summary: The Men's Volleyball Club at UCF provides a competitive volleyball environment for all students to enjoy!

name: Mental Monthlies
summary: The mission of Mental Monthlies is to raise mental health awareness in Orlando youth through volunteer educational seminars/workshops, promoting early intervention, reducing stigma, and teaching strategies for mental well-being.

name: Mexican Student Association
description:
Mission

The mission of Mexican Student Association is to serve as liaison between the Mexican community and the UCF community to support and unite Mexican students at UCF. MexSA is committed to providing social, cultural, and educational awareness amongst the UCF community about the Mexican people.

Goals

The goal of MexSA is to unite students at UCF to help and support each other throughout their educational journey at UCF. MexSA, as UCF, stands for opportunity. This organization will make sure that its members excel at UCF by providing them proper leadership and personal growth experiences. MexSA will offer a safe, comfortable, and judgement-free environment for students to come together and smoothly adjust to the campus life. Discussions about personal experiences and cultural diversity will serve as the primary source for developing harmony and friendship among all its members and the rest of UCF student body. MexSA, as the acting Mexican institution at UCF, will look after the educational and social development and progress of the Mexican community within Orlando, especially in the University of Central Florida.
summary: MexSA is committed to providing social, cultural, and educational awareness amongst the UCF community about the Mexican culture, traditions, and customs.

name: Mindful Readers Club
description: Hello Everyone! Mindful Readers Club is a club where individuals are able to feel themselves and learn about psychology through literature, as well as make friendships for the rest of their college career. We focus on reading books that have to do with different disorders. We would dissect them together and be able to come together as a community to be able to have fun while learning psychological disorders and their symptoms, and how other interpret the books. We would also have activities like making bookmarks, collaborating with our local library, having blind dates with books, and movie nights! Follow our Instagram to stay updated with new events and activities!
summary: The mission of MRC is to connect a community of students passionate about psychology and interested in exploring the human mind through the lens of literature. Our mission is to foster intellectual curiosity, critical thinking, and personal growth.

name: Model United Nations UCF
description:
Model United Nations at the University of Central Florida is UCF’s Model United Nations team. UCFMUN is a student organization in which students can learn about the United Nations, international relations, and the vastly diverse cultures and countries from around the world.

Every year, the UCF delegation travels nationwide to participate in several Model UN conferences. UCFMUN is an award-winning delegation that has, in the past, participated at conferences such as DawgMUN (University of Georgia), SunMUN (University of Florida), NCSC (Georgetown University), McMUN (McGill University in Quebec), NoleMUN (Florida State University), and more.

Besides attending conferences, UCFMUN hosts KnightMUN, a yearly Model UN conference for high school students. The mission of KnightMUN is to provide an environment where students can engage in meaningful discourse, hone their leadership and collaboration skills, and gain a deeper understanding of global issues. 

To stay updated, please follow our Instagram (@ucfmodelun) and join our Discord group! We are a students-only group, and no previous Model UN experience is needed. You are also welcome to email our President at unaucfpres@gmail.com if you have any questions!

https://discord.com/invite/FZGbGEHk5S
summary: Model United Nations at the University of Central Florida is a student organization where students can learn about the United Nations, international relations, and the vastly diverse cultures and countries of the world.

name: Moot Court at UCF
summary: The mission of the Moot Court Organization is to foster a community of students who share an interest in the law, to allow for discussions of constitutional issues, and to develop advocacy skills through participation in scrimmages and tournaments.

name: Moroccan Student Society
summary: Our goal is to promote a better understanding of Moroccan culture, heritage, and society among the University community, while also creating opportunities for networking, mentorship, and career development for Moroccan students.

name: Mothers and Children Health Association
description: We are proudly partnered with hospitals and clinics such as AdventHealth and Grace Medical Home, as well as organizations like the Mother’s Milk Bank of Florida to serve mothers and children in historically underserved communities. Ultimately, our work aims to combat the maternal health crisis in the United States.
summary: Our organization is centered on improving the health of women and children through our reproductive health and safe sleep workshops, mother-infant donation drives, clinical and non-clinical volunteering events, and advocacy opportunities amongst others.

name: Mu Sigma Upsilon Sorority, Incorporated
description: Mu Sigma Upsilon Sorority, Incorporated was founded on November 21, 1981 as the first Multicultural sorority in the nation. This organization is comprised of women from various ethnic backgrounds, races, religions and creeds. The sisters of MSU share their culture and continually make efforts to educate society on those differences. This is the strength and core of their diverse sisterhood. They have a willingness to succeed, a sense of purpose to hold to their discipline of academic excellence and dedication to enrich the community.
summary: Mu Sigma Upsilon Sorority, Inc. was founded on November 21, 1981 as the first Multicultural Sorority in the nation. This organization is comprised of women from various ethnic backgrounds, races, religions and creeds.

name: Mujeres in Marketing
summary: The mission of Mujeres in Marketing is to educate Latina students aspiring to dive into a career in marketing and related fields by fostering community, providing resources, and promoting professional growth.

name: Multicultural Academic Support Services (MASS)
description: The mission of Multicultural Academic and Support Services (MASS) is to maximize student success by assisting Multicultural and First-Generation College Students in their transition to UCF and by connecting with the University community and our partners to promote and facilitate academic support services and programs.
summary: Multicultural Academic and Support Services (MASS) assists multicultural and first-generation students.

name: Multicultural Association of Pre-Health Students
description:
Welcome to Multicultural Association of Pre-health Students!

 

Watch our introductory video: Click here

 

Since our commencement, we have flourished in aiding underrepresented students into professional schools through career specific meetings, shadowing opportunities, local medical school trips, community philanthropy, and annual attendance to the American Medical Educational Conference hosted by the S.N.M.A.

 

Who We Are:

Multicultural Association of Pre-medical/health Students, or MAPS, represents the undergraduate and post-baccalaureate students of Student National Medical Association (SNMA). (www.snma.org) MAPS chapters are spread throughout the country at over 150 undergraduate institutions. They are well integrated into SNMA's infrastructure, participating in regional and national events. We, along with other chapters in Florida help constitute Region Four. Our organization's advisor is also an academic coordinator with the College of Health Sciences at UCF: Catherine Manz.

Our Objective and Purpose:

To provide underrepresented pre-med/health students with knowledge, skills, and experience that are both prerequisite and concomittant to professional participation in health care fields.

To improve multicultural students matriculation into all professional health related programs, with an emphasis on medicine.

Our group is open to all pre-med, dental, physical therapy, occupational therapy, physician assistant, athletic training, podiatry, optometry, psychology, nursing, and other allied health professions.

***United we aspire, together we Achieve***

Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/mapsucf 

Follow us on Instagram at  https://www.instagram.com/mapsatucf/ 

Visit our website at: https://www.mapsatucf.org

Check out our past events: Click here
summary: Strives to foster a family environment that invites, collaborates, encourages, and educates its members and neighboring community organizations. Our mission is to provide underrepresented students with the knowledge and experience in health care.

name: Multicultural Student Center
description: The Multicultural Student Center (MSC) will help facilitate the inclusive shared learning experience for all UCF Knights. We will promote an environment that acknowledges respects, enhances, and celebrates all aspects of culture. Through intentional programming, with Student Organizations, and the UCF community, we will encourage the educational exploration of multiculturalism, engage in dialogue, challenge assumptions and barriers, and work with the surrounding community to support and build collaborative relationships across the University.
summary: The Multicultural Student Center (MSC) will help facilitate the inclusive shared learning experience for all UCF Knights. We will promote an environment that acknowledges respects, enhances, and celebrates all aspects of culture.

name: Multilingual MedSpeaks
summary: The mission of Multilingual MedSpeak is to educate individuals on essential health and emergency terminology across languages, empowering them with life-saving knowledge and fostering global communication through guest speakers and events.

name: Muslim Student Association
description:
The mission of MSA at UCF is to provide, in accordance with the teachings of Islam, religious services, social services, academic services, and community services along with spreading the logical and beautiful message of Islam and engaging in interfaith. 

linktr.ee/Msa_ucf
summary: The mission of MSA at UCF is to provide, in accordance with the teachings of Islam, religious services, social services, academic services, and community services along with spreading the logical and beautiful message of Islam and engaging in interfaith.

name: Narcare at UCF
summary: The mission of Narcare is to reduce opioid overdose deaths by distributing Naloxone, raising awareness on prevention, and ensuring every individual has the opportunity for survival, recovery, and a healthier future.

name: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
description:
The mission of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People at UCF is to inform youth of the problems affecting African Americans and other racial and ethnic groups; to work to educate and advance the economic, social, and political status of these marginalized communities; to foster harmonious cooperation with the rest of society; to stimulate an appreciation of the African Diaspora and other people of color’s contribution to civilization; and to develop an intelligent, bold, and effective youth leadership.

Goals:

  • To promote proactive political and community activism and advocacy through methods of democratic participation and civic engagement.
  • To spread awareness of relevant issues and current events that may impact such marginalized communities.
  • To raise public awareness of the necessity of positive youth engagement.
  • To provide young people with personal and leadership development training.
summary: Founded February 12, 1909, the NAACP is the nation’s oldest, largest and most widely recognized civil rights organization.

name: National Association of Black Accountants
description:
Are you a student looking to advance your educational, professional, and personal goals?
Do you want to network with top employers and explore valuable internship and job opportunities?

If so, NABA UCF is the perfect organization for you!
We welcome all majors and are a community of driven, ambitious students committed to helping one another grow. Our mission is to empower the next generation of leaders through mentorship, development, and opportunity.

Together, we lift as we climb, and we want you to be a part of it.
Join us and unlock your full potential. Hope to see you soon!

Any Questions? Please email nabaucf@gmail.com or nabaucfvp@gmail.com
summary: NABA UCF empowers students of all majors through mentorship, networking, and career opportunities. Join a supportive community, connect with top employers, and unlock your full potential—together we lift as we climb! Email nabaucf@gmail.com

name: National Association of Black Journalists
description:
Mission Statement: To prepare, encourage, and educate minority students pursuing careers in the media.

The mission of the National Association of Black Journalists is to act as a peer group of like-minded students working towards their personal and professional goals. The National Association of Black Journalists strives to help students with learning skills associated with the journalism major and provide them with information about professional development opportunities.

The National Association of Black Journalists hopes to create a presence on campus for students who need to be surrounded by career-oriented individuals who are determined to have a job in the communication field post-graduation. In terms of our members, the organization wishes to give them as much information as possible before they join the workforce.
summary: The National Association of Black Journalist is an organization created to assist students that are looking forward to careers in the media industry after graduation.

name: National Association of Health Services Executives at UCF
description: The mission of the National Association of Health Service Executives (NAHSE) at UCF is to promote the advancement and development of black healthcare leaders and elevate the quality of healthcare services rendered to minorities and underserved communities. NAHSE participates in local and national programs and projects designed to improve the quality, access, and availability of health services and to expand educational opportunities in the field of health services administration. Serves as the official liaison between national NAHSE and UCF.
summary: NAHSE at UCF promotes the advancement and development of black healthcare leaders and elevates the quality of healthcare services rendered to minorities and underserved communities.
categoryNames: ['Community Innovation and Education', 'Health Professions and Sciences', 'Black', 'Downtown ']

name: National Association of Hispanic Journalists
description:
The National Association of Hispanic Journalists (NAHJ) at UCF is dedicated to the recognition and professional advancement of hispanic students in journalism and other areas in the media. NAHJ is an educational and charitable association, which offers scholarships, conferences and other opportunities.

Here at UCF, we promote internships and create a student-produced webcast each semester. Any students who are interested in diversity and inclusion in the media are welcome to join our club, regardless of major or background.
summary: NAHJ at UCF is dedicated to the recognition and professional advancement of hispanic students in journalism and other areas in the media. Any students interested in diversity and inclusion in the media are invited to join!

name: National Black Law Student Association
description:
UCF's chapter of the National Black Law Student's Association(NBLSA) is a nationally recognized pre-law organization that is geared towards developing successful legal professionals who are driven and enthusiastic to bring about meaningful change in our communities and throughout the globe. We take great pride in helping all members get a step closer to their fulfilling careers within the legal field. 

 

NBLSA strives to provide academic enrichment and professional development within a culturally diverse atmosphere. We discuss a variety of social issues, business etiquette, resume and personal statement critique as well as law school and LSAT success strategies.

 

We host an array of professionals within the legal field and give plenty of networking opportunities including highly respected lawyers, judges, law students and deans and other law school and LSAT representatives. We take great pride in our organization and would love to share that with you.
summary: UCF NBLSA is dedicated to fostering academic and professional competence, and bringing about meaningful legal and political changes in our communities. We welcome all UCF Students, regardless of background.

name: National Marrow Donor Program at UCF
description:
NMDP at UCF is a student-led organization focused on education, recruitment, and fundraising to support patients in need of marrow and stem cell transplants. Our mission is to raise awareness about blood cancers, disorders, and the importance of donor registration.

Education efforts include workshops, campus events, and drives that aim to dispel myths and provide accurate information about the donation process. By fostering informed conversations, we help students understand how they can make a life-saving impact.

Fundraising supports both patient-centered initiatives and our on-campus activities. Funds raised go toward outreach, research support, and hosting events that strengthen our community’s ability to contribute meaningfully.

Recruitment involves engaging students and the campus community through events designed to connect potential donors to opportunities for joining the donor registry. We guide individuals through the process and help them take the first step toward becoming a match.


Text “UCF” to 61474 to learn more or start your journey today.
summary: NMDP at UCF is a student-led organization focused on raising awareness about blood cancers and disorders through education, donor recruitment, and fundraising initiatives to support patients in need of life-saving stem cell and marrow transplants.
categoryNames: ['Community Innovation and Education', 'Health Professions and Sciences', 'Medicine', 'Nursing', 'Service', 'Medical Service']

name: National Organization for Women at UCF
description:
NOW at UCF works to provide a strong intersectional feminist presence that impacts our campus and the greater Orlando community. In practicing intersectional feminism, our club warmly welcomes persons of all gender identities, sexualities, racial and ethnic backgrounds, and socioeconomic standings. It is our belief that inclusive, intersectional feminism is the only true form of feminism. As political, economic, and social forces continue to deprive women, transgender, and non-binary people of safety from violence, fair and equal treatment in the workplace, access to reproductive healthcare and comprehensive sex education, and much more both in this country and abroad – it’s crucial that young feminists take initiative to raise awareness about the persisting need for gender equality, as well as leading the way to take action. 

Our club has been working to eliminate the patriarchy since 2005!

 

PLEASE JOIN US ON

- REMIND APP: 

https://www.remind.com/join/nowucf

- GROUP ME: 

https://groupme.com/join_group/90400188/7jLYsER8
summary: NOW at UCF is an intersectional feminist group focused on educating the UCF student body on feminist perspectives through activism and advocacy for equal rights.

name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
summary: NPHC is a collaborative organization composed of nine historically African-American fraternities & sororities. The council serves as a way for these organizations to interact while exchanging information regarding forums, meetings and various activities.
categoryNames: ['Greek: National Pan-Hellenic Council', 'Service', 'Social/Political Awareness', 'Black', 'Greek: Greek Council']

name: National Society of Black Engineers
description:
The National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) is the largest student-run organization in the nation, committed to advancing the academic, professional, and personal success of its members. At our chapter, we host events throughout the academic year that promote academic excellence, technical growth, leadership, and community service.

 

Check out our website for more information. Also, follow us on Instagram and join our Discord to stay up to date on our events!

 

Our efforts extend beyond college campuses through our Pre-College Initiative (PCI) program, where we inspire and support youth in pursuing higher education and careers in STEM. From mentorship to hands-on workshops, we aim to build a strong pipeline of future engineers.

 

In addition to our core programming, we offer general socials and chapter bonding experiences that help cultivate a welcoming, supportive community. As a chapter, we are dedicated to empowering our members to grow academically, professionally, and personally.
summary: The National Society of Black Engineers Mission Statement is, "To increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers, who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community."

name: National Society of Black Women in Medicine
description: The National Society of Black Women in Medicine is an organization that strives to provide underrepresented black women with the skills, knowledge, and experiences to professionally participate in health care fields and scientific disciplines. We strive to uplift the lives of women in the black community who aspire to pursue a career in medicine and/ or science. Through volunteer, unity, mentorship, and research we strive to empower the minds of our future female health professionals. We plan to implement strategies for our future female physicians and healthcare professionals that will ensure that they are trailblazers in the scientific and healthcare field.
summary: The National Society of Black Women in Medicine is an organization that aims to support underrepresented black women in navigating the pre-health rigors by providing networking opportunities, guest speakers, clinical workshops, and volunteer experiences.

name: National Society of Leadership and Success
description:
The NSLS is the largest leadership honor society in the United States. Our NSLS chapter at University of Central Florida was started in 2003. Our local chapter is part of the national organization with 700+ chapters and over 1.4 million members.

Students are selected based on exemplary academic achievement. Our members are given access to:
· More than $400,000 in scholarships.
· An exclusive NSLS job board.
· A personalized letter of recommendation.

The NSLS leadership program teaches the interpersonal skills that employers seek to give you an edge in the job market. Hear directly from current members as they share how their experience has changed their life.

If you become a member, some of the other benefits are:
· Learn from exceptional leaders like former presidents George Bush and Barack Obama during exclusive Speaker Broadcasts.
· Meet new friends and make lifelong connections (on-campus and virtually).
· Overcome challenges with success coaches shortcutting your way to success.
· Access to private networking events.

Visit the NSLS website to learn more about and accept your nomination at www.nsls.org

Frequently Asked Questions:
Some of the common questions we receive are listed below. If you have any other questions, visit nsls.org to chat with a team member or email help@nsls.org.

What do I have to do to become inducted?
Our five-step program takes approximately 10 hours over the course of the semester at your pace.

Is this recognized on campus?
We are a Registered Student Organization (RSO). There are also more than 1.4 million members nationwide.

I am interested in joining but I haven't been invited what do I do?

Feel free to fill out the nomination for at https://members.nsls.org/nomination/application
summary: We Build Leaders Who Make a Better World

name: National Student Speech Language Hearing Association (NSSLHA) - Orlando
description:
HOW TO BECOME A UCF NSSLHA MEMBER

NOTE: Membership applications for Fall 2025 will open on August 11th, 2025!

 

Step 1. Request NSSLHA membership on Knight Connect (Click ‘Join’ on our page)

Knight Connect provides you with access to emails from the organization, your service record, and events such as our General Body Meetings, and more!

 

Step 2. Complete the appropriate e-application and submit your chapter dues (link in application)

Please Note: requests are approved during the following application acceptance windows:

Membership applications are open from August 11th, 2025 through October 10th, 2025!

Undergraduate Application: 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSccN4a0J4-GlA15R6vO5RlezP6iOjbbCUSnH2IWC-x1QyTWQg/viewform?usp=dialog

Graduate Application:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScxygOasX8aRXVdzcatP2GMqsBsvPdzZYicVivaQrB9ezgXnw/viewform?usp=header

 

Step 3. Once we receive your e-application and dues, you will be accepted as a member on Knight Connect and are welcome to sign up for events, meetings, and workshops! :)

** Please note that if you are a current/existing member who already has approved access to our Knight Connect page, you still need to complete an application for each school year and pay chapter dues to be considered an "active" NSSLHA member. Otherwise, you will be removed from the roster **

If you have questions about this, please email secretary.ucfnsslha@gmail.com. **

Be sure to visit our website (https://ucfnsslha.com/) and follow us on our social media (see the icons below) to keep up to date and network with members! 


What is UCF NSSLHA?

The National Student Speech-Language Hearing Association (NSSLHA) Chapter at The University of Central Florida strives to connect members with opportunities to enhance what is learned in the classroom and apply it to real-world observations and participation. Through partnerships with other campus organizations, fundraisers, socials, volunteer opportunities, and guest speakers we provide a plethora of outlets for our members to network with students, and professionals in the Orlando area.

What do we do?

In the past, we have partnered with the Special Olympics of Florida, Autism Speaks, UCF CARD & UCF PALS, Ronald McDonald House, and groups such as the American Sign Language Club and UCF Best Buddies. Socials for members have included, Lake Claire picnics, ropes courses at the Recreation and Wellness Center, and bowling just to name a few. Guest speakers have included UCF professors, organization representatives, audiologists and SLP's, and individuals experiencing a communication disorder. NSSLHA maintains a close relationship with the School of Communication Sciences and Disorders the UCF Communication Disorders Clinic located in Research Park providing us with many volunteer opportunities and unique experiences that are given exclusively to members.

In the upcoming year, we plan to expand the opportunities through more socials, a wider variety of guest speakers, and participation in more campus events.
summary: NSSLHA is designed for both graduate and undergraduate students interested in the study of normal and disordered human communication. Students interested in pursuing careers in Speech-Language Pathology and/or Audiology are highly encouraged to join!

name: National Student Speech Language Hearing Association (NSSLHA) - Southern Region
summary: Our organization is a small step in preparation for ASHA after the completion of the Masters program.  We aim to serve the community by voluntering in events related to speech and hearing disorders.

summary: Neg Kreyol’s purpose is to instill unity within men of Haitian descent. This is to help promote more Haitian men as leaders and role models to the younger generation and peers within UCF and the community.

name: Neuroscience Alliance at UCF
description: The mission of Neuroscience Alliance at UCF is to promote awareness, research, and opportunities in neuroscience at UCF. By encouraging professional relations between students and faculty, students will be provided with opportunities and exposure in current research, potential career paths, and provided with advice and information for a future career in neuroscience. These goals shall be achieved through providing meetings and speeches related to neuroscience, potential outreach in the form of shadowing neuroscience related professionals, volunteering at schools, hospitals, or other such facilities, and creating committees involving projects and ideas relevant to neuroscience within any area such as medicine, philosophy, psychology, biotechnology, psychiatry, computer science, chemistry, cognitive science, linguistics, mathematics, engineering, and physics.
summary: The mission of Neuroscience Alliance at UCF is to promote the incorporation of different disciplines and apply them towards a better understanding of the neurosciences.

name: Nexus at UCF
description:
Produced at UCF, Nexus is a premier business podcast featuring in-depth conversations with industry pioneers, scholars, leaders, and global change-makers.

We dive into emerging trends, strategies, and the evolving landscape of business to equip students, professionals, and entrepreneurs with the insights needed to navigate the complexities of today, and prepare for the opportunities and challenges of tomorrow.

Whether it's revolutionizing industry or reshaping organizational practices, these real-world stories and insights offer a fresh perspective on innovation, impact, and the breakthroughs that occur when visionary thinking meets the pace of modern innovation.

Join us as we connect you to the future of business.
summary: Connecting you to the future of business.

name: Office of Research and Community Engagement
description:
The Burnett Honors College has long been known for providing quality instruction in our classrooms and laboratories so that our Honors graduates are prepared for rich and productive lives in the workplace. We have now expanded our educational horizons so that our students are well educated for citizenship as well as for careers. One of the most important attributes of the UCF college experience is community engagement, which enhances one’s personal and professional life. By serving others, students develop the ability to lead, to communicate effectively with diverse populations, and to understand complex issues within their community.

Through the Honors Freshman Symposium, Elevation Fellows Program and the Honors Educational Reach Out (HERO) opportunities, the number of students who are interested in, excited about, and involved with community engagement at The Burnett Honors College has grown tremendously over the past five years. These opportunities provide students with a chance to contribute to their community, to take what they have learned in the classroom and the knowledge that they have acquired from their college experience and apply it for a greater good. By being engaged citizens, students not only make connections within the broader community, but also make connections within their respective student community. Being civically responsible affords students the chance to serve as leaders and mentors, communicate their shared interests and passions, and collaborate to change the way that future generations think about their livelihood.
summary: The Burnett Honors College has long been known for providing quality instruction in our classrooms and laboratories so that our Honors graduates are prepared for rich and productive lives in the workplace. We have now expanded our educational horizons so

name: Office of Student Involvement (OSI)
description:
The Office of Student Involvement (OSI) supports student success and enhances the campus environment by focusing on our core principles – Connect, Involve, Impact -through quality programs, services, student leadership opportunities, and intentional environments.

Begin your journey by joining one of our Agencies or over 670+ Registered Student Organizations across all UCF Campuses. Take the initiative to join a committee, apply for a leadership position, build friendships, and increase your marketability. Our agencies coordinate events and provide programming and services enjoyed by thousands of students every year.

Equipment Rentals for RSOs

FIRST-COME FIRST-SERVE BASIS

Requirements:
- Equipment will only be available for registered and active RSOs in good standing with the University
- Equipment will only be available to reserve by Authorized Officers and pick-up must be done by an Authorized Officer or a designated person by the requestor
- Authorized Officers must present their Student ID to the OSI Front Desk

Available Equipment (for RSOs):
- 11 Tents
- 23 Tables 
- 35 Chairs
- 4 Hand trucks
- 11 Swipe card readers

*available inventory subject to change*

Submit the RSO Equipment Rental Form.

RSO Equipment Rentals for Tailgates

FIRST-COME FIRST-SERVE BASIS

Requirements:
- Pickup starts at 4 PM or an hour before the University closes
- There is a high demand and limited supply of equipment; the only eligible items for check-out are: (1) tent, (1) table, and (2) chairs based on availability

When you arrive at OSI to check out the equipment, please fill out the Tailgate Rental Agreement Form.
Note: The Tailgate Equipment Rental Form will go live a few hours before kickoff on gameday. The link will not work until then.

*Please do not fill out the form before picking up in person as we CANNOT reserve or guarantee that equipment will be available once you arrive*

Other RSO Benefits offered by OSI:
- Printing: 250 copies per week (one-sided) or 150 copies per week (two-sided)
- Posting your flyer on two bulletin boards located in the Student Union for a specified period – subject to change based on space and availability
- Arts & Crafts Station
summary: OSI supports student success and enhances the campus environment by focusing on our core principles – Connect, Involve, Impact - through quality programs, services, student leadership opportunities, and intentional environments.

name: Office of Sustainability Initiatives
description: We understand that the complex global challenges of today impact us all. We recognize that these challenges cannot be solved alone. We are heavily invested in building relationships within our community, partnering with local organizations, neighboring colleges, and key stakeholders to achieve our goals. With an eye to the future, our vision is to create a campus environment that informs and grooms the leaders of tomorrow.
summary: At Sustainability Initiatives, we seek to create an environment where ideas are freely shared, partnerships are formed and solutions are uncovered in the pursuit of environmental, economic and social sustainability.

We strive to better the lives of others worldwide by collaborating with organizations and volunteering trough a flexible service program.
summary: "Today's friends, tomorrow's leaders, forever in service."

name: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.
description:
The purpose of this chapter shall be to bring about a union of Omega men on the local, state, district and national levels who manifest high ideals of manhood, scholarship, perseverance, and uplift in order to:

a)    Stimulate the attainment of high ideals;

b)    Disseminate and inculcate these ideals among those with whom it comes in contact;

c)    Occupy a progressive and constructive place in the civic life of the community, state and nation;

d)    Keep Omega forever burning in the hearts of her gallant sons; and

e)    Remind the brothers of their responsibility to keep Omega forever progressive and strong.
summary: The purpose of this chapter shall be to bring about a union of Omega men on the local, state, district and national levels who manifest high ideals of manhood, scholarship, perseverance, and uplift

name: Omicron Delta Kappa National Leadership Honor Society
description:
Omicron Delta Kappa, the National Leadership Honor Society, was founded December 3, 1914 at Washington and Lee University in Lexington, Virginia by 15 student and faculty leaders. The founders formulated the idea that leadership of exceptional quality and versatility in college should be recognized, that representatives in all phases of college life should cooperate in worthwhile endeavors, and that outstanding students, faculty, and administrators should meet on a basis of mutual interest, understanding, and helpfulness.  OΔK® was the first college honor society of a national scope to give recognition and honor for meritorious leadership and service in extracurricular activities and to encourage development of general campus citizenship. Since its founding, Omicron Delta Kappa has initiated over 300,000 members.

The Society recognizes achievement in the following five areas:

  • Scholarship
  • Athletics
  • Campus or Community Service, Social or Religious Activities and Campus Government
  • Journalism, Speech and the Mass Media
  • Creative and Performing Arts

 

If you are interested in joining, please visit our website to complete the online application at: https://membership.odk.org/audience/prospective_members/membership_application_form
summary: National leadership honor society for UCF students

name: Orientation Team
description:
Orientation Leaders (OLs) serve as critical members of the First Year Experience (FYE) team and are current undergraduate students who are dedicated to UCF and seeking to serve on a team of role models for all UCF students. We aren’t going to lie: this position is demanding. But when done well, we believe it’s more rewarding than any other job on campus! You and your teammates get to shape the experiences and journey of thousands of new students and families coming into UCF! You become a first friend, a mentor, resource, and source of knowledge and inspiration to new Knights!

Apply by Wednesday, October 5, 2022. Application available Monday, August 22, 2022.

name: Orthopedics and Athletic Medicine
description: Our goal is to build a large and diverse cohort of passionate pre-health students dedicated to a future in orthopedic medicine and the world of athletics. name: OSI Productions
description:
OSI Productions limits service to UCF departments outside of OSI, SG, SJA, and Pegasus Palooza in an effort to provide quality service to our internal areas. If seeking our services from outside the previously mentioned areas please email OSIProdirector@ucf.edu for further assistance.

OSI Productions will not be reviewing forms during the following time periods:

- Final Examination Periods 

- Winter Break 

- Spring Break

Please note that during our busy seasons for OSI agencies, including Homecoming (October/November), UCFestival (March), and Knight-Thon (March), there may be delays in response to request from outside our agencies.

 

OSI Productions is a student-run production group funded by Student Government. As a team we work to provide high-quality video, photo, and livestream content to various departments and agencies across campus.

If you wish to learn more about our organization, please feel free to send us an email at osiprodirector@ucf.edu

For service requests scroll down to our forms section.

To view form status and submissions follow these guidelines: click here.

Re-submitting forms: click here.
summary: OSI Productions is a student-run video production group funded by SG. As a team we work to provide high-quality video, photo, and livestream content to various departments and agencies across campus.

name: OSI Volunteerism and Community Engagement
description: The Volunteerism and Community Engagement Center (VCE) is a part of the Office of Student Involvement (OSI), located in suite 154 of the Student Union. We focus on volunteerism and community engagement within our UCF community and in the Greater Orlando community. VCE now houses the Alternative Break program, Volunteer UCF, AmeriCorps, Community Connectors, as well as other programs, organizations, and initiatives connected to volunteerism.
summary: The Volunteerism and Community Engagement Center (VCE) is a part of the Office of Student Involvement (OSI), located in suite 154 of the Student Union.

name: Out in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics at The University of Central Florida
description:
We are Out in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics at The University of Central Florida (oSTEM at UCF), a professional development organization focused on uniting students of STEM majors and LGBTQ+ identities. Our mission is to create and cultivate an environment where students at UCF, of all gender and sexual identities can unite, learn about various internship and employment opportunities, connect with a variety of professionals in STEM fields, and cultivate their personal and professional appearances to help maximize their success post-graduation.

We are the local chapter of the national organization Out in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics, and we are dedicated to continuing their work here at UCF.
summary: The mission of oSTEM at UCF is to empower LGBTQ+ students in STEM to succeed personally, academically, and professionally by building an environment and community that nurtures innovation, leadership, and advocacy.

name: Outlanders at UCF
description:
Welcome!

 

Hello and welcome to Outlanders at UCF! We are a camping and general outdoorsmanship club here at the University of Central Florida. We offer students the opportunity to experience the outdoors in a fun and stress-free way. It is our goal to foster a community of outdoor enthusiasts to promote interpersonal connections, outdoorsmanship, and environmental awareness. Trips are cheap and we offer free equipment rentals!

 

Want to learn more about us? Register with us here on KnightConnect and then join our Discord linked on our instagram! You can meet some of our members there and perhaps see some of the trips we have hosted in the past. You MUST be registered with us on KnightConnect (using your UCF Login) to view our upcoming trips. We look forward to seeing you around 

Instagram: @outlandersucf

Link Tree (discord linked): https://tr.ee/O1TPQ2m76J
summary: We, the Outlanders at UCF, hereby solemnly swear to get you outside hiking, camping, and canoeing while making new friends and eating plenty of s'mores! We're the general outdoors club, so if you need a breath of fresh air, check us out!

name: Paintball Club @ UCF
description:
Our Mission is to promote the sport of paintball locally and to win at the collegiate level of competitive paintball. Our club supports both recreational players, competitive players, and NEW PLAYERS as well! PLEASE EMAIL/MSG DIRECTLY BEFORE JOINING THE GROUP!

name: Panhellenic Council
description: The UCF Panhellenic Council is the governing body over the twelve National Panhellenic Conference (NPC) sororities located on our campus. The Council is comprised of ten executive officers, chapter presidents, twelve chapter delegates, and junior delegates. It is the responsibility of the Council to unite all chapters in the spirit of Greek unity, to enforce the NPC guidelines, and to oversee and regulate the recruitment process. The Council works year round to promote positive ideals of sorority life at UCF, and contribute to the UCF community through involvement, leadership, academic, philanthropy, school spirit, and overall support.
summary: The Panhellenic Council is comprised of twelve recognized National Panhellenic Conference sororities.

name: Partners in Health ENGAGE@UCF
description:
Partners in Health ENGAGE is a grassroots, student run organization that fights for global health equity and social justice. We are a part of a nation-wide network of other student organizations that work together to achieve our shared goal of global health equity. We organize a wide range of events including fundraisers for public health projects around the world, meetings with members of congress to advocate for global health legislation, and educational events to inform the community on issues relating to global health. If you are interested in joining our movement please reach our via the link below or contact our E-board!

https://linktr.ee/pihe_ucf
summary: The mission of Partners in Health ENGAGE-UCF is to fight for global health equity and advocate for the right to health.

name: Pathway to Professions in STEM
summary: The mission of Pathway to Professions in STEM is to be a community-driven organization that enhances public speaking, STEM knowledge, and professional development through presentations, mentorship, volunteer opportunities, guest speakers, and workshops.

name: Pediatric Association of Caring Knights
description:
The mission of the Pediatric Association of Caring Knights is to provide specialized opportunities for students aspiring to enter a medical or medical affairs-based profession with an interest in pediatrics through community involvement, educational seminars, and networking.  

It is the goal of PACK to:  

  • Foster an educational and welcoming connection between our members and the youth of Central Florida. 
  • Provide members with a variety of beneficial volunteer opportunities.  
  • Provide members with a variety of educational opportunities. 
  • Develop members into professional and competitive applicants for future ambitions.
summary: To provide specialized opportunities for students aspiring to enter a medical and public affairs-based profession with an interest in pediatrics through community involvement, education seminars, and networking.

name: Pegasus Palooza
description: As UCF's official Welcome Week, Pegasus Palooza returns every Fall semester with over a week full of social, academic, and service activities for students to get acquainted with the UCF campus, meet people, and simply to have fun! Whether you are a freshman or senior, transfer or regional campus student, there are events for everyone to enjoy!
summary: As UCF's Official Welcome Week, Pegasus Palooza returns every Fall semester with a week full of social, academic, and service activities for students to get acquainted with the UCF campus, meet people, and simply to have fun!

name: Pegasus Pilots
description:
Pegasus Pilots is UCF's one and only, all-encompassing aviation RSO on campus! If you're interested in aviation, flying, and/or piloting aircraft (whether for fun or as a career), then this is the organization for you. Everyone, no matter how little or much experience they possess, is welcome to join! Our members range from enthusiasts to certified flight instructors (CFIs), with more than 1000 flights hours. 

 

Pegasus Pilots hosts monthly General Body Meetings (GBMs) with guest speakers from the aviation industry, as well as a number of aviation-related activities, such as airshow trips, facility tours, socials, workshops, museum volunteering, a flight school partnership, and more!

 

Looking to join? Want to see more of what we do? Check out our YouTube here, follow us on Instagram here, and join our Discord here! We don't just take off - we charge on!
summary: UCF's one and only, all-encompassing aviation RSO on campus. All are welcome, from enthusiasts to experienced pilots. We don't just take off - we charge on!

name: Perfect Pair
description:
The UCF chapter of Perfect Pair has some of the following goals:
Enhancing the quality of life of older adults: The primary goal of Perfect Pair is to enrich the lives of the elderly by providing them with companionship and emotional support. The UCF chapter of Perfect Pair may seek to achieve this goal by organizing regular visits, community events, and other activities that allow older adults to interact with college students.
Building meaningful relationships: Perfect Pair aims to foster genuine connections between older adults and college students. The UCF chapter may strive to create opportunities for long-term relationships to form, which can provide both parties with a sense of purpose and fulfillment.
Providing volunteer opportunities: College students who participate in Perfect Pair gain valuable experience in volunteering and serving the community. The UCF chapter may seek to provide students with meaningful volunteer opportunities that allow them to make a difference in the lives of others.
Raising awareness about older adult loneliness: Perfect Pair recognizes that loneliness is a widespread issue, and aims to raise awareness about it. The UCF chapter may strive to educate the local community about the importance of addressing this problem and encouraging more people to get involved in helping seniors.
Perfect Pair is a non-profit organization, and the UCF chapter may need to fundraise to support their efforts. The chapter may organize events and activities to raise funds that can be used to support their programs and cover the costs of providing activities and resources for the seniors they serve.
summary: Perfect Pair is a non-profit organization that aims to connect older adults in assisted living facilities with college students to provide them with meaningful interactions and alleviate loneliness and boredom.

name: PERIOD @ UCF
description:
PERIOD@UCF aims to educate on and advocate for menstrual equity and is dedicated to philanthropic and charitable services to the student, local, national, and global communities. We strive to do so by donating PERIOD packs, partnering with local organizations, educating the community, pushing for period policy changes, and fostering productive conversation about the stigma and topic in general.

 

2025 - 2026 Executive Board:

Co-presidents: Meera Lakshmanan & Ritisha Suresh

Vice President: Shreyaashri Selvakumar

Treasurer: Madison Diaz

Secretary: Spurthi Nrusimhadevara

Media Relations: Mia Ladores
summary: The purpose is to serve the menstruators of the community by providing PERIOD packs, educate the community on menstruation, advocate for period policy on campus and in our schools, and fundraise for PERIOD packs for menstruators in need.

name: Peruvian Student Association
description:
Mission

The mission of the Peruvian Student Association (PeruSA) is to socially, academically, and professionally unite all students, alumni, and faculty, by fostering and promoting the Peruvian culture at both the University of Central Florida and the overall Orlando community.

Goals

The goal of Peruvian Student Association (PeruSA) is to serve as a nucleus for networking with Peruvian students, alumni, faculty, and other regional or local organizations. It shall be open and accessible to everyone thus providing a cultural liaison between the Peruvian community and UCF at large. PeruSA will strive to raise awareness of Peruvian culture for the students at UCF and the community.
summary: The mission of PeruSA is to socially, academically, and professionally unite all students, alumni, and faculty, by fostering and promoting the Peruvian culture at both the University of Central Florida and the Orlando community.

name: Phi Alpha Delta Pre-Law Fraternity
description:
https://www.pad.org/page/JoinPAD
Connect with us on Instagram
 
Phi Alpha Delta Law Fraternity, International is a professional law fraternity advancing integrity, compassion and courage through service to the student, the school, the profession and the community. We are the preeminent law fraternity promoting the bonds of fraternalism and we are the leader in the development and advancement of professional ideals.

The purpose of this Fraternity shall be to form a strong bond uniting students and teachers of the law with members of the Bench and Bar in a fraternal fellowship designed to advance the ideals of liberty and equal justice under law; to stimulate excellence in scholarship; to inspire the virtues of compassion and courage; to foster integrity and professional competence; to promote the welfare of its members; and to encourage their moral, intellectual, and cultural advancement; so that each member may enjoy a lifetime of honorable professional and public service.
summary:
Visit www.ucfpad.com for more information

name: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc.
description: On June 8, 1978, the Iota Rho chapter began to leave an untouchable mark on the University of Central Florida’s campus. Even now, 47 years later, the distinguished men of this chapter continue to make strides in the community and on campus with such events as Dodge For Change, Sleep Out for The Homeless, and many others. The honorable men not only know how to help service the Orlando community but also know how to serve the UCF community through fun events and activities such as Walk-Like-A-Sigma, The Miss Phi Beta Sigma Pageant, Love Jones and many other events. Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Incorporated itself has an undeniable legacy and has the honor of being associated with great men such as George Washington Carver, Reverend Al Sharpton, Huey P. Newton, Emmitt Smith, and the list goes on. Every day, the brothers of the Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Incorporated work diligently to make our collegiate and greater Orlando community stronger with our motto “Culture for Service and Service for Humanity.”
summary: Fraternity founded on the principles of Brotherhood, Scholarship, Service. Our Motto: Culture for service and service for Humanity

name: Phi Delta Epsilon International Medical Fraternity
description: Phi Delta Epsilon is a co-ed professional fraternity, focused on creating physicians of integrity with a life-long commitment to our guiding principles of philanthropy, deity, and education. Our organization does so through fellowship, service, mentoring, and formal training in leadership, science, and ethics. UCF’s FL Beta Chapter consists of a group of individuals representing a variety of diverse cultures, backgrounds, character and personalities, and strives to connect members with medical students, practicing physicians and emeritus members to gain first-hand information about medical school and the medical profession.
summary: Phi Delta Epsilon is a co-ed medical fraternity for men and women aspiring to be future physicians. We provide leadership and service opportunities, in addition to a variety of social and cultural events for our supportive family of members.

name: Phi Delta Phi Legal Honor Society
description:
Phi Delta Phi International Legal Honor Society

ΦΔΦ – UCF Hall seeks to promote scholarship, integrity, ethical conduct and excellence while preparing interested students for law school upon graduation.

 

  Phi Delta Phi©® is the oldest legal organization in continuous existence in the United States, predating even the American Bar Association. It was founded in 1869 at the University of Michigan School of Law by four law students, who at the urging of their faculty, endeavored to create an association that would foster scholarship, civility, and ethical conduct in our profession. Since that time, Phi Delta Phi©® has grown beyond the borders of the United States to Canada, Latin America and Europe.
 
Phi Delta Phi©® celebrates academic excellence and embraces the finest attributes of professionalism and scholarship. Since our founding, Phi Delta Phi©® has emphasized to students and lawyers alike the importance of our calling. Our active membership is drawn from those students of the law who not only have shown themselves companionable, but have manifested ability and industry in legal study
 
ucfpdp.com
http://www.phideltaphi.org/
 
 
Find us on Facebook @ Phi Delta Phi UCF Hall
Find us on Instagram @UCFPhiDeltaPhi  
 
Meetings for Fall 2023 are TBD. Follow the Instagram for more information.
summary: The purpose of this organization is to promote the advancement of the highest intellectual, professional, and ethical standards within the University of Central Florida community.

description: Being part of a fraternity would also involve upholding certain traditions, rituals, and values that are important to the organization. name: Phi Eta Sigma National Honor Society
description:
The mission of Phi Eta Sigma is to not only reward academic excellence, but to encourage students to continue to excel in their scholastic endeavors.

Joining Phi Eta Sigma means becoming a part of a nationwide community that dedicated to achieving excellence and elevating the college experience. By becoming a member of Phi Eta Sigma, students have access to exclusive scholarships opportunities and programs that are specifically designed to enhance their academic and professional development.

Phi Eta Sigma provides more than $400,000 in local and national scholarships through our Founders Fund and chapter resources. Phi Eta Sigma prides ourselves in awarding scholarships to students who have demonstrated leadership, service, academic excellence, and a commitment and involvement within Phi Eta Sigma.

In Phi Eta Sigma, we believe in providing opportunities for our students to grow holistically through the development of their mind, health, and character. These three values provide the foundational component for all Phi Eta Sigma programming at the National and Regional levels.

We are a network of students, alumni, and faculty/staff who are dedicated to an elevated college experience for themselves and others. Our society offers opportunities for networking, engagement, and meaningful connections on our campus and throughout the nation. As a member, you will have exclusive access to events, and resources that will assist you in building your community within Phi Eta Sigma.
summary: The mission of Phi Eta Sigma is to not only reward academic excellence, but to encourage students to continue to excel in their scholastic endeavors.

name: Pineapple Theatre Club
description:
Mission

The mission of Pineapple Theatre is to create, entertain, and inspire audiences through imaginative storytelling. We are driven by a firm belief in the power of quality and innovative artistic performances. We welcome students of all majors who have a love for theatre to join our community of creatives and find an outlet to continue performing without majoring in the arts, but also welcome students of the entertainment industry to gain experience in production roles to assist them in their professional careers.

Goals

  • Promote a safe place to acquire skills in performance and backstage at UCF’s Rosen Campus.
  • To demonstrate our skills through productions and showcases on UCF’s Rosen Campus.
  • To offer other forms of involvement in the theatrical world, including but not limited to, promotional and technical production.
  • To reach out to the Orlando community through performing arts 
  • To advocate for entertainment study-centered students through internships and experience. 
  • To put on events for all students at UCF to attend and the Orlando community.
  • To Co-Program with RSOs and agencies on campus to promote the awareness of art and performance production.
  • To provide entertaining experiences for members to network with one another.
summary: Pineapple Theatre is to offers a creative and social outlet in the form of theatrical performance and production talents for students of all majors!
