name: Pre-Dental Student Association
description:
The purpose of our organization is to prepare our members to become well-informed, exceptional candidates when applying to dental school. We offer members clinical experiences, shadowing, DAT & application workshops, guest speakers, leadership opportunities, and networking events. Not only is this a great place to learn more about the field of dentistry, but to also build a supportive community at UCF! We invite you to learn more about us and all of the great resources we have to offer!

 

 

If you would like to join our organization, please pay your membership dues on our website PDSAUCF.com. Once you have paid your dues and joined our Knight Connect, you will be added to our mailing list and receive a Weekly Email from us every Monday after you have joined detailing our upcoming events and how to sign up for them. Please check your spam/junk/promotions folder if you do not start receiving emails the Monday after you pay your dues.

 

 

Because our events are limited we do not share them on Knight Connect: you MUST pay your dues in order to receive updates about our events. 

 

The "Contact" feature on Knights Connect, is NOT the best way to reach us. If you have any questions, please email us at PDSA.UCF@GMAIL.COM or check out our website PDSAUCF.COM. Make sure to follow us on Instagram @UCF_PDSA and join our official Discord to see what we’re up to and get quick updates about upcoming events. We look forward to meeting you!
summary: This club is dedicated to guiding students who are interested in the field of dentistry. Our club offers resources to learn more about dentistry, improve oral health in the community, and become a competitive dental school applicant.

name: Pre-Optometry Association
description:
The mission of the Pre-Optometry Association (POA) is to equip students with the knowledge and resources needed to pursue a career in optometry. Through exposure to the application process, the Optometry Admission Test (OAT), insights from practicing optometrists, and volunteer opportunities, POA supports students on their path to optometry school. This club provides a welcoming environment for like-minded students who want to help others see the world in perfect clarity.

 

The best way to keep up to date with our events is to follow us on Instagram @UCF_PREOPTOMETRY
summary: The mission of the Pre-Optometry Association is to prepare students for the optometry profession. Students can learn about the application process, gain insights from optometrists, and participate in volunteer activities.

name: Pre-Pathology Society
description:
The Pre-Pathology Society (PPS) at UCF is a student-led organization dedicated to exploring the hidden world of pathology, the science behind diagnosing disease and uncovering truth in medicine and forensics. We give students an inside look at careers that often go unnoticed but are critical to healthcare, justice, and research.


What sets PPS apart is our Path to Pathology (P2P) Program, a semester-long mentorship track designed to help students build the academic and professional foundation for medical or graduate school. Through resume/CV workshops, advising on degree planning, and personalized guidance, members gain tangible progress toward their goals while earning recognition through our PPS medallion ceremony.

 

Our members also benefit from:

  • Guest speakers and networking with pathologists, forensic professionals, and medical scientists

  • Research opportunities in pathology-related labs at UCF and beyond

  • Volunteering and outreach with community partners like medical examiners’ offices and nonprofit organizations

  • Professional development including graduate/medical school preparation, shadowing, and leadership experience

 

PPS is more than just a club, it’s a launchpad for students fascinated by disease, justice, and the science that brings hidden stories to light. Whether you dream of becoming a physician, forensic pathologist, or biomedical researcher, PPS equips you with the tools, experiences, and community to turn curiosity into impact.

 

Make sure to join our groupme! https://groupme.com/join_group/97598545/wbGtYH2g
summary: The Pre-Pathology Society (PPS) connects students interested in pathology, forensics, and medicine through guest speakers, research, volunteering, and mentorship to build skills, explore careers, and join a supportive community.

name: Pre-Professional Medical Society

The Pre-Professional Medical Society (PPMS) is a unique organization that unites pre-professional students with diverse career aspirations based on their many common interests. PPMS provides its members with a variety of speakers from interrelated professions, giving members an inside look at their future careers. Our members gain an edge over competing professional school applicants by becoming knowledgeable of admission processes as well as current issues in healthcare. Members are supplied with ample opportunity to help those in need by volunteering in our local community. PPMS creates a supportive environment for our members through various social events, allowing our members to build trusting relationships with their peers. Our ultimate goal is to see that each member is accepted into the professional school of their dreams.

 

 

Go to our website for all important information!

name: Pre-Student Osteopathic Medical Association
description: Pre-Soma is a student-led organization at UCF that aims to promote Osteopathic Medicine by building connections with members from all levels, including students and physicians. Our mission is to provide pre-medical students with access to meaningful experiences that foster academic growth, clinical exposure, leadership development, and service to the community. With this strong community, we can help our members gain all of the tools needed for professional school.
summary: Pre-Soma aims to promote Osteopathic medicine by building connections with members from all levels including, students and physicians. With this strong relationship we can help our members gain all of the tools needed for professional school.

name: Pre-Veterinary Society
description:
Welcome to the Pre-Veterinary Society at the University of Central Florida! As Pre-Veterinary students dedicated to entering a competitive field, this organization provides a means for learning about the academic process and the opportunities available within this career. As a member of the PVS, students are given the chance to network with their peers and veterinary professionals.

We are nationally affiliated with the American Pre-Veterinary Medical Association (APVMA) and winner of the “APVMA 2012 Oustanding Club Community Service Award“.

Be sure to join us on Instagram and Facebook! And explore our website to learn more about us and to discover helpful resources for pre-veterinary students.
summary: The mission of the Pre-Veterinary Society(PVS) is to provide fellowship and exchange among students interested in veterinary medicine.

name: President's Leadership Council
description:
President’s Leadership Council (PLC) at the University of Central Florida (UCF)  is a select group of 35 student ambassadors who demonstrate leadership, service, scholarship and academic excellence. Council members serve the university in a variety of capacities, including hosting special guests on and off campus and at various presidential events, such as appreciation receptions, university Board of Trustees’ and state Board of Governors’ functions, and the President’s Suite at campus sporting events.  The PLC also serves as an extension of the presidency, allowing students to take

an active advisory and advocacy role on campus.
summary: President’s Leadership Council (PLC) at the University of Central Florida (UCF)  is a select group of 35 student ambassadors who demonstrate leadership, service, scholarship and academic excellence.

name: Pride Student Association
description:
Looking for more LGBTQ+ friends? Pride Student Association is committed to celebrating and unifying the LGBTQ+ community on the UCF campus.

Mission:

The Pride Student Association is dedicated to fostering a vibrant and inclusive environment for the LGBTQ+ community at UCF. Our mission is to celebrate diversity, promote unity, and empower individuals by providing a platform for networking, education, advocacy, and social engagement.

Purpose:

  1. Networking and Socializing: Through regular meetings and events organized by the Pride Student Association and local affiliates, we offer opportunities for LGBTQ+ students to connect, build friendships, and create a supportive network within the UCF community.

  2. Discussion and Intersectionality: We facilitate open and critical discussions about current events affecting the LGBTQ+ community, emphasizing intersectionality and the experiences of gender and sexual minorities that often go overlooked in broader conversations.

  3. Inclusion and Acceptance: Our organization strives to include and amplify the voices of gender and sexual minorities who are often marginalized within the larger LGBTQ+ community. We seek to create a safe space where all individuals feel heard, valued, and supported.

  4. Social and Political Outreach: We engage in social and political outreach activities to support representatives and candidates who share our goal of LGBTQ+ inclusion and acceptance. By advocating for policy changes and promoting LGBTQ+ rights, we aim to effect positive societal change.

  5. Education and Awareness: Through various events, we aim to educate and raise awareness among the UCF student body and local residents about the LGBTQ+ community. Our goal is to foster understanding, challenge stereotypes, and promote a culture of acceptance and respect.

Join the new Pride Student Association Discord server! You do not need to be a member to attend our general body meetings. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us via e-mail.
summary: The mission of Pride Student Association is to provide a unifying student-led group that promotes acceptance, diversity, and a safe social environment for students of various sexual and gender identities engaging in social and political awareness.

name: Progressive Black Men, Incorporated
description:
Progressive Black Men, Inc. aims to eradicate negative stereotypes placed on those of African descent through Academic Excellence, Communal Support, and the Fellowship of Brothers.

 

Our vision is to reconstruct and redefine the image of the Black male and uplift people of African American through: Brotherhood, Community Service, Humanitarian Aid, and the Development of High Standards of Personal Integrity and Moral Character.

 

PBM was founded on the campus of Florida State University on November 27th, 1989.

 

The UCF Chapter, nicknamed "Famous", was chartered on November 9th, 2014.

 

Our brothers have held numerous titles & achievements on campus such as Homecoming King, Mr. UCF, Mr. CSA, Mr. NCNW, and Black Student Union president.

 

Miss Progressive Black Men Scholarship Pageant, Women Appreciation Night, and Walk a Mile in Her Shoes are just a few of the notable events held on campus.

 

Follow us to stay up to date on all upcoming events & information:

Website: ucfpbm1989.org

Instagram: @ucf_pbm

Twitter: @pbm_ucf
summary: Progressive Black Men, Inc. aims to eradicate negative stereotypes placed on people of African descent through Academic Excellence, Communal Support, and the Fellowship of Brothers.

name: Project Downtown Orlando at UCF
description:
The mission of PROJECT DOWNTOWN ORLANDO AT UCF is to contribute to the well-being of the greater
Orlando community by providing necessary services to the homeless, indigent, and disadvantaged communities. PDO at UCF aims to foster a positive volunteering and educational environment through cooperative social
work and outreach.
summary: PDO @ UCF aims to foster a positive volunteering and educational environment through cooperative social work and outreach as well as providing necessary services to the unsheltered, indigent, and disadvantaged communities.

name: Project Spotlight
description: Based out of UCF’s main campus, Project Spotlight is a student developmental theatre company dedicated to workshopping and producing new, student-written works while providing students of all majors opportunities to create theatre in multiple capacities. In our various festivals and productions throughout the year, students may participate as an actor, director, playwright, stage manager, dramaturg, or designer. We also offer a weekly playwriting club!
summary: Project Spotlight is a student developmental theatre company dedicated to workshopping and producing new, student-written plays while providing students of all majors opportunities to create theatre in multiple capacities.

name: Project Sunshine at UCF
summary: The mission of Project Sunshine is to deliver the healing power of play to children with medical needs through trained and dedicated volunteers.

name: Psi Chi The National Honor Society in Psychology
description:
The UCF Orlando Chapter of Psi Chi provides students with opportunities to grow socially, professionally, and academically within the field of psychology. As such, Psi Chi hosts club meetings, volunteer activities, and a formal induction ceremony each semester to celebrate our member's academic accomplishments and to help our students expand on their undergraduate career as psychology majors. 

*Membership on Knightconnec does not reflect official membership with Psi Chi the International Honor Society in Psychology.
summary: The UCF Orlando Chapter of Psi Chi provides students with opportunities to grow socially, professionally, and academically within the field of psychology.

name: Psi-Chi International Honor Society of Psychology - Lake Mary
description: Psi Chi is an international honor society that awards academic recognition to students who achieve scholastic excellence in the study of psychology. The UCF-Lake Mary chapter of Psi Chi hosts meetings and events in the pursuit of encouraging and stimulating the academic and professional growth of its members.
summary: To award academic recognition to students who achieve scholastic excellence in the study of psychology while encouraging and stimulating the academic and professional growth of its members.

name: Psy-Squared - Sanford/Lake Mary
description: Psy-Squared is an organization aimed at the advancement and development of graduate students in the field of clinical psychology
summary: Graduate student organization for the Clinical Psychology M.A program at the Sanford / Lake Mary campus

name: Psychedelic Science Club
description:
Psychedelic Science Club at UCF is a student-led organization dedicated to exploring the scientific, medical, and interdisciplinary study of psychedelics. Our mission is to create a welcoming space for students to learn, discuss, and engage with this rapidly growing field through an academic lens.

We focus on:

  • Education: Hosting speaker events, workshops, and reading groups to share knowledge on psychedelic research, history, and policy.

  • Research Opportunities: Connecting students to labs, conferences, and faculty doing work related to neuroscience, psychology, pharmacology, and anthropology.

  • Harm Reduction & Wellness: Promoting evidence-based harm reduction practices and fostering honest, stigma-free conversations about mental health.

  • Community & Collaboration: Building an inclusive, interdisciplinary community of curious students and collaborating with other campus organizations for events, service, and outreach.

Whether you’re passionate about neuroscience, psychology, pharmacology, public health, philosophy, anthropology, or simply curious about the future of psychedelic science, you’ll find a place here to learn, connect, and contribute.
summary: The mission of Psychedelic Science Club is to explore the therapeutic potential, science, and cultural context of psychedelic substances through academic discussion, education, and harm reduction principles.

name: Psychological Society
description:
It is our intent and purpose to provide students with educational as well as entertaining activities within the realm of psychology. We aim to serve as a forum for students to discuss psychology, its related issues, and how it affects student life. This organization also seeks to provide students with exposure and insight into the different areas of psychology, volunteer opportunities, graduate programs, and prospective employment opportunities.

 

Video introduction to the club

 

Fall 2025 Club Membership Application are open until 9/30 at 11:59 PM!
 
How to Become a Member of Psych Society:
  1. Select “Join” on our KnightConnect page
  2. Complete and submit the Membership Application Form.
  3. Pay dues. Dues are $25 for one semester OR $40 for the year (Fall and Spring semester). If you are interested in purchasing a club t-shirt, it will be an additional $5.
  1. Log on to our Discord page and put your first and last name in the #names channel.
  2. Congratulations! You are now a member of Psych Society!
 
Discord link: https://discord.gg/jbgED96qjg
summary: It is our intent and purpose to provide students with educational as well as entertaining activities within the realm of psychology. We aim to serve as a forum for students to discuss psychology, its related issues, and how it affects student life.

name: Puerto Rican Student Association- Central Florida
description:
The Puerto Rican Student Association-Central Florida serves as a liaison between the UCF and the Puerto Rican community to support and unite Puerto Rican students at UCF. PRSA-CF is committed to providing social, cultural, and educational awareness among the UCF community about the Puerto Rican people. We want to create a safe space where Puerto Rican can embrace their culture and feel close to home. 

The goal of PRSA-CF is to unite the Puerto Rican students at UCF to help and support each other throughout their educational journey at UCF. Also, PRSA-CF, like UCF, stands for opportunity. This organization will make sure that its members excel at UCF by providing them with proper leadership and personal growth experiences. PRSA-CF will offer a safe, comfortable, and judging-free environment for Puerto Rican students to come together and smoothly adjust to campus life. Discussions about personal experiences and cultural diversity will serve as the primary source for developing harmony and friendship among all of its members and the rest of the UCF student body. PRSA-CF, as the acting Puerto Rican institution at UCF, will look after the educational and social development and progress of the Puerto Rican community in Orlando and Central Florida.
summary: The Puerto Rican Student Association-Central Florida serves as a liaison between the UCF and the Puerto Rican community to support and unite Puerto Rican students at UCF.

name: Punjabi Student Association
description: We are a group of motivated students originating from the states of Punjab in Pakistan and India that were divided following the largest mass migration in history during the partition in 1947. We are striving to promote and showcase our beautiful and shared Punjabi culture with one another and to the greater UCF community.
summary: Punjabi Student Association at UCF aims to spread awareness about the rich heritage of the Punjabi culture by hosting meetings, fundraisers, and formal and philanthropic events for all!

name: Qualitative Research Club
description: The Qualitative Research Club is a community for graduate students, faculty, and staff with a vested interest in qualitative inquiry to connect, collaborate, learn, and create partnerships around new and ongoing research projects.

faculty, and staff with a vested interest in qualitative inquiry to connect, collaborate, learn, and create partnerships around new and ongoing research projects.

name: Quiz Bowl
description:
Quiz Bowl is an academic competition between two teams that covers various fields of knowledge, including science, art, history, literature, pop culture, and more. We hold practices 2-3 times per week to prepare for competitions, which we either host or travel to (places of past tournaments include UF, Georgia Tech, Valencia, Columbia University in New York, MIT, and Chicago). We encourage new people to come out to a few practices and experience it for themselves!

Our primary method of communication is our Discord.
summary: Quiz Bowl is an academic competition between two teams in various fields (including science, fine arts, history, literature, pop culture, and more).

name: Quotes, the Ad/PR Club at UCF
description:
Welcome to Quotes, the Advertising and Public Relations Club at the University of Central Florida. Quotes is the local student chapter of FPRA, the Florida Public Relations Association. The value of public relations is essential across all industries and all fields. Whether you’re an advertising and public relations major, a business-related major or even a pre-health major, joining Quotes offers an incredible opportunity for professional development, networking and understanding of public relations for every student.

Quotes serves as the link between your role as a student and your role beyond graduation. The organization provides the unique opportunity to learn more about the profession, make new connections and stay in touch with local practitioners.

Through teamwork and collaboration, the entire executive board has volunteered its time to make this a successful year and looks forward to fostering our shared endeavors.
summary: Welcome to Quotes, the Advertising/Public Relations Club at UCF. Quotes is the local student chapter of the Florida Public Relations Association. The value of PR is essential across all industries and fields, including business, health, law and more.

name: Ratio Christi @ UCF
description: Ratio Christi @ UCF aims to equip university students to give historical, philosophical, and scientific reasons for Christianity. We bring together faith and reason to establish the intellectual voice of Christ in the University. Students, engaged in the battle for the mind, learn to defend God's existence, the reliability of the Bible, and the reality of Christ’s resurrection. Ratio Christi is a safe place to bring doubts, questions, and challenges to Christianity. Our goal is to ask the hard questions and come to reasonable conclusions.
summary: Ratio Christi @ UCF aims to equip university students to give historical, philosophical, and scientific reasons in defense of Christianity and the truth of the Gospel.

name: Real Estate Society
description:
With regular meetings featuring guest speakers from all over the Central Florida real estate community, along with office visits and frequent internship opportunities, The UCF Real Estate Society is the place to be for those interested in real estate regardless of experience or major.

Make sure you're following us on Instagram (@res_ucf), LinkedIn (The UCF Real Estate Society) & Facebook (UCF Real Estate Society) to stay up to date for meeting dates.
summary: The Real Estate Society seeks to cultivate students' interest in real estate by bringing in guest speakers, attending networking events, and hosting social events with other business clubs. We aim to bridge the gap between students and professionals.

name: Reel Knights
description:
The UCF Fishing Club, The Reel Knights, have been UCF's fishing club since 2006. We are a devoted group of sportsman who enjoy the outdoors and just being on the water, while staying actively involved in the UCF and greater Central Florida communities. We have a lot to offer as a club from social aspects, in club tournaments, fishing gear, club kayaks, tackle discounts, and much more.

MEMBERSHIP BENIFITS:

As a member of the UCF Reel Knights you have the following benefits:

Club t-shirt newly designed each year, access to all the clubs meetings and social events, priority entry into the clubs fishing tournaments, access to the clubs kayaks, discounted fishing gear from all our major sponsors, club raffles, club football tailgates, ability to be featured in our professionally-made production films, and lastly the club offers students the ability to make the large student body at UCF feel a little smaller and get to know other students with similar interests, go on fishing trips with each other, and much more.

Members of the UCF Reel Knights also have the option to try out for the UCF Inshore Fishing Team and The UCF Bass Team each year.

Our Mission:
Preserving and promoting the sport of fishing at the University by giving students an opportunity to share their passion with others in a structured, and comfortable atmosphere. 

 

 


Contact Us at: UCF.reelknights@gmail.com

Instagram: @UCF_ReelKnights
summary: The Reel Knights, a club of fishermen and women of all levels.  Joining a club allows UCF's large student body feel a little smaller while making friends with similar interests.  Join us on Facebook: Reel Knights at UCF.

name: Register Student Organization (RSO) Resources
description:
Welcome to the RSO Resources Hub! 

This page serves as your one-stop resource to assist you with the registration/re-registration process and answer any questions about your Registered Student Organization (RSO). We're here to make your experience seamless and successful!  

 

New Organization Registration:
New Organization Registration is now open! Please scroll down and find the form. The form will close November 10th.

 

Looking to Reactivate your RSO? Please schedule an appointment with one of our Graduate Assistants.

Ellie: https://calendly.com/el910486-ucf/30min
Jake: https://calendly.com/ja923053-ucf/30min

 

ASO/DSSO Organizations: If your organization believes it qualifies as an ASO or DSSO, you must email your completed Sponsorship Form and Advisor Agreement form to RSO@ucf.edu and Angely.Tolani@ucf.edu. Please note that there are specific forms for ASO and specific forms for DSSOs, make sure you are submitting the correct set for your classification. OSI will review your submission, and once approved, we will notify you of your official ASO or DSSO classification. Only organizations with official OSI approval will be classified as ASO or DSSO. 

 

What's New?  

We've introduced new RSO Classifications to better support your organization's needs. Here's a quick breakdown:  

- GSO (General Student Organization): Independent student-led groups focused on a shared interest or mission.  

- DSSO (Departmental Supported Student Organization): Directly supported by a university department, with resources and advising provided.  **College/Department/Unit approval required**

- ASO (Associated Student Organization): Affiliated with campus-wide initiatives or umbrella organizations. **College/Department/Unit approval required**  


This change ensures clearer support structures and helps streamline processes for all RSOs.  

 

Required Materials:

In order to create a new student organization, you must follow the steps and collect all the information to complete the application:

  • New Organization Consultation 
  • A constitution (scroll down to the "Files" section of this page for a helpful template).
  • At least 10 UCF student members with NID emails
  • Organization President and at least 1 other officer
  • UCF Staff Advisor (NOT REQUIRED, but HIGHLY ENCOURAGED)
  • Mission that is unique, and not a duplicate of an existing RSO
    • External Affiliation documents (if applicable) -If they are a branch from an existing organization
  • An organization name that does NOT include the University of Central Florida/UCF preceding the name of their RSO (ex. UCF Hiking Knights is not a valid name)

 

To schedule a new organization consultation, visit: https://calendly.com/kortoutreach 

 

Need a Banking Letter?  
Submit a Banking Letter form found under Knight of the Roundtable's KnightConnect Page. Click here to access the form.

Available Forms  
You'll find the following forms on this site:  

- New Organization Registration (available until November 10th)

- Constitution Revision Request  

- Student Leader Eligibility Appeals 

 

Additional Resources

  • A constitution template is available in the Documents section of this webpage.

 

Questions? 

Please take a look to familiarize yourself with our RSO Manual. It is a great resource for all student organizations. You can access it here: RSO Manual 

 

 

- RSO Coordinator, Angely Tolani: angely.tolani@ucf.edu 

- RSO Graduate Assistants: rso@ucf.edu  

 

Office Information  

Location: Office of Student Involvement, Student Union 208  

Email: osi@ucf.edu  

Phone: (407) 823-6471
summary: Welcome! Explore our tabs for more information.

name: Rekonstruktion Dance Troupe Inc.
summary: Rekonstruktion Dance Troupe combines values and principles such as family, loyalty, and dance in the development of dancers with the goal of building confident and successful individuals and responsible people of strong character.

name: Relay for Life at UCF
description: This group is the official contact for Relay For Life at UCF. We fundraise and hold events to benefit the American Cancer Society. The American Cancer Society is the nationwide, community-based, voluntary health organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer through research, education, advocacy, and service. Each year, we hold various events and meetings that all lead up to our main event in Spring! This year, we will be working harder than ever to celebrate, remember, and fight back!
summary: This group is the official contact for Relay For Life at UCF. We fundraise and hold events to benefit Relay For Life and the American Cancer Society.

name: ReliefShare @ UCF
description:
Who are we? 

ReliefShare @ UCF is a nonprofit organization that takes medical surplus from hospitals that donate it to us and send it to countries where this medical supplies could be used. We also pack meals for places that are affected by food desserts or natural disasters. This is the first chapter on a university campus.

What is medical surplus?

Medical surplus is any expired medical supplies or medical supplies that is unexpired and unused. Usually this expired medical supplies is in decent condition and can be used to an extent. The condition of medical supplies will be examined by the recipient. Unexpired medical supplies maybe be donated to us in the case that a Hospital changes the brand of supplies and must remove all of the previous brand’s merchandise by discarding them. 

What will we do at events?

Our events will include sorting medical supplies into 10 categories based on the medical device’s use (e.g Urology, Cardiology, Surgical). Then we would inventory each item into a spreadsheet using a program called Orcascan. The program allows us to scan a barcode or QR code on the device and automatically log it into a spreadsheet.
summary: ReliefShare @ UCF donates unused medical supplies/surplus and meals to disaster-affected regions and countries in need by partnering with other nonprofits.

name: REN Knights
description:
“Huzzah, and welcome to the realm!”

REN Knights is UCF’s home for all things Renaissance! Whether you're a history lover, fantasy nerd, theater kid, DnD devotee, or just someone who thinks chainmail is cool—we've got a seat at the table (right next to the bard).

Our mission is to celebrate the spirit of the Renaissance through immersive, themed events and to find ways for students to experience renaissance fairs for themselves. We strive to build an inclusive community where you can explore, create, perform, and connect—no crown required.

Join our discord and follow our instagram to stay connected!
summary: The mission of REN Knights is to foster an appreciation for the culture, history and arts of a renaissance fair through engagement and inclusivity.

name: Residence Hall Association
description: The Residence Hall Association, more commonly known as RHA, is a registered student organization that is affiliated with the Department of Housing and Residence Life (DHRL) and advised by a full-time DHRL professional staff member. RHA works year-round to bring the best opportunities to residents, and we strive to see them be actively involved in the community. RHA believes that through leadership, programming, and advocacy, our members can grow academically, professionally, and personally to have a more enriching university experience. RHA hosts events that are geared towards providing a fun experience for all on-campus residents. We provide funding to Area Councils in each community so they can do the same for residents across campus. Interested in joining RHA? Follow our Instagram (@rhaucf) and see how you can get involved!
summary: RHA strives to provide residents with a on-campus living experience that compliments their academic experiences through programming, leadership opportunities, and advocacy.

name: Rosen Life
description:
Rosen Life strives to further the sense of UCF spirit and community at the Rosen College campus. This includes, but is not limited to, surveying student opinions, advocating for Rosen College student needs, representing Rosen College students to Student Government, and by providing diverse and unique events for the UCF student body! We are funded through the Activity and Service Fee, allocated to Rosen Life through Student Government and the Office of Student Involvement. Each of our eight (8) directors are responsible for the execution of a specific type of events relating to Rosen Life's mission. The overall function and direction of the organization are managed by the Student Director and Assistant Student Director of Rosen life.

How to Get Involved

If you are interested in getting involved with the Rosen Life, email our RL Outreach Director, Harley Paul, at rloutreach@ucf.edu  for more information. 

Mission

Our mission at UCF's Rosen Life (RL) is to foster a sense of community on the Rosen campus by hosting unique events that effectively cater to our diverse student body, and advocating for their needs however possible.

name: Rowing Club @ UCF
description:
In 1972 the first UCF rowing team was established under the guidance of Coach Dennis Kamrad. Rowing is one of the earliest athletic activities on campus, and was the first UCF program to win a state championship in 1973 and a regional championship in 1972. Since then, both the men's and women's teams have sent UCF rowers to national, international, and Olympic events. We are an extremely competitive team that has won several state titles within the past few years (men's varsity 8 - 2016, men's novice 8+ - 2018 & 2022, men's lightweight novice 4 - 2019, men's novice 4 - 2022, women's novice 4+ 2023, women's novice 8+ 2023) along with a national championship in the women's novice 4 (2022), and has emerged as a well recognized and respected collegiate team. 

Come try us out!

If you would like more information about joining the team look for us on IMleagues at UCF,  email us at Ucf.Mensrowing.Recruitment@gmail.com or DM us on instagram @CentralFloridaRowing to get in contact with us
summary: A highly competitive and nationally recognized co-ed club team founded in 1972  under Coach Dennis Kamrad that has reclaimed the title "fastest club team in the state" along with 2 state titles and 1 national title in the 2022 spring season alone.

name: RPG Knights
description:
Here at RPG Knights you'll be able to meet and discuss whatever story-driven games pique your interest! Come here to meet like minded people, learn about new games, and just have plain fun with the RPG genre.

For information feel free to message us on Discord or contact us through here!
summary: The mission of RPG Knights is to provide a community for students who specifically love single player, story-driven role playing video games, a place to discuss their favorite video games, experience new video games, and, most importantly, meet like-mind

name: RUKUS Entertainment
description: Rukus Entertainment is a hip-hop dance team promoting diversity through our shared interest in music and movement. We are a registered student organization at UCF, hosting auditions each fall and spring semester, welcoming dancers of all levels year-round. No prior experience needed, just a passion for music, dance, and hip-hop culture! Join the Ruk-fam by catching us at upcoming performances across UCF and Central Florida, dropping into our open-to-all classes on Wednesday evenings, or staying connected through our socials for more ways to support!
summary: Rukus Entertainment is a hip-hop based dance team promoting diversity through a shared interest in music and movement.

name: Runway to Hope
description: Through relationships with children’s hospitals, Runway to Hope fosters collaborative efforts among corporations, local businesses, and philanthropists to not only raise funds and awareness but also bring new programs and initiatives to the pediatric cancer community, while providing direct support and aid primarily to Central Florida children and their families impacted by pediatric cancer.
summary: The mission of Runway to Hope’s mission is to support families, primarily in Central Florida, fighting pediatric cancer, while seeking a cure.

name: Russian American Student Association
description:
The Russian American Student Association at the University of Central Florida is a cultural organization with the goal of enriching the community with knowledge about the Russian culture and language. The club strives to show members and the community as a whole the richness of Russian culture by providing an opportunity to see, hear, and taste the culture. The club is open to everyone, not just native Russians.

The Russian American Student Association hosts weekly meetings as well as larger cultural events ranging from musical concerts to ballet. Weekly meetings balance educational and social activities: movies, food, arts, and discussions are a glimpse of what the Russian Club members may experience on a weekly basis.

Members of different ages and from different spheres of life are united by the common curiosity of Russian history and culture. The Russian American Student Association officers and members are determined to build cross-cultural bridges through learning. Sharing experiences of immersive cultural exploration lessens the divide between cultures and nations, which is what the club ultimately hopes to achieve.
summary: The Russian American Student Association provides a community for students interested in the Russian language and culture, as well as the history and traditions of other former Soviet republics.

name: Sailing Club @ UCF
description:
Please reach out to us at sailingucf@gmail.com for any questions.

 

Our site has moved to IMLeagues UCF, you can find us through the RWC Website under "Sport Clubs." If you are looking to contact the club please use any of our other methods of contact (email, groupme, instagram, etc.) We look forward to hearing from you!

 

Mission

The mission of Sailing Club at UCF is to provide students an opportunity to learn and compete in the sport of sailing.

 

Goals

Our goals are to provide all sailors an opportunity to improve in their craft and represent the University of Central Florida on the regional and national stage.
summary: The mission of Sailing Club at UCF is to provide students an opportunity to learn and compete in the sport of sailing.

name: Sales Club of UCF
description: The Sales Club is an organization devoted to setting students up for success. The Sales Club promotes professional selling as a career, but also focuses on developing essential skills that are necessary to be successful no matter what career path you choose. Hence, this club welcomes students from all majors. Sales Club members are continuously improving their verbal communication skills in many fun and rewarding activities. As an active member you will practice and gain valuable knowledge on topics such as, networking, negotiating, business etiquette, public speaking, and body language. You will also learn how to sell your own talents and ideas when interviewing at your job, and in your everyday activities.
summary: Our mission is to help students learn the essentials of landing your dream job, and to provide the networking opportunities to do so.

name: Saudi Students Association
description:
العربية: نادي الطلاب السعوديين بجامعة وسط فلوريدا هو كيان طلابي يسعى إلى أن يكون جسرًا للتواصل بين الثقافة السعودية والمجتمع الأكاديمي الدولي، مجسدًا قيم الكرم والطموح والعزيمة والاعتزاز بالوطن. يهدف النادي إلى دعم وتمكين الطلبة، وتعزيز دوره الاجتماعي والثقافي والرياضي، مع توفير بيئة محفزة تحتضن الجميع وتشجع على تبادل المعارف والخبرات

English: The Saudi Students Association at the University of Central Florida is a student organization that seeks to serve as a bridge between Saudi culture and the international academic community, embodying the values of generosity, ambition, determination, and national pride. The association aims to support and empower students, strengthen its social, cultural, and athletic role, and provide an engaging environment that embraces all members and encourages the exchange of knowledge and experiences.

Español: La Asociación de Estudiantes Saudíes en la Universidad de Florida Central es una organización estudiantil que busca ser un puente entre la cultura saudí y la comunidad académica internacional, representando los valores de generosidad, ambición, determinación y orgullo nacional. La asociación tiene como objetivo apoyar y empoderar a los estudiantes, reforzar su papel social, cultural y deportivo, y ofrecer un entorno estimulante que acoja a todos los miembros y fomente el intercambio de conocimientos y experiencias.
summary: The mission of Saudi Student Association (SSA) is to foster cultural exchange, support Saudi students academically and socially, and strengthen ties with the UCF community through collaboration and shared experiences.

name: Saxophone Club
description: Saxophone Club works to provide weekly saxophone-based educational opportunities for its members. This is achieved through live performances and masterclasses presented by staff or guest artists.
summary: To provide students with opportunities to better understand the saxophone by exposing them to diverse performers and repertoire.

name: Scholastic Association of Graduates in Engineering
description:
SAGE is a CECS student organization committed to serving the needs of graduate students and BS-to-MS students in engineering and computer science. Our mission is to provide the resources to help students succeed personally, professionally, and academically.

To that end, we try to present interesting speakers and useful information at all of our meetings, to provide insights or education in topics ranging from career development and job-seeking, to research skills and technical writing, to work-life balance and mental health. We also host social events to give students a chance to take a break from classwork and research and to meet fellow students outside of their individual labs and departments. Additionally, our organization serves as an advocate, not only listening to the needs of our members and representing their interests with the CECS and UCF administration, but also representing the CECS graduate program as a whole in recruiting new graduate students and providing guidance and support to undergraduates considering applying to graduate school.

Most importantly, we want to help build a community that unites graduate students across CECS, regardless of where they come from, what they're studying, or where they are in their career. In a world where STEM research and industry are increasingly collaborative, interdisciplinary, and interdependent, it's more important than ever to have a diverse network of peers to rely on for information, mentorship, and support.
summary: SAGE is an organization for CECS graduate students dedicated to support student success by providing networking, professional development, and educational opportunities, and fostering a stronger, more united graduate student community.

name: Service-Dog Training and Education Program at University of Central Florida
description:
For information on how to join STEP@UCF, please email stepucf@gmail.com!

STEP@UCF seeks to educate our campus, as well as the general public, about the impact of service dogs and to spread awareness of service dog etiquette and respect. The UCF campus is a wonderful learning ground for our pups with new sights, smells, and distractions galore. 

 

Students will gain knowledge and experience with developmental stages, learning theory, medical care, the impact of early socialization, record keeping and reporting, public relations, public speaking, and communication skills. Additionally, the members will gain disability awareness and knowledge of issues regarding legal aspects of public access for assistance dog users. Our main focus is providing students a fun and rewarding volunteer opportunity that they can take with them outside of college.

 

For more information, please check out our Instagram or Website!
summary: In paw-tnership with Canine Companions (www.canine.org), STEP@UCF seeks to educate our campus, as well as the general public, about the impact of service dogs and to spread awareness of service dog etiquette and respect.

name: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Incorporated
description:
Welcome to the home of the "Flipmode" Lambda Mu chapter of Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. We are so delighted that you have stopped by to browse and to learn more about what Lambda Mu does here at The University Of Central Florida. As part of the illustrious sisterhood of Sigma Gamma Rho, we hold dear to our hearts high scholastic achievement, genuine community outreach, and the elegance that distinguishes successful young women from girls.

 

  In the Spring of 1990, there was a need to finally complete the list of historically black sororities at the University of Central Florida. Therefore, with the help of the Delta Mu Sigma Alumnae Chapter, Lambda Mu's Herstory was created. The void was filled by nine vibrant young women. These women represent four different countries: Antigua, Italy, the Philippines, and the United States. Their main focus of studies concentrated in the following disciplines: the study of life, educational development, business, and the intricacy of engineering. They are the Sorors of "NINE LIVES"
summary: Founded on November 12, 1922, at Butler University by 7 Black Educators. Sigma prides itself in scholarship, service, and sisterhood. We chartered at UCF on February 24, 1990, and we pride ourselves on upholding these values and helping our community.

name: Sigma Lambda Beta International Fraternity, Inc.
summary: Sigma Lambda Beta International Fraternity is a historically Latino-based social fraternity that was founded in 1986 at the University of Iowa based on cultural understanding and wisdom. We believe in the ideals of fairness, opportunity, and equality.

name: Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority Incorporated
description:
During the fall of 1989, the foundation of Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority, Inc. was commenced by collegiate women who recognized the need to form an organization that provided empowerment to women of all cultural backgrounds. Their humble beginnings were built at the University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa where their vision was to create a network of academic and social support for all women/nonbinary. Under the guidance of Esther Materon Arum and Mary Peterson, the vision came to fruition on April 9th, 1990, as the University of Iowa Panhellenic Council officially recognized the organization as a sorority.

Through the continued commitment and leadership of the founding mothers, the operation of Sigma Lambda Gamma has thrived on many college campuses and provides an avenue for educational excellence to women of many nationalities. Our members recognize the need for togetherness and support among members of varying cultures at the university level and they remain dedicated to the overall success of members in a global environment.

Sigma Lambda Gamma is a sisterhood/siblinghood of members who have chosen this affiliation as a manner to achieve personal development and awareness to the responsibility of community involvement for the betterment of our local, regional, national and global communities through the efforts of a network of close to 3,000 sorority members. Furthermore, we continue to be a pioneer in the Greek fraternal world through development of innovative programming initiatives, such as the Young Women’s Leadership Program and Emotional Intelligence.

Today, Sigma Lambda Gamma is the largest and fastest-growing multicultural sorority with a multicultural membership in chapters and alumnae associations throughout the United States – from Arizona to Wyoming; Florida to Minnesota; New York to Texas; and many more states between the coasts of California and Rhode Island. A criterion for membership into Sigma Lambda Gamma is open to members of exceptional morals & ethics with a demonstrated commitment to academic excellence, and who are pursuing or have completed courses leading to a degree in an accredited college of university. Sigma Lambda Gamma is welcome to women, trans women, and nonbinary. Culture is Pride, Pride is Success.
summary: Sigma Lambda Gamma strives to be the premier organization committed to providing a mechanism of empowerment to all women.

name: Society for Human Resource Management
description:
SHRM Student Chapter at UCF is an undergraduate and graduate service chapter that promotes education, networking, and leadership opportunities for Human Resource majors, Business majors, and non-business majors.

Our board of officers strive to provide the best connections on campus and in the community to help students find job placement, internships, volunteer opportunities, and overall experience to separate themselves more marketable.

Throughout the semester, we invite local business professionals from various backgrounds to share their knowledge of current and upcoming trends that will affect the future professional. Outside of meetings, participation as both attendee and volunteer are encouraged at local GOSHRM meetings, HR FL and SHRM conferences, and SHRM Student Chapter at UCF events & activities.
summary: The Society for Human Resource Management Student Chapter at UCF will take you to the next level and provide the resources you need to accomplish your professional goals in human resource management. Open to ALL UCF majors!

name: Society for the Advancement of Minorities in STEM
description:
Join our Discord! https://discord.gg/mKGksEhW

SACNAS (Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Native Americans in STEM) is a national organization with over 150 chapters in universities all over the country (as well as a national research conference every year), with the mission of encouraging more diversity within the STEM fields. Our goal is to foster a community of like-minded students, offer career development opportunities, as well as give back to the community through volunteering, and advocate for access to research, graduate school, and involvement in science and STEM.
All students from all majors/disciplines are welcome to join us!

 

Here are some of the events and workshops we plan to do:

- Workshops on graduate school and summer research programs application process

- Applying for scholarships

- How to get involved in research and find your field of interest

- How to talk/write about your research

- Why you should get involved in research, and/or go to graduate school
summary: To provide a support system ensuring the success of members in academia, encourage and make graduate school accessible to Hispanics/ Chicanos, Native Americans, and other underrepresented minorities in STEM.

name: Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers
description:
SASE is dedicated to the advancement of Asian heritage scientists and engineers in education and employment so that they can achieve their full career potential. SASE’s mission is to prepare Asian heritage scientists and engineers for success in the global business world, celebrate diversity on campuses and in the workplace, and provide opportunities for members to make contributions to their local communities. In addition to SASE National's mission, the University of Central Florida chapter seeks to connect individuals in a way that benefits both their professional and personal lives. SASE membership is open to everyone regardless of background and major. 

 

If you are interested in joining, here is our linktr.ee! https://linktr.ee/saseucf
summary: SASE's mission is to prepare Asian heritage scientists, engineers, and technologists for success in the global business world, to celebrate diversity on campuses and in the workplace, and to provide opportunities for members to volunteer.

name: Society of Environmental Engineers
description:
The Society of Environmental Engineers is a club where students can meet, network, and work alongside other students and Environmental Engineering professionals, gaining valuable knowledge of the field. Though it is primarily aimed at those pursuing a degree in Environmental Engineering, the club is open to and welcomes anyone interested in the subject. 

The club provides several exciting opportunities to learn and gain a deeper understanding of the profession outside the classroom. Guest lecturers come from all disciplines of Environmental Engineering, including wastewater control, air pollution control, and more. These professionals share insights into their careers, life after college, and offer tips on how to be successful in the field. 

In addition to guest lectures, we have attended a variety of specific tours that provide valuable real-world exposure. These include energy plant tours, landfill tours, water treatment plant tours, and wastewater treatment plant tours. These tours give students a firsthand look at the operations and challenges within different sectors of Environmental Engineering. 

SEE also holds several volunteering events throughout the year, giving students a chance to get outdoors and make an impact in local communities. Our involvement with FWEA and AWWA has included beach and river cleanups. In previous years, we have attended specific tours such as plant tours and industry conferences, providing valuable real-world exposure. 

 There are several chances to make a difference throughout the year. Please come out to one of our meetings or events and see what the club is all about! Join our Discord and access our other platforms here!

SEE also represents FWEA and A&WMA here at UCF!

FWEA - Florida Water Environment Association - https://www.fwea.org/

A&WMA - Air & Waste Management Association - https://www.awma.org/
summary: SEE incorporates all sections of environmental engineering: solid and hazardous waste, air pollution, water, and wastewater. We also work with several professional engineering groups such as AWWA, AWMA, and FWEA.

name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
description:
Welcome to the official Knight Connect page for SHPE at UCF!

The Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (SHPE) was founded in Los Angeles, California, in 1974 by a group of engineers employed by the city of Los Angeles. Their objective was to form a national organization of professional engineers to serve as role models in the Hispanic community. This organization made its way to Orlando in 1988.

Our Chapter focuses on the Hispanic population at the University of Central Florida. For our members, we offer workshops, discussion panels, information sessions, and much more to prepare our soon-to-be Engineers for the real world. Companies come to our Chapter to discuss a multitude of topics, such as how to write a winning resume, interviewing tips/techniques and what companies expect out of an entry-level Engineer.

SHPE National's mission is to empower the Hispanic community, so we took it upon our Chapter to engage with the younger community around Orlando to inform them about the importance of STEM. We conduct school visits to middle and high schools through our SHPE Junior Program to present what technical professions are and how they affect our everyday life. We also monitor student competitions for SECME, a statewide program that enables younger student with hands-on projects with basic math and science applications.

With almost 400 members, every day we're closer to reaching the entire Hispanic STEM community at the University of Central Florida. We are devoted to empowering our members to realize their fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support, and development. Leadership is a key element for SHPE and we encourage all members to become leaders within our organization. It’s not only a great experience, but it allows you meet other students and Chapters.

 

SHPE UCF: En la Florida Central, ¡Juntos sin parar!

Register with us to become a member: Membership Registration Form

Make sure to connect with us on our socials:

Discord | Instagram | Website | LinkedIn
summary: To promote the development of Hispanics in engineering, science and other technical professions; To achieve educational excellence, economic opportunity and social equity; To improve our communities through science and technology.

name: Spanish Graduate Association
description:
It is the mission of this organization to provide leadership and educational opportunities for its members. The philosophy, goals, and/or purpose of SaGA shall be to foster the growth of Spanish graduate students and any student who may be interested in Spanish Linguistics, Literature, and Culture through an academic and professional environment.

This purpose shall be achieved by the following:

  1. Promoting the Spanish graduate program of the University to the educational community.
  2. Providing graduate and interested students in Spanish with the ability to offer formal constructive input and feedback to their graduate program.
  3. Providing support for Spanish M.A. students in their research and professional development activities.
  4. Serving as a mentoring body for new students admitted to the program.
  5. Interacting with fellow graduate students and enhancing the social atmosphere through interaction and communication between students and graduate faculty members.
summary: The mission of the Spanish Graduate Association SaGA is to promote, through a professional and academic environment, the growth of Spanish undergraduate and graduate students as well as other students interested in Hispanic language and culture.

name: Speaking Knights @ UCF
summary: The mission of Speaking Knights is to assist UCF students in the development of their public speaking skills and provide opportunities to engage with the UCF Speech and Debate team.

name: Special Olympics College Club at UCF
description:
Special Olympics is a global organization that provides Olympic-style sports training and competition for children and adults with intellectual disabilities. It offers athletes the opportunity to improve their physical fitness, build confidence, and experience joy within a supportive community of fellow Special Olympics athletes. Since its founding in 1968, the mission of Special Olympics has remained the same: "To create a better world by fostering the acceptance and inclusion of all people."

 

The Special Olympics College Club at UCF is a sports club that fosters friendships between college students and individuals with intellectual disabilities through a shared love of sports. The club also continues to lead the social inclusion movement of Special Olympics. By incorporating the three core components of a Special Olympics College Club—Unified Sports, Inclusive Leadership, and Whole School Engagement—we aim to help transform college campuses into communities that reflect inclusion and acceptance.

 

To get updates on events and meetings, follow us on Instagram @ucfspecialolympics and join our Discord! If you have any questions, feel free to message us on any of our platforms or send an email to ucfspecialolympics@gmail.com!
summary: The mission of Special Olympics College Club at UCF is to Connect local Special Olympics athletes and students at the University of Central Florida through sports while also spreading awareness to the public about the importance of inclusivity.

name: Sport Business Club @ UCF
description:
Sport Business Club @ UCF is a premier undergraduate organization dedicated to preparing students for influential careers in the sports, entertainment, and media industries. Grounded in experiential learning and strategic industry engagement, SBC provides members with opportunities to develop critical business skills, explore emerging trends, and connect with leading professionals across the country.

Through speaker panels, site visits, competitions, leadership development programs, and collaborative projects, the club bridges the gap between academic theory and real-world application. Members are encouraged to lead with purpose, think critically about the evolving sports landscape, and engage with ethical, inclusive practices that reflect the complexities of modern sport business.

SBC is deeply committed to creating a space that reflects the diverse voices, backgrounds, and ambitions of UCF’s student body. By promoting equity in access, representation, and leadership, the club ensures that all students—including first-generation and underrepresented populations—have a pathway into high-impact roles in the industry.

Backed by partnerships with the DeVos Sport Business Management Program and a growing national network, SBC is building one of the most dynamic, student-driven sport business ecosystems in the country. Whether you aspire to work in team operations, marketing, law, analytics, or media, the Sport Business Club @ UCF is where future leaders begin their journey.

We appreciate all our members for their dedication and enthusiasm, which propel our community forward. Thank you for your commitment and contributions that enrich our collective experience and success.

 

How do I join?

1) Register on KnightConnect!

2) Join our Flare! (This is where all our important dates, opportunities, meeting times, etc, are all posted!)

3) Fill out the Membership Form & pay dues* (instructions on the linked Google Form!)

NOTE: If, for any reason, you are unable to pay dues but would still like to be a member of SBC @ UCF, please email ab081126@ucf.edu, and we will make sure to work something out!
summary: Sport Business Club @ UCF prepares students for careers in sports and entertainment through hands-on experiences, professional development, and national networking—building one of the most dynamic undergraduate sport business communities in the nation!

name: Sport Club Council
description:
The University of Central Florida (UCF) Sport Club Council is an agency of the UCF Student Government Association (SGA) and is advised by the Sport Club Staff at the UCF Recreation & Wellness Center (RWC). Each Sport Club is a Registered Student Organization (RSO) with the Office of Student Involvement (OSI). Sport Clubs exist to promote and develop interest in a particular sport activity. Interests may be competitive, recreational, instructional or any combination of the three. Participation in Sport Clubs is strictly voluntary and membership is open to all currently enrolled UCF students who are paying the Activity & Service Fee. As RSO’s, clubs are developed by students for students under the supervision of the Recreation & Wellness Center. The Sport Club staff of the RWC believes that involvement in the Sport Club Program enhances development, leadership, and the overall college experience for students by supplementing skills learned in the educational realm. It is the mission of the program to provide diverse sports opportunities for all students across a broad range of skill levels and experiences.

name: Student Academic Resource Center
description:
Mission Statement

The Student Academic Resource Center mission is to strengthen comprehensive learning, enhance retention and promote student success by providing academic support services to UCF students. This is accomplished through campus outreach, tutoring, supplemental instruction, learning assistance, and first-year transition programs.

Vision Statement

The Student Academic Resource Center is committed to maintaining its status as a nationally recognized learning center with model academic support programs that promote undergraduate students’ academic preparation, transition, and progress toward graduation. Through collaboration and partnerships with internal and external constituencies, the center will remain cutting-edge in facilitating service to students by providing opportunities for a smooth, seamless, and successful transition to UCF and progress toward graduation.

Goals

  • To develop and implement quality academic support services for UCF students.
  • Establish partnerships and provide outreach programming that will contribute to the academic success and persistence of UCF students.
  • Enhance learning in and outside of the classroom.
  • Enhance learning for UCF students with comprehensive and innovative learning initiatives.
  • Provide excellent customer service to UCF students who use SARC services and programs.

The Student Academic Resource Center (SARC) at the University of Central Florida, affectionately known for its iconic Red Door, has a rich history dating back to its founding by Dr. Mary Helen Callarman in 1988. Originally housed in a gray portable classroom, Dr. Callarman boldly painted its front door red over a weekend, a move that not only distinguished SARC but also symbolized its commitment to student support amidst a sea of uniformity.

From its inception, SARC has championed a student-centric approach, pioneering innovative academic support programs. Initially offering peer tutoring and the College Achievement Program, SARC has since expanded its services to include Supplemental Instruction (SI), group and one-on-one peer tutoring, academic consultations, academic success workshops, and online learning support. Over the past several decades, SARC has positively impacted students’ academic journeys over one million times.

In 2001, SARC relocated to Howard Phillips Hall, enhancing its accessibility and outreach. In 2018, it moved again to Trevor Colbourn Hall, UCF’s newest building, further increasing its presence and capacity to serve the growing student body. Throughout each move, the original Red Door remains a cherished symbol, adorned with a plaque honoring Dr. Callarman’s pioneering spirit and the enduring mission of SARC.

Discover more about SARC’s legacy of academic excellence and student empowerment through its vibrant history and ongoing commitment to student success.

Accessibility Statement

The Student Academic Resource Center is committed to ensuring all web resources are usable by everyone. If you encounter any issues accessing content on this website, please contact us. We will work to make the resource or feature usable or provide the information in an alternative format.
summary: We are the learning center on campus where students can access high-quality academic support programs and services which include: peer tutoring, academic consultations, supplemental instruction and academic success workshops.

name: Student Accounting Society
description:
The Student Accounting Society is a professional organization, established in 1974, which unites students preparing for a career in the accounting field. Joining SAS is the ideal way to make connections with professionals who can be key to your career growth and development while also building a network of peers who will support you in your academic and professional successes.

Please see our website for additional information on joining @ sasucf.org ! We recruit every Fall and Spring! Recruitment begins at the beginning of every semester, so be sure to visit our website for any updates!

Email any questions to ucfsas@gmail.com
summary: Student Accounting Society is an organization designed to help its members in developing professional skills, utilizing them in weekly interactions with professionals who educate the members about their area of study and networking.

name: Student Care Services
description: Student Care Services (SCS) offers guidance, resources, and referrals to UCF students who are experiencing a distressing situation which significantly impacts academic or personal success. The SCS team coordinates referrals to campus and community resources, develops action plans for student success, oversees the Student of Concern process, and provides education and outreach to university and community members. Our goal is to intervene before a student reaches crisis level and ensure the safety of both the student and the UCF community. SCS also oversees UCF Cares, an umbrella of care-related programs, resources and staff dedicated to fostering a caring community of Knights.
summary: Student Care Services (SCS) offers guidance, resources, and referrals to UCF students who are experiencing a distressing situation which significantly impacts academic or personal success.

name: Student Government Election Commission
description:
The Election Commission serves to promote and facilitate Student Government elections. The Election Commission is comprised of the Supervisor of Elections, the Assistant Supervisor of Elections, and 12 other Election Commissioners. Together, they successfully market, facilitate, and execute the Elections! They also ensure that all candidates and campaigners abide by the Election Statutes and enjoy a fair and transparent election experience.  

 

Potential candidates can find the Candidate Application Packets in the "Forms" section of the Election Commission Knight Connect page. Presidential petition sheets can be found in the "Documents" section of the Election Commission Knight Connect page. Please convert the Petition sheets to a .csv file upon submission. 

 

2025 Fall Events:

Prospective Presidential and Senate Candidates Q&A

Date and Time: Wednesday, November 12th, 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM

Location: Live Oak Event Center – Magnolia Room

 

2026 Election Period Timeline:

 

2026 Info Sessions!

Time: 10:15 AM - 11:00 AM

Location: Sand Key, SU Room 220

 

Dates: January 27th, January 29th, February 3rd, February 5th, February 6th, February 9th, February 10th, and February 11th

 

Virtual (Zoom) Dates: February 13th (12:00 PM - 12:45 PM) and February 17th (9:00 AM - 9:45 AM)

 

Important Dates:

Election Period Begins & Presidential Petition Forms Open: Monday, January 12th, 9:00 AM

 

Declaration of Candidacy Period: Monday-Friday, February 9th-13th, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM

 

Active Campaigning Allowed Beginning: Monday, February 9th, 9:00 AM - Candidates may campaign only after receiving verification from the Election Commission.

 

Write-In Application Process: File the write-in declaration by Wednesday, March 15, 5:00 PM; Eligibility verified by Thursday, March 12th, 5:00 PM

 

Election Events

Presidential Ticket Debate: Monday, February 23rd, 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM (Doors open at 6:00 PM)

Location: Student Union Pegasus Ballroom D-I 

 

Candidate Expo: Wednesday, March 4th, 2026, 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM

Location: Student Union Key West Ballroom 

 

Election Voting:

Time: Monday-Wednesday, March 9th-11th, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

If there is no runoff, the Election period ends Wednesday, March 25, 2026.

 

Runoff Election (if necessary): Monday-Wednesday, March 23rd-26th, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

If there is a run-off, the Election period ends Wednesday, April 8th.

 

A comprehensive calendar with all relevant dates and deadlines can be found on the SG Election Commission UCF Events calendar: 

https://events.ucf.edu/calendar/5821/student-government-election-commission/this-month/

 

 

Contact Information:

Amarah Presley, Supervisor of Elections: sga_ec@ucf.edu

 

Andrew Collazo Borges, Assistant Supervisor of Elections: sga_aec@ucf.edu

 

Chantel Carter, SG Advisor: chantel.carter@ucf.edu
summary: The Election Commission serves to promote and facilitate Student Government elections.

name: Student Government Executive Branch
description:
We Moved! Student Government is now located on the Third Floor of the Student Union in Suite 346!!!

 

UCF Student Government is a representative body modeled after the United States government. Through its three branches, Executive, Legislative, and Judicial, Student Government aims to represent student issues and concerns at all levels of University decision making. Through a $20.4 million dollar budget acquired from student fees, SG maintains hundreds of student jobs, oversees two facilities (Student Union and Rec & Wellness Center), and is constantly creating new services and initiatives aiming to make campus life better for all UCF Knights.

The Executive Branch (or Cabinet) is composed of student leaders appointed by the Student Body President each year. Our cabinet consists of a diverse group of students who share a passion for helping their university grow and making sure their peers receive the best education possible.

We sit on over thirty-five different University Councils where we represent the average student and ensure that the student voice is heard loud and clear. The Executive Branch is also responsible for the development and maintenance of many significant student programs and services such as the Safe Ride Program, the Recreation & Wellness Center, Universal Knights, town hall meetings, educational programs, diversity education events, and many others
summary: UCF Student Government is a representative body modeled after the United States government. Through its three branches, Executive, Legislative, and Judicial, UCF Student Government aims to represent student issues and concerns.

name: Student Government Judicial Branch
description: The Judicial Branch is composed of 14 students dedicated to improving the life of the student body at UCF by working to uphold and protect students’ rights through interpretation of the Student Body Constitution and University Policies. Justices serve on several appeals hearings including parking citation appeals, election eligibility and violation appeals, appeals for RSO fiscal sanctions, Student Conduct, and more. Justices also serve as impartial advisors for students going through the conduct and grade appeal processes.
summary:
The Judicial Branch Serves to protect student rights by advising students on how to best participate in university processes.

"The Judicial power of the Student Body shall be vested in a Judicial Council" -Student Body Constitution

name: Student Government Legislative Branch (Senate)
description:
The Student Body Senate is comprised of student leaders who represent the various Colleges and work with students and Registered Student Organizations. Our Student Body Senate provides students and organizations with the funds necessary for travel and conference registration, as well as campus-wide events and projects. Also, through various committees and caucuses, Senate has a great impact on issues that directly regard the Student Body. Student Senators also work on college-specific and/or campus-wide initiatives that better the student experience for UCF Knights! 

Senate meets every Thursday evening at 7:00 p.m. It is encouraged that you attend these meetings so you can have a better understanding of your representative body as well as where your Activity and Service Fee is going. Over the summer, the Student Body Senate meets at 6 p.m.*
summary: The Senate of Student Government of the University of Central Florida is comprised of student representatives who solely work with students and Registered Student Organizations.

description:

It is designed specifically to address the concerns and needs of students currently enrolled in the HESP Program at UCF, as well as undergraduates at UCF who are interested in Student Affairs graduate programs. Our Instagram will keep you updated with general SPA meeting times and fun events that will be held throughout the year. We look forward to serving you and making the HESP experience an amazing one!

Check out our website here!
