name: Student Union
description: The Student Union is “The Heart of Campus”; creating lasting first impressions by providing high quality facilities that are both student oriented and environmentally focused. We seek to enrich the student experience through innovative programming and civic engagement. We offer an experience based learning environment that fosters personal and professional growth. The Student Union consistently exceeds expectations by providing resourceful, courteous and attentive services in partnership with students, faculty, alumni, staff, parents and guests.
summary: The Student Union is “The Heart of Campus”; creating lasting first impressions by providing high quality facilities that are both student oriented and environmentally focused.

name: Student Veterans of America UCF Chapter
description:
***Veteran Knights***

The Student Veterans of America UCF Chapter is a student-led organization dedicated to supporting and empowering military veterans who are pursuing higher education at the University of Central Florida. Through community building, advocacy, and access to resources, the SVA UCF Chapter strives to create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all student veterans. The group provides a network of support for its members, helping them navigate their college experience, connect with local veteran organizations, and build lasting relationships with fellow student veterans.

***Our New Community Discord Page ***
summary: SVA at UCF advocates for the collective interests of all student veterans of the armed forces and those who support them. To provide military veterans with the resources, support, and advocacy needed to succeed in higher education and after graduation.

name: Students for Education in Prison
description: We are a student-led club organized to support UCF faculty and students in prison education and related areas of civic engagement. Our goals include collaborating with other organizations to raise awareness of mass incarceration, discussing the impacts of education in prison, and hosting drives and events. SFEP is for everyone, regardless of their level of knowledge on issues of mass incarceration, and we aim to be a welcoming and supportive space for formerly incarcerated students.  Join us at an upcoming meeting! Come open to meeting people and learning new things!
summary: The mission of Students for Education in Prison is to raise awareness about the impacts of mass incarceration and the importance of prison education and to provide a community for all UCF students, including those who have been formerly incarcerated

name: Students for Salt
description:
The Mission for Students for Salt is to build up and empower collegiate student leaders to impact the campus and community for Christ through outreach and service. We aim to connect current students with community members who share their faith and desire for service within a local faith-centered community. We are affiliated with Salt Company National. A national organization that started in 1987 to reach major universities in North America. 
 
Our goal is to reach the campus through students and equip them to love, serve and lead on the campus now and later lead in the community themselves.  
 
We have weekly gatherings, campus groups, mentorship, and service opportunities for UCF students to connect in and grow their faith.
summary: The mission for Students for Salt is to build up and empower student leaders to impact the campus and community for Christ through outreach and service. Our goal is to provide students with the necessary tools to love, serve and lead their communities.

name: Students for the Exploration and Development of Space
description:
The Students for the Exploration and Development of Space (SEDS) is non-profit student-run organization that empowers young people to participate and make an impact in space exploration.


SEDS helps students develop their technical and leadership skills by providing opportunities to manage and participate in national projects, attend conferences, publish their work, and develop their professional network, in order to help students become more effective in their present and future careers in industry, academia, government, and education.


Our belief is that focusing on the enthusiasm of young people is the key to our future in space and to important breakthroughs in science and technology.

Email us (contact@sedsucf.org), visit our website, or join the discord server for more information on how to become a member!
summary: SEDS is an independent, student-based organization which promotes the exploration and development of space through technical projects, industry tours,outreach, networking opportunities, and professional development. Love space? This is your place!

name: Students for Training, Research, and Education in Energy and Turbines
description: STREET(Students for Training, Research, and Education in Energy and Turbines) is a student club. The main objective of the STREET is to train, research, and educate students. Also, it is the largest group for energy and turbine at UCF! We work on several different projects including power generation, aviation, and propulsion. We travel to national and international conferences together to present our works. We do have several fun events !!
summary: To facilitate UCF student participation in the field of energy engineering through involvement in research and industry

name: Students Supporting Israel at the University of Central Florida
summary: The mission of Students Supporting Israel at UCF is to be a clear and confident pro-Israel voice on our campus and to support students in grassroots pro-Israel advocacy.

name: Students Who Care
description:
The mission of Students Who Care is to connect undergraduate healthcare students nationwide with hospitalized children, isolated seniors, and their families, to provide fun, friendship and support. Our RSO provides monthly Ronald McDonald House volunteer opportunities, limited weekly volunteering at childrens hospitals, weekly volunteering at Somerby's senior facility, and fun socials. There is no shortage of volunteer hours we can provide you!

Fill out the application linked below to join:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdYpQCTyrAwCR3Tmkvk3PrYFhI6AWIdv1_yqjjolbg4dhA0FA/viewform
summary: The mission of Students Who Care is to connect undergraduate healthcare students nationwide with hospitalized children, isolated seniors, and their families, to provide fun, friendship and support. To join, please fill out the application linked below.

name: Surf Club and Team @ UCF
description:
The Surf Club & Team at UCF is a student run organization that provides a place for surfers and non-surfers alike to meet and enjoy the beach together. The Surf Club is one of the largest non-greek organizations on campus with around 100 members each year. We host lots of events, such as beach cleanups, alumni contests, tailgates, beach days, and movie nights. Our club is a great way to make friends and catch rides to the beach!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T7YHtTO7EeI
summary: The Surf Club & Team at UCF is a student run organization that provides a place for people with common interests to hang out, meet new people, and go surfing. The Surf Club is one of the largest non-greek organizations on campus with about 100 members.

name: Survivor UCF
description:
Survivor UCF is a group of students and fans of the CBS Reality TV Series Survivor, dedicated to running our own version of the game on UCF Campus, as well as hosting watch parties.

 

With a goal of hosting at least two per semester, the primary function of Survivor UCF is to host our own seasons of the game where UCF students can outwit, outplay, and outlast the competition until only one remains.

 

Just like on the show, we have our own custom-designed and manufactured Buffs that players in the season will get to take home as memorabilia.  Each season has its own unique buff design, with varying colors to distinguish the opposing tribes. 

 

Survivor UCF also will host weekly watch parties of CBS Survivor while it is airing.  The watch parties will be a space for fans of the show to watch the live airing of episodes, meet other fans, and discuss the events of the game.  

Here are all of our links!
summary: Survivor UCF is a group of students and fans of the CBS Reality TV Series Survivor, dedicated to running our own version of the game on UCF Campus, as well as hosting watch parties.

name: Sustainability Initiatives
description: UCF's Office of Sustainability Initiatives understands that the complex global challenges of today impact us all. We recognize that these challenges cannot be solved alone. We are heavily invested in building relationships within our community, partnering with local organizations, neighboring colleges, and key stakeholders to achieve our goals. With an eye to the future, our vision is to create a campus environment that informs and empowers the leaders of tomorrow.
summary: At Sustainability Initiatives, we seek to create an environment where ideas are freely shared, partnerships are formed and solutions are uncovered in the pursuit of environmental, economic and social sustainability.

name: Taekwondo Club @ UCF
description:
Welcome to the Taekwondo Club @ UCF! We practice both traditional and Olympic styles of Taekwondo and are always accepting new students from beginners to black belts. Our club represents UCF at local, state, and national competitions in board breaking, poomsae, and sparring. Whether you’re looking for a great workout or aiming for team USA, become a member of our Taekwondo family! If you have any questions, feel free to visit our website, contact us or come watch a practice!

name: Tau Beta Pi - The Engineering Honor Society
description:
About Tau Beta Pi

Tau Beta Pi is the only engineering honor society representing the entire engineering profession. It is the nation's second-oldest honor society, founded at Lehigh University in 1885 to mark in a fitting manner those who have conferred honor upon their Alma Mater by distinguished scholarship and exemplary character as students in engineering, or by their attainments as alumni in the field of engineering, and to foster a spirit of liberal culture in engineering colleges.

There are now collegiate chapters at 246 US colleges and universities, 40 active alumni chapters in 16 districts across the country, and a total initiated membership of approximately 580,000.

 

Future TBP Members

  • Interested in joining or qualifications for membership? Membership in Tau Beta Pi is by invitation from our collegiate chapters to students in the top 1/8 of the junior class or top 1/5 of the senior class. Graduate students and eminent engineers may also be initiated. Find out more here »
summary: Tau Beta Pi is the only engineering honor society representing the entire engineering profession. Membership is by invitation only of eligible students.

name: Tau Beta Sigma National Honorary Band Sorority
description: Tau Beta Sigma is a highly respected pre-eminent music organization comprised of over 160 collegiate chapters and more than 3,800 collegiate members with a balanced representation of women and men. Strong leadership thrives throughout our organization and we have a solid financial foundation. We cultivate and sponsor a variety of music education programs for our diverse membership and work closely with collegiate band directors. Our alumni association is an integral part of Tau Beta Sigma, promoting diversity efforts, social networking and assisting members in enhancing their professional leadership and employment possibilities after graduation from college. We are actively engaged in the community through music.
summary: We provide exceptional service to collegiate bands and promote equality and diversity, including empowering women in the band profession. We cultivate leadership, educational achievement, music appreciation and community development.

name: The Adaptive Community
description:
The Adaptive Community/Aphasia Family meets at 12:30-3:30 pm every Friday during the academic terms at UCF (spring, summer, fall). 

- Meetings occur from 12:30-2:30 for Aphasia Family members, 

- Volunteers collaborate on Aphasia Family projects from 2:30-3:30. 

 

Contact:

Interested in volunteering? Email us for access to our application!

For general inquiries, contact aphasiafamily@ucf.edu. 

 

Description of Aphasia Family: 

Aphasia Family is a free community group that provides language-rich activities, socialization, and community outings for stroke survivors with aphasia and related communication disorders. Aphasia Family is offered as one of the UCF Aphasia House programs, and the group was founded by people with aphasia, for people with aphasia.

The weekly Aphasia Family meetings, led by undergraduate and graduate students, foster intergenerational dialogue between members with communication disorders and UCF students. 

.

If you have questions regarding the Aphasia House that do not pertain to volunteering, please contact Aphasia House Interim Director, Dr. Lauren Bislick Wilson at lauren.bislick@ucf.edu. 

.

Remember to dress appropriately when volunteering with the Adaptive Community. At The Aphasia House, we are expected to come dressed professionally. No shorts, jeans, hats, T-shirts, tennis shoes, or conspicuous logos. Thank you!

 

 

Page updated: 08/21/2025
summary: The Adaptive Community provides a service-learning opportunity for UCF undergraduate and graduate students to facilitate a social, inclusive environment for members with aphasia and related communication disorders.

name: The Affiliate Chapter of the National Black Association of Speech Language and Hearing at the University of Central Florida
description:
The University of Central Florida chapter of NBASLH strive to connect members with the opportunity to build a community within one another, learn from each other, and expand on what we learn in the classroom. In this upcoming year we plan to expand the opportunities of members through informational general body meetings, guest speakers, campus involvement, community service, socials, etc. UCF's NBASLH wants to create an inclusive environment and use every opportunity to grow within our careers and ourselves.

UCF NBASLH Membership Application

name: The Bahamian Student Association
description: The Bahamian Student Association (BAHSA) at the University of Central Florida is a cultural and community-based organization dedicated to celebrating and promoting Bahamian heritage on campus. Our mission is to create a supportive environment for Bahamian and non-Bahamian students alike by fostering unity, cultural pride, and academic success.

name: The Balkan Student Association
description:
The mission of The Balkan Student Association is to educate and bring awareness to the diverse culture and history of the Balkans. In addition to this, its purpose is to bring community for those of Balkan heritage, allowing them to learn their own culture, language, and traditions, and have a sense of community on campus.

 

The goals of the club are to: 

  • Promote Balkan culture at UCF
  • Provide a sense of community for Balkan students on campus

  • Educate and advocate on contemporary Balkan culture,                                contributions, and global relevance
summary: The mission of The Balkan Student Association is to educate and bring awareness to the diverse culture and history of the Balkans. In addition to this, its purpose is to bring community for those of Balkan heritage, allowing them to learn.

description:
The mission of the Biomedical Engineering Society at UCF is to build and support the biomedical engineering community locally, nationally and internationally, with activities designed to communicate recent advances, discoveries, and inventions; promote education and professional development; and integrate the perspectives of the academic, engineering and medical fields. 


Join our Discord for updates! -> https://discord.gg/Bpkz8RyKg3 <-
summary: BMES@UCF serves to educate, serve, and grow the Biomedical Engineering Society at UCF and provide resources for members who are interested in learning about the field, hearing presentations from professionals, or just networking with other students!

name: The Black Female Development Circle, Inc.
description:
The Black Female Development Circle, Inc. at the University of Central Florida is a circle of women devoted to empowering each other throughout their college experience. Our three principles are Self Actualization and Improvement, Belief in a Higher Power, and Self Respect. Throughout the year, we host several events and socials that exemplify each of those principles. We provide leadership opportunities for our members in a fun, supportive environment.  


The Black Female Development Circle is an organization of African American women that came together at the University of Florida in 1994. The group was founded to serve as a support system for black women. Meetings were to be a place where women with similar experiences could come together to discuss current events and find comfort from women who could relate to them. Since that time, collegiate chapters have been established at The University of Central Florida, University of South Florida, UConn, Flagler College, and the University of Miami.

 

Join our interest chat: BFDC 25-26 Group Me
summary: To Educate, Explore, Enhance, and Celebrate womanhood on campus and in the community by building upon the intellectual capacity of women through Self-Awareness, Self-Respect, and Self-Actualization. ✨

name: The Cypress Dome Society
description:
The Cypress Dome Society is the University of Central Florida’s literary organization staffed by undergraduate students. Named after a feature of the landscape on the UCF campus, we are dedicated to fostering the literary arts and promoting a sense of community among writers and artists through events and our annual publication, The Cypress Dome, UCF's undergraduate literary journal. 

Founded in 1989, The Cypress Dome is edited, designed, and produced by a selected editorial team of The Cypress Dome Society students as part of a year-long internship. Poetry, fiction, creative nonfiction, flash fiction/nonfiction, graphic narratives, and visual art may be submitted in the fall term, according to submission guidelines distributed each fall, to be considered for publication in the annual issue published each spring.

Our events, such as our monthly Open Mic sessions, and our publication seek to cultivate creativity and diversity and are open to both graduate and undergraduate students. 

For more information on how to get involved in The Cypress Dome Society, contact us or join our Discord (https://discord.gg/MSAhPUgAyx) If you are interested in submitting your work for publication in The Cypress Dome, please visit our website: https://cah.ucf.edu/cypressdome/.
summary: The Cypress Dome is a student-produced literary journal that publishes creative writing and visual art by University of Central Florida students.

We offer lessons from our coach with 40+ years of experience and compete in tournaments in and around the state of Florida. For those new to the sport, we provide all the necessary equipment and can teach you everything you need to know to start fencing like a pro!

 

All practices are held in Recreation and Wellness Center (KnightFit room [245] on the second floor). Our meeting times for the semester are Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 7-10pm.

description: The German Club at the University of Central Florida is a cultural organization whose goal is to help students understand and appreciate the German culture and language. The club is open to all students who are interested in learning about a new language and culture - no prior knowledge required. We offer biweekly General Body Meetings that focus on cultural and historical topics, as well as "Kaffeestunde" (coffee hour) get-togethers to practice German conversation in a friendly and casual setting. We also hold several special events throughout the semester such as volunteer opportunities and social gatherings outside of campus.

We will create a database of recruiting labs as well as physicians allowing shadowing, which will vastly help students in their quest for graduate programs. We also have ample volunteering opportunities as well as seminars to help students get excited about any of the extra credit activate.

name: The Improv Academy
description:
*If you are interested in joining The Improv Academy, please follow our Instagram for updates (@ucfimprov) or send us an email (ucftheimprovacademy@gmail.com)!

The Improv Academy (TIA) teaches and performs long-form improvised comedy at the University of Central Florida. Our community is proudly to forges new friendships, fosters creativity, and shares a lot of laughs. The program is designed to support all levels of experience.

 

The Improv Academy functions foremost as an educational organization. Our program is divided into four levels and can be completed in two years. Each level takes a semester to complete. After finishing the program, players join our Grad Room.

name: The National Council of Negro Women
description:
2025-2026 Initiative: N-VINCIBLE

          Founded by Dr. Mary McLeod Bethune in 1935, the National Council of Negro Women, Incorporated (NCNW) played an important role in the struggle for human and civil rights all contributing to the peaceful solutions to the problems of human welfare and rights.

          The National Council of Negro Women, Incorporated (NCNW) is a non-profit organization with the mission to advance the opportunities and quality of life for women, families, and communities. NCNW fulfills this mission through research, advocacy, national and community-based services, and programs.

          NCNW was founded at the University of Central Florida by Charlyn Stanberry in the summer of 2005. Here at UCF, our mission is to Lead, Develop and Advocate not only on campus but in the greater community through community service and events to raise awareness.

Follow us on all social media @NCNWUCF for upcoming events!
summary: The National Council of Negro Women is a nationally recognized nonprofit organization with a mission to Lead, Develop and Advocate for women of color. The National Council of Negro Women at UCF has been making a lasting contribution since 2005.

name: The Rosen Entrepreneurship & Innovation Club
description:
Our Goals
We aim to help you:

• Cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset
• Build career networks with Rosen College students and industry professionals
• Access resources to create your own entrepreneurial ventures
• Develop skills essential for success in hospitality and tourism entrepreneurship

What We Offer
REIgKNIGHTS hosts a variety of exciting opportunities, including:

• Networking Events with industry leaders, entrepreneurs, and peers
• Workshops and Seminars on business planning, marketing strategies, and financial management tailored to hospitality
• Entrepreneurship Competitions where you can pitch innovative ideas, receive feedback from experts, and compete for awards and prizes
• Collaboration Projects that let you tackle real-world challenges with local businesses and organizations
• Membership Benefits including exclusive resources, mentorship opportunities, and industry insights

Whether you’re passionate about hospitality, marketing, leadership, or simply exploring your entrepreneurial side, REIgKNIGHTS welcomes students from all majors to join a vibrant community of innovators.
summary: The mission of The Rosen Entrepreneurship & Innovation Club (REIgKNIGHTS) is to foster innovation and entrepreneurship in hospitality and tourism, empowering students to thrive in a dynamic business environment.

description: The Women’s Network (TWN) was created for ambitious women looking to grow professionally while being lifted by their community. TWN offers opportunities to gain exposure to the professional world, network with high-profile speakers and meet peers around their campus and the country. TWN meets biweekly (twice a month) and holds speaker meetings, various networking events, resume, internship and LinkedIn workshops, alumni networking receptions and interactive activity sessions to develop relationships with fellow members. Our workshops and guest speakers help prepare you for your next steps and may open your eyes to paths you haven't even considered.
summary: The Women’s Network is a national networking organization dedicated to redefining ambition. TWN is a diverse and inclusive community that emphasizes the importance of building your network, celebrating ambition, and connecting college students.

name: Theta Chi Fraternity
description:
Theta Chi is one of the oldest men’s college fraternities in North America. Founded in 1856, more than 175,000 members have enjoyed the Fraternity’s traditions, ideals and fellowship.

Founded on the principle of friendship through the mutual assistance of every member, Theta Chi aims to provide its members with an enjoyable and fulfilling collegiate experience that also prepares them for rewarding, successful lives after graduation.
summary: Founded on the principle of friendship through the mutual assistance of every member, Theta Chi aims to provide its members with an enjoyable and fulfilling collegiate experience that also prepares them for rewarding, successful lives after graduation.

name: Theta Sigma Chapter of the International Fraternity of Delta Sigma Pi
description: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce, and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.
summary: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice.

name: Theta Tau Professional Engineering Fraternity
description:
Are you a student in the college of engineering and computer science looking to make friends with other students who share similar interests? Do you want more of the college experience, while at the same time preparing yourself for the career of your dreams?

Since 1904, Theta Tau has been providing a brotherhood for engineers. Theta Tau is the nation’s oldest and foremost fraternity for engineers. The purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

If you’re looking to get more out of your education while having fun at the same time, then Theta Tau may be the fraternity for you. Come out to our Fall or Spring semester Rush events to hang out and get to know the brothers of Theta Tau Rho Gamma Chapter.
summary: The purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.
categoryNames: ['Engineering and Computer Science', 'Honor Societies ', 'Greek: Academic/Career/ Honor']

name: ToKnight Show
description: The mission of ToKnight Show is to teach students how to write and produce comedy sketches for the purpose of putting together a monthly variety show.
summary: The mission of ToKnight Show is to teach students how to write and produce comedy sketches for the purpose of putting together a monthly variety show.

name: Tower II Apartments
description: Area Council is a student led group in your own residence that will be active in leadership, programming, and advocacy for the community. The mission is to provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth.
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.

name: Tower III Apartments
summary: The mission is to provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth

name: Tower IV Apartments
summary: The mission is to provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth

name: Towers I Apartments
description: To provide a residence life program that encourages a positive living and learning environment, supportive of students development in the college community by providing quality opportunities and connections for academic and personal growth.
summary: The mission of the Department of Housing and Residence Life is to provide students living in university housing with a safe and secure environment that is conducive to academic and personal achievement.

name: Toys Kicking Cancer
description: Toys Kicking Cancer is a student-led philanthropic initiative created to bring joy to pediatric cancer patients during the holiday season. The organization collects new, unwrapped toys to donate to children undergoing cancer treatment, offering them moments of happiness and hope during a difficult time in their lives. Toys Kicking Cancer aims to kick cancer by delivering comfort and holiday spirit to young patients, ensuring they feel remembered, celebrated, and supported by their community. Anyone can contribute by donating toys or volunteering at events to help spread cheer and make a meaningful impact.
summary: The mission of Toys Kicking Cancer is to “To bring joy and happiness to kids that are going through difficult times by donating toys during the holiday season.”

name: Trading Card Game Knights
description:
We play and teach many trading card games including:

Magic the Gathering, Pokemon, Cardfight!! Vanguard, Yugioh, Flesh and Blood, Digimon, Lorcana, and Shadowverse: Evolve.

===

We run biweekly events for all of our club-supported events including tournaments, drafts, trading days, and teaching events.

===

Don't have the money for cards? We're 100% proxy friendly. You can print them, no problem.

Prefer to play with official cards? Many of our members have multiple decks and are down to lend you theirs for a game or two.

===

Join our Discord to learn more about us, and hopefully we'll be gaming with you soon:

https://discord.gg/gR32KCH8c2
summary: We're TCG Knights, where everyone is welcome! We like to play cards. We play and teach Magic the Gathering, Vanguard, Yugioh, Flesh and Blood, Digimon, Pokemon, Lorcana, and more

name: Transfer Center
description:
The Transfer Center is the hub for all transfer students on-campus to get assistance, meet with their Success Coaches, access opportunities and educational experiences, and interact with fellow transfer students.

Our events are open to all students.

Find us on the main campus at the Trevor Colbourn Hall, Suite 215.
summary: The Transfer Center is the hub for all transfer students on-campus to get assistance, meet with their Success Coaches, access opportunities and educational experiences, and interact with fellow transfer students.

name: Transfer Knights
description:
Welcome to Transfer Knights!

Transfer Knights is the one-stop shop for integrating into campus either as a first-time transfer student or any semester afterward. We host general body meetings that consist of fun activities that allow you to get to know other students on campus in addition to providing workshops and resources that are provided both on and off campus. 

Aside from academic events, we also host socials and ways to get to know people through meetups, tailgating during football games, spirit splash, and so much more. Transfer students make up a majority of the population of our UCF community and we want you to have fun and get involved! We encourage you attend as many events as possible and give out prizes such as Member of the Month and a monetary scholarship based on attendance. 

If you have questions or just want to chat, message one of our executive board leaders.

 

Our Social Media & More:

LinkTree: https://linktr.ee/transferknights

Instagram: @ transferknights

Discord: https://discord.gg/2P3wcdDY3Y

Website: https://transferknights.weebly.com/

 

Our Spring 2025 Executive Board:

President - Reya Colón

Vice President - Ivan Iliev

Recruitment Director - Javier Narvaez-Martinez

Events Coordinator - Jazmin Wiggins  

Graduate Student Advisor - Nishit Tailor
summary: Transfer Knights is a RSO dedicated to help transfer students get involved and connected at UCF!

name: Trial Team
description:
At the start of each academic year, members of Trial Team get access to a complete criminal or civil case. This case comes with witness statements, affidavits, and evidence. We work in teams to develop ideas about how to best present this case to a jury (essentially, we do everything trial attorneys would do upon receiving a case). Some students play the role of attorneys and others play the role of witnesses. Throughout Fall and Spring semester, we travel across the country to compete in Mock Trial competitions against some of the best schools in the nation. 

When you join Trial Team, you are coached by some of the most prominent attorneys in Orlando. These attorneys work to help you understand trial work, different areas of law, objections, presentation skills, etc. 

You should consider joining Trial Team if ANY the following interest you:

-Public Speaking

-Competitive Settings

-Leadership Opportunities

-Team Environments 

-Law School

-Acting

-Travel

-Mentorship
summary: The Trial Team provides an opportunity for some of UCF's brightest students to acquire and sharpen their critical thinking and analytical skills, as well as gain trial experience that will prove valuable during law school, and eventually in practice.

name: TriKnights at UCF
summary: The mission of TriKnights at UCF is to promote general physical fitness and represent the sport of triathlon within the community.

name: Trombone Club
description: Further the relevance of the trombone in the UCF community by bringing in various guest artists for concerts and clinics.
summary: Further the relevance of the trombone in the UCF community by bringing in various guest artists for concerts and clinics.

name: Turkish Students Association
description: The mission of the Turkish Student Association is to provide UCF students of Turkish descent to represent their Turkish identity within the UCF community and socialize. Our goal is to have Turkish Students of UCF feel at home and connect with their Turkish peers. This includes undergraduate students, graduate students, and faculty staff.
summary: The mission of TSA is to encourage and strengthen the cultural relations and educational ties between Turkish-Americans and the American people and to share a general knowledge of the language, history, culture, and social life of Turkey.

name: Turning Point USA
description: Through non-partisan debate, dialogue, and discussion, Turning Point USA believes that every young person can be enlightened to true free market values.
summary: Turning Point USA’s mission is to educate students about the importance of fiscal responsibility, free markets, and capitalism through innovative campus activism and non-partisan, thought-provoking discussion.

name: Type 1
description: Registered Student Organization for students with Type 1 Diabetes at UCF. This club was created with the intention to provide a relaxed and fun outlet to meet others with diabetes, interact with health care professionals , see and try new equipment, embrace new means to manage your health, and make new friends! The club is open to any students or faculty. You do not need to be Diabetic to join or get involved!
summary: A RSO for students with Type 1 Diabetes at UCF!

name: UCF Arboretum
description:
To volunteer with us, please click Join!  

Individual Volunteering 

Students, faculty, and staff can sign up to volunteer in our Greenhouse, Pollinator Gardens, Public Garden landscapes, and Community Farm and Gardens. Each shift has a cap of 6-10 people, depending on project needs. 

To RSVP, please scroll down to the Events section. Choose the volunteer shift you'd like to RSVP to. Once on the details page for the event, click RSVP. If it shows "No Spots Available", our shift is full, but feel free to join the waitlist. We post shifts at the end of each month!  

Hours need to be submitted through the "Submit Hours" section on KnightConnect as we do not automatically count hours. Any forms that need to be signed must be accompanied by hours submitted through this section.  

For Adopt-A-Program volunteer inquiries, please contact adopt.a.program@ucf.edu.

Group Volunteering is suspended until further notice.  

Please contact us through our email (arboretum@ucf.edu) or our Instagram @ucfarboretum 

Arboretum Documentary: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6X7WyiVMpwE
summary: The Arboretum, in partnership with Landscape and Natural Resources, enriches the UCF community by creating and maintaining an inviting and sustainable outdoor environment, and by generating research, education, outreach & volunteering opportunities.

name: UCF Experiential Learning
summary: Experiential Learning (EL) helps connect students with resources and opportunities with employers to gain experience through internships, co-ops, and service-learning.

name: UCF Global
description: UCF Global at the University of Central Florida functions as the primary international hub for students, faculty, and staff. Through strong partnerships UCF Global is committed to increasing international mobility and enhancing the university’s global competency. Encompassing the Intensive English Program and multiple support services for the international population on campus, UCF Global aides in transforming the lives of the UCF and global community.
summary: UCF Global at the University of Central Florida functions as the primary international hub for students, faculty, and staff.

name: UCF Homecoming
description:
Homecoming is a week full of exciting events for UCF students, alumni, faculty, and staff alike! As the one of the most beloved traditions on campus, Homecoming strives to create events celebrating school spirit, togetherness and inclusion. Our mission is to make UCF Homecoming the best week of the year by bringing people together. Charge on!

 

2025 Executive Board

Executive Director - Gabby Murison|ucfhc@ucf.edu

Associate Director - Delaney Warner|hcad@ucf.edu

Talent Director - Grace Paolo|hctalent@ucf.edu

Movie Director - Hunter Davis|hcmovie@ucf.edu

Comedy Director - Derek Freitas|hccomedy@ucf.edu

Concert Director - Ben Lance|hcmusic@ucf.edu

Splash Director - Cooper Foxman|hcsplash@ucf.edu

Royalty Director - Ari Peters|hccourt@ucf.edu

Engagement Director - Christian Jones|hc-engagement@ucf.edu

Volunteer Director - Ashleigh Miller|hcvolunteer@ucf.edu

Marketing Director - Mya Hauser|hcmarketing@ucf.edu

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us!
summary: Homecoming is a time for students to come together and share their love of UCF through a week's worth of events! Go Knights, Charge ON!

name: UCF Recreation and Wellness Center
description: The mission of the UCF Recreation and Wellness Center is to foster healthy lifestyle choices and wellness through efficient services, comprehensive programs and high-quality facilities.  The Recreation and Wellness Center is designed to enrich campus life and advance the university’s educational mission.
summary: The mission of the UCF Recreation and Wellness Center is to foster healthy lifestyle choices and wellness through efficient services, comprehensive programs and high-quality facilities.

name: UCF Student Health Services
description:
UCF Student Health Services provides high-quality healthcare that delivers value, promotes lifelong well-being, and supports academic success within the UCF community. We aspire to be the model college health program of the future that will transform the health and well-being of the community we serve.

Since its establishment in 1968, UCF Student Health Services has grown tremendously and today averages 6,000 patient visits per month. We provide low-cost health services to the UCF community and are funded, in part, by the student Health Fee, which is included in students’ tuition. We are committed to providing the UCF community with quality healthcare, and as such maintain accreditation by the Accreditation Association for Ambulatory Health Care (AAAHC).

In addition to providing primary and specialty healthcare services to our Knights, UCF SHS is one of several departments that comprise UCF Well-Being, a partnership that focuses on health and wellness-oriented programming. Both together and individually, we plan, coordinate, and host well-being events designed to educate our Knights on important health topics within a fun, supportive environment.

https://linktr.ee/ucf.shs
summary: UCF Student Health Services is an AAAHC accredited, outpatient facility providing primary care and specialty services to the UCF Community. We can provide most of your health care needs.

name: Uknighted Chemistry Graduate Student Association
description: The mission ofthe Uknighted Chemistry Graduate Student Association is to cultivate a community among graduate students in the Department of Chemistry that promotes collaboration between students and faculty and to bring awareness to the general public about chemistry and STEM.
summary: The mission of the Uknighted Chemistry Graduate Student Association is to cultivate a community among graduate students in the Department of Chemistry that promotes collaboration between students and faculty and to bring awareness to the general public

name: Undergraduate Physical Therapy Association
description:
The Undergraduate Physical Therapy Association aims to provide a supportive network for students interested in physical therapy careers while providing them with information and opportunities necessary for admission into Doctor of Physical Therapy programs. Through the association, students will have the opportunity to meet practicing physical therapists, connect with volunteer experiences, participate in physical therapy events, learn about physical therapy graduate school requirements, and meet other students and faculty involved in physical therapy. 

This page is relatively inactive, so join the UPTA Facebook page OR our Instagram ucf_upta in order to receive updates on upcoming events and get access to some exclusive free resources! You can officially join the club at anytime, just stop by one of our general body meetings!

If you have any questions relating to the club, please email UPTAsecretary@gmail.com!
summary: The Undergraduate Physical Therapy Association aims to provide a supportive network for students interested in physical therapy while providing them with information and opportunities necessary for admission into Doctor of Physical Therapy programs.

name: University Kinesiology Club
description:
The University Kinesiology Club (UKC), cooperating with professional organizations, related fields, and our community, strives to be recognized as a national presence advancing the Sport and Exercise Science field, and the well being of all people through participation, leadership, advocacy, and professional conduct in our professions. UKC brings together students interested in personal training, athletic training, physical therapy, occupational therapy, sports medicine, chiropractic and more!

--

To become a member, you must pay your club dues (cash or our Venmo link, which we can provide upon request), of either $20 for the semester or $35 for the year. After which you will be approved to join the official roster here on Knight Connect. Members will receive a club t-shirt, access to member only events and volunteer opportunities, and more! If you have any questions, our contact information can be found below. Please click on the website button to visit our Linktree and Instagram!
summary: "We strive to build strong networking bonds within our major and related fields while promoting lifelong fitness & wellness through the integration of higher education, community involvement, & recreational activities.”
categoryNames: ['Community Innovation and Education', 'Health Professions and Sciences', 'Sports and Recreation']

name: Unmanned Spacecraft Engineering and Research Club
description:
Mission

The mission of Unmanned Spacecraft Engineering and Research Club is to Promote research and development in the are of unmanned spacecraft, as well as increase students exposure and knowledge of space systems.

Goals

The aim of our organization is education about small satellites through discussion, research, and hands on experience. We provide a way to get first hand experience with building satellites and exploring space.
summary: The mission of Unmanned Spacecraft Engineering and Research Club is to Promote research and development in the are of unmanned spacecraft, as well as increase students exposure and knowledge of space systems.

name: Upsilon Phi Delta Healthcare Administration Honor Society
description:
Upsilon Phi Delta is a select and distinguished national academic honor society for students studying healthcare administration. Our organization’s mission is to recognize, reward, and encourage academic excellence in the study of health administration. Please see "Documents" section for membership eligibility information and the application. 

​​Upsilon: meaning “Health”; Phi: meaning “Care”; Delta: meaning “to lead and administer”

 

Find the application with the requirements for admission in the documents below!
summary: Upsilon Phi Delta is a select and distinguished national academic honor society for students studying healthcare administration. Our organization’s mission is to recognize, reward, and encourage academic excellence in the study of health administration.

name: Urban Knights Planning Association
description: The goals of this organization are to connect students, faculty and professionals to create networking for emerging urban planners. We network with planners all over Central Florida, providing advice, expertise, and career opportunities for Urban and Regional Planning students at the UCF Downtown Campus. This will create a mentor relationship between the students and planning professionals. We are involved in conferences, lecture series, and events that are taking place in Central Florida and encourage our members to attend these activities. Lastly, we seek to provide resources and activities for students currently engaged or interested in joining the UCF Urban Planning program.
summary: The mission of the Urban Knights Planning Association is to bring together students, faculty and planning professionals to network and create ideas for planning urban environments.

name: Venezuelan Student Association
description: VENSA is dedicated to promoting the Venezuelan culture and heritage through social, professional, and charitable events. Our objective is to reach out and support Venezuelans within the UCF community, making sure everyone feels at home and helping each other thrive and succeed. Visit our Instagram for updates and reach out to join!!!
summary: VENSA is a student organization dedicated to uniting the Venezuelan community at UCF and promoting social gatherings and cultural appreciation.

name: Veterans Medical Outreach
description:
Veterans Medical Outreach aspires to close the gap between the homeless veteran community and the healthcare system. An aspect of how we work towards closing this gap is we educate the homeless veteran's on their benefits at the VA hospital. 

We build our members medical skills through various workshops, including blood pressure, heart rate, visual acuity, EKGs, and testing somatic reflexes. These skills instilled in our members throughout the semester will be utilized in a real world situation at our weekly medical screenings at State of Hope. State of Hope is a non-profit organization that houses and feeds the homeless veteran community, and we collaborate with them for multiple events, such as our free medical screenings and hosting drives for vital necessities that their veteran community lack. Additionally, our club provides all of our members with a strong background with vital characteristics for producing a strong post-graduate professional school application, including numerous volunteer opportunities, resume workshops, research workshops, suture workshops, and patient-doctor interactions workshops.
summary: The mission of VMO is to ameliorate veterans' health and well-being through holistic healthcare, empathetic services, and educational resources, inspiring them to optimize the U.S. healthcare system for ideal outcomes.
categoryNames: ['Arts and Humanities', 'Health Professions and Sciences', 'Medicine', 'Medical Service']

name: Video Game Music Ensemble @UCF
description:
Founded in 2023, the Video Game Music Ensemble @UCF is a student-led ensemble open to all current UCF students. They play music from a wide variety of video games, old and new. The ensemble aims to bring students together with their love of music from video games.

If you are interested in joining please fill out the sign-up form.

Sign-up on our Linktree

See our most recent concert here
summary: The mission of VGM@UCF is to provide performance opportunities and live performances for UCF musicians interested in the music from video games.

name: Vietnamese American Student Association
description:
The Vietnamese American Student Association (VASA) at the University of Central Florida was founded in 1982 with the purpose of fostering the values of leadership for the community, diversity and inclusiveness through Vietnamese-American culture, & lifelong friendships. Along with our traditions, we hope to accomplish this purpose through our community service events, cultural shows, fun-filled meetings, and heart-warming socials. We believe that by understanding our pasts, we can build on stronger foundations for the future, bettering our lives, our community, and our culture together.

Add us on Facebook @ 'Va Sa' for updates on our next meetings and be sure to follow our instagram '@vasaucf'
summary: The Vietnamese American Student Association (VASA) at the University of Central Florida was founded in 1982 with the purpose of fostering the values of leadership for the community, and diversity and inclusiveness through Vietnamese-American culture.
categoryNames: ['Service', 'Social/Political Awareness', 'Cultural Organization', 'APIDA (Asian Pacific Islander Desi American)']

name: Village Mentors
description: Village Mentors at UCF is determined to empower underprivileged children and communities globally through international online mentoring. It works to establish schools and virtual mentoring/tutoring services in third world countries and address global educational needs. Additionally, it strives to develop curricula especially in ESL and STEM, conduct educational assessment/research, and fundraise for essentials supplies. Its future plans include expanding its tutoring services in Columbia, beta-testing new initiatives, and expanding on existing efforts in Ahero-Kenya, Maragoli-Kenya, Ghana, Haiti, Mexico, Nigeria, Philippines, Samoa, Vietnam, etc. By transcending borders through these international online mentoring services, this organization aims to give students an opportunity to volunteer internationally and promote cultural diversity.
summary: Village Mentors is an organization that is determined to empower underprivileged children and communities globally through building impactful, scalable learning hubs sustained with virtual mentors to improve global education and quality of life.

name: Volunteer UCF
description:
Mission

Volunteer UCF is dedicated to promoting civic engagement and education on various social topics to the UCF student body through educational and service projects.

Purpose

Through a variety of events and programs such as Knights Give Back and the Alternative Break Program, students gain valuable knowledge and experience, become connected to volunteer opportunities of their interest, and expand their community outreach. Volunteer UCF provides service event consultations and recognizes student volunteers for their outstanding service. We work with over 200 community organizations and continue to expand our agency’s outreach.
summary: Volunteer UCF is dedicated to promoting civic engagement and education on various social issues to the UCF student body.

name: Volunteer UCF Alternative Break Program
description:
Volunteer UCF’s Alternative Break Program places teams of students in communities to engage in service and experiential learning. ABP Teams are exposed to complex social and cultural issues that aim to heighten social awareness, encourage life-long community collaboration, and promote the advocacy of social change within communities. Teams are led by student Coordinators who guide group development before, during, and after the experience. Faculty Advisors also facilitate the experience.

 

We coordinate domestic service trips with community partners to empower UCF students to be agents of change today and leaders of tomorrow during Winter and Spring Break and possibly some long- weekends. 

 

To stay updated please be sure to follow us on Instagram and check out our linktree, which can be found below. Looking forward to working with you!
summary: Coordinating domestic and international service trips with community partners to empower UCF students to be agents of change today and leaders of tomorrow.

name: VR Knights
description: VR Knights is a club that is concerned with making a community full of people who take an interest in Virtual Reality, primarily from the fun social aspects of it as well as it's potential as a development platform. Our main mission is to make a circle of enthusiasts who go to UCF and use that circle to give people who are new to VR the tools to make their own VR experiences
summary: Make and play VR Games!!
categoryNames: ['Arts and Humanities', 'Engineering and Computer Science', 'Creative Arts', 'LGBTQ+']

name: Wags for Walks
description:
* Please visit our instagram to get involved, we do not regularly check Knightconnect* 


Why join Wags for Walks? It helps reduce stress, anxiety and depression for students and dogs by…
● Going outside (a breath of fresh air is great for both parties involved)
● Meet new friends (this club allows you to meet new friends in all different majors who share the love for animals you do and for canines to give you equally the same amount of love you give them)
● Raise awareness for adoption ( these events allow students to feel great when contributing to the community and help dogs come out of their shell and shine in a less stressful environment)
summary: The mission of Wags for Walks is to raise awareness for adoption and the mental health of students partnered with canines at the Orange County animal shelter. Students of all majors and canines will benefit from this new outlet for stress and anxiety.

name: Wakeboarding Club @ UCF
description:
Knights Wake

*As a Sport Club at UCF we operate on IM Leagues NOT Knightconnect... Click here to go to our IMLeages Page!*

We are Knights Wake the wake boarding Club at UCF. A casual and competitive club at UCF with 6 national championships! We take riders of all experience levels and specialize in teaching those who have never rode before. We also have discounts to get the cheapest riding around, and have a weekly hangout on Fridays at Orlando Watersports Complex (OWC). We also compete in two national organizations, and travel all over the US to compete against other schools! So if you want to keep riding or never rode before and want to try we are the club for you!
summary: Knights Wake is the Wakeboarding Club at UCF. We take riders of all experience levels and specialize in teaching those who have never wakeboarded! Come hang out and wakeboard with us or contact us to learn more. Hope to see you on the water!

name: We In Animation at UCF
description:
We In Animation is the UCF chapter of the international organization, We in Animation (WIA). We are committed to celebrating and uplifting underrepresented and marginalized voices in the animation industry, while also providing professional development opportunities to our members. We welcome artists of all identities passionate about animation and more!

 

As a student organization affiliated with WIA, our goal is to bring together the global animation community to empower and advocate for people of underrepresented gender identities in the art, technology, production, and business of animation, inspiring excellence and justice in all facets of the industry.

 

The UCF collective works to achieve this by building a professional network, hosting talks and panels, and holding professional development workshops in cooperation with our parent organization.

 

Join us on KnightConnect and visit our website to learn more!
summary: We in Animation, the UCF chapter of We in Animation (WIA), is focused on supporting all artists in pursuing animation and uplifting underrepresented and marginalized voices in the entertainment industry.

name: Wellness and Health Promotion Services
description:
Wellness & Health Promotion Services (WHPS) offers a wide variety of services and programs aimed at helping all UCF students be healthy knights! We promote healthy lifestyle habits associated with higher academic performance by providing outreach and educational workshops on safe sex, nutrition, stress management, sleep, healthy relationships, and body image. To support student safety, we provide HIV Testing and Risk Reduction Counseling. We offer Biofeedback assisted relaxation training to help students manage stress. We coordinate the Healthy Knights 2020 initiative, an SDES collaborative effort focused on promoting the overall health of all UCF students.

To learn more about any of the topics mentioned check out our Health Huts seen around campus, or follow us on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram/YouTube/Pinterest @HealthyKnight
summary: Wellness & Health Promotion Services (WHPS) offers a wide variety of services and programs aimed at helping all UCF students be healthy knights!

name: Wesley at UCF
description:
Wesley at UCF is a non-profit campus ministry that hosts many weekly events that are curated to support students. We are inspired by Dr. Martin Luther King’s vision of the "Beloved Community," an inclusive community where everyone belongs. You can find us located on East plaza between the Barnes & Noble and Amazon Locker. Wesley at UCF supports the community by offering the following:

  • Student Lounge: a space for students to have a quiet, clean, and comforting place to study or get free coffee or tea on Monday-Thursday from 10a.m. to 3p.m. 
  • Community Knight: On Wednesday’s at 5:30, come by for a free, delicious dinner and a space to meet new people and hangout. We also do fun monthly events/game nights where you can win gift cards to local restaurants, even further supporting the Orlando community!
  • Spiritual and Leadership Development: follow training or discussions led by professionals or Rev. Erwin Lopez or guest speakers over the semester.
  • Counseling: You can choose between our specialists for up to 3 free online sessions of individual counseling (while funds last). Remember, you are not alone and we are here for you.

 

From semester to semester our events may change, so to best stay up to date, follow us on Instagram @wesleyatucf

Here we actively post what’s new going on within our ministry. Everyone is welcome to our events, and no registration is required.

 

Wesley at UCF is a safe space for students of all faiths, gender, race, sexuality, etc. Our mission is to establish a loving and caring community of good people where we can all grow together, whether that be spiritually, emotionally, or physically.
summary: A nonprofit campus ministry that supports college students through faith, community, and service. We offer many weekly programs containing guidance and resources to help students thrive and build the Beloved Community.

name: Who We Play For at the University of Central Florida
summary: The mission of WWPF at UCF is to raise awareness of heart health and Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA) through affordable ECG screenings, education, preventative training, and community outreach, particularly targeting youth in the Central Florida region.

name: WIKI KNIGHTS
description:
Wiki Knights is an organization that believes information can and should be available, free of charge. This organization aims to create open-source textbooks for the college community as well as to contribute to existing open source communities such as OpenStax, Wikipedia, and Pressbooks. Members and leaders have the same end goal, which is to provide information to all free of charge.

The organization consists of members devoted to different aspects of this goal, such as advocating for open educational resources (OER), promoting affordable textbooks at UCF, and ensuring students are provided with fair textbook options.

=====

Official website: https://wikiknights.com/

=====

Social media:
- Discord invite link: https://discord.gg/7z2zR3e
- Instagram (@wikiknights): https://www.instagram.com/wikiknights
- Reddit (@WikiKnights): https://www.reddit.com/user/WikiKnights
- Twitch (@wikiknights_ucf): https://www.twitch.tv/wikiknights_ucf
- Twitter (@wikiknights_ucf): https://twitter.com/wikiknights_ucf
- YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@wikiknights
summary: Wiki Knights is an organization devoted to advocating the adoption of free, open-source educational resources and contributing to the knowledge in open-source repositories such as OpenStax, Wikipedia, and Pressbooks.

name: WISE Women in Hospitality
summary: The mission of the WISE Women in Hospitality is to foster empowerment, growth, and confidence for leaders in hospitality through service, leadership development, and strengthening of knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs).

name: Women in Business UCF
description:
Women in Business UCF was created support and empower the next generation of female business leaders by developing technical skills and a strong social network. Our main goal is to help all members obtain a job offer prior to or upon graduation. We are here to mentor and guide female college students by providing access to resources that will enable them to perform at executive levels in professional and educational environments. We will have educational meetings with businesswomen that have excelled in the workplace and will provide several social networking opportunities for members to build strong relationships and gain connections to big opportunities. 

Gaining internships and job offers is incredibly important for student success upon graduation. It's no secret that men have been favored by employers in most business professions, notably finance, accounting, and investments, among others. There is a noticeable wage gap between males and females. Because of this, we see that women are still at a large disadvantage in professional environments. We aim to prepare female UCF students to help bridge the gap between businessmen and businesswomen that has existed for far too long.
summary: Women in Business UCF was created support and empower the next generation of female business leaders by developing technical skills and a strong social network, with the goal of all members having a job offer upon graduation.

name: Women in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
summary: The mission of Women in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science is to empower women in electrical engineering and computer science by creating an inclusive community that encourages members to pursue careers in STEM.

name: Women in Film
description: We host workshops, networking events, and guests speakers to educate members about women in film and the film industry. This club provides valuable opportunities for education and networking by supporting women and non-binary students as they navigate the film industry and work on student projects.
summary: This organization provides empowering networking and educational opportunities for women and non-binary people entering the film industry.

name: Women in Lasers and Optics
description:
The mission of WiLO is to promote and support women's personal and professional growth in the field of Optics, Photonics and Lasers though community building, networking opportunities, and encouraging young women to choose optics and lasers as a career. This organization will also work towards preparing all CREOL students and students in STEM enrolled in undergraduate and graduate degrees for the transition from student to professional life.

Follow us on Instagram and join our Slack for updates!
summary: The mission of WiLO is to promote and support women's personal and professional growth in the field of Optics, Photonics and Lasers though community building, networking opportunities, and encouraging young women to choose lasers and optics as a career.

name: Women Veterans Association
description:
“As women, we have to start appreciating our own worth and each other’s worth. Seek out strong women to befriend, to align yourself with, to learn from, to collaborate with, to be inspired by, to support, and enlightened by.” – Madonna

The Women Veterans Association’s mission is to create a safe space for women veterans to grow academically, professionally, and personally. Our team is dedicated to fostering genuine community and ensuring that women veterans at UCF have the best college experience possible.

For Fall 2025, we’re planning 2–3 engaging events and are also looking for women interested in stepping into leadership roles. Please email us if interested 

If you’re a woman veteran attending UCF this semester, we’re here to serve you!

✨ Join us to meet amazing women, help shape upcoming events, and create unforgettable memories.
📧 Contact us by email to get connected to our Discord.
📲 Follow us on Instagram: @wva_ucf
summary: The mission of the Women Veterans Association is to provide a platform at UCF for women who have served to come together to build an environment & community that nurtures personal, academic & professional growth.

name: Women's Club Soccer @ UCF
description: Hello, welcome to Women’s Club Soccer at UCF!! We currently have practice Monday/Tuesday/Thursday from 4:30pm-6:30pm on the RWC Grass Field. Please email wcsoccer.ucf@gmail.com or text 954-909-1362 before you come out for further details.
summary: We are the Women's Club Soccer team at UCF! We are a student-run organization that travels across the state of Florida playing high-level club teams at other Universities.

name: Women's Lacrosse Club @ UCF
description: The Womens Lacrosse Team at UCF is a competitive team that competes in both local and nation-wide tournaments. We travel to other Florida schools and out of state schools to compete. We have mandatory practices three times a week :)

name: Women's Law Student Association
description: Our club strives to empower women in the law field that is typically run by men. Our members will focus on study groups for the LSAT and networking for internships to be successful. We want everyone to succeed and work together to achieve the goal of getting into law school. Applications, studying for the LSAT, and finding internships is all very stressful along with school work that we already have, and that is what we are here for.

description: A club where women of all shapes and sizes can learn and play rugby with other schools throughout the state as well as around the country. No experience is necessary to come play and we practice every Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday from 4:00 pm-6:00 pm in the Fall and Spring on the sports club grass fields.

name: Women's Ultimate Frisbee Club @ UCF
description:
Welcome!!! to the Women's Ultimate Frisbee Sports Club at UCF (The Sirens)

We pride ourselves in providing a competitive athletic environment while also growing friendships that will outlast the college years. We welcome any girl who is interested in joining, no experience, so come on out!  

Absolutely no experience is required to join, we accept everyone onto our team with open arms!

name: Women's Volleyball Club at UCF
description: The Women's Volleyball Club at UCF, is a club for volleyball players with previous experience. Purpose: To play competitive volleyball without the extreme commitment of playing a regular college sport. Our goal is to play competitive volleyball while making great friends and memories. Our volleyball season starts at the beginning of fall and finishes at the end of the spring semester. General Info: Since we want everyone to be able to play, our club consists of two teams. We have practices a few times a week and have around 5 tournaments each semester. Travel: During fall we try to play other club teams in Florida. Some of the teams we have played in the past include University of Miami, University of Florida, University of South Florida, Florida State University, Stetson, etc. During spring semester we travel in and out of state to compete and be eligible to play at Nationals which is in Minneapolis, Minnesota in 2021. This past spring we traveled out of stated to play tournaments in North Carolina at UNC, Texas at University of Texas-Austin and Kansas City, Missouri for nationals. To stay informed please follow/like us on Facebook. All Club Volleyball events, practices, and open gyms will be announced there.
summary: The Women's Volleyball Club at UCF, is a club for volleyball players with previous experience. Purpose: To play competitive volleyball without the extreme commitment of playing a regular college sport. Our goal is to play competitive volleyball while m.

name: Women's Water Polo Club @ UCF
description:
Women's Water Polo at UCF is a competitive club team that travels within the Southeast region (Florida and Georgia) during the regular season and across the US for Nationals. We have been ranked among the top 10 teams in the Nation three times, once in the top 2.

Rankings at Nationals: 2013- 2nd | 2015- 9th | 2017- 5th | 2022- 12th

SE Division Champs: 2009-10 | 2013 | 2015 | 2017 

SE Runner-up: 2011-12 | 2014 | 2016 | 2018 | 2022

There are no tryouts or experience required to be a part of our team, however, a background in swimming is recommended. The (2025) Fall semester practices are TBD.

description:
Women's Wrestling Club @ UCF is working to bring UCF's women's wrestling to the national level, giving women access to competitions across the country and the ability to compete in both folkstyle and freestyle wrestling. Join us if you are a woman interested in learning and competing in high-level wrestling competitions!

 

Accolades:

1 National Champion

3 National Finalists

6 All-Americans
summary: Women's Wrestling Club @ UCF teaches women at UCF to wrestle and allows them access to national-level college wrestling competitions.

name: Women’s Pre-Dental Association
description:
The mission of Women’s Pre-Dental Association is to empower women pursuing dentistry by providing educational resources, career development opportunities, and resume enhancement to support their journey toward dental school.

Our goals are to create an environment where women can gain knowledge and confidence in their careers in dentistry by building a supportive network of dental professionals who share their personal experiences and insights into the field. Promote diversity within dentistry and advocate for equitable opportunities for women while encouraging professional and personal development through mentorship, workshops, and leadership opportunities. Provide engaging workshops that prepare members for dental school applications, interviews, and the Dental Admission Test. Facilitate networking and connections with dental professionals, alumni, and current dental students to foster relationships and career growth. Additionally, encourage members to take on leadership positions to further develop their skills and influence within the profession.

 

If you're interested in joining WPDA, following our Instagram account @UCFWPDA and join our flare chat! https://flare-event.app.link/OzTzjTl18Qb
summary: The mission of Women’s Pre-Dental Association is to empower women pursuing dentistry by providing educational resources, career development opportunities, and resume enhancement to support their journey toward dental school.

name: Writers Uknighted

Writers Uknighted is a network of creative student writers that strive to enhance their writing skills in a productive and positive atmosphere. This club provides a space for student writers to come together and hone their creative skills.

Whether you write creative fiction/non-fiction, poetry, scripts, plays, etc. feel free to come to our meetings and activities to learn more about the craft of writing and gain a wider perspective on both other people's work as well as your own!

Feel free to reach us at our email, writersuknighted@gmail.com or join us on Discord, which is our base of operation (link:https://discord.gg/3ECEVKfR)

name: YEHUDI
description:
By offering dynamic programming, thrilling social events, beautiful venues, international trips, and stimulating growth opportunities, YEHUDI forges eternal bonds and sparks the YEHUDI in you.
 
Join YEHUDI Orlando for inspirational learning programs, paid fellowship opportunities, authentic Shabbat/holiday experiences, and incomparably immaculate vibes every Monday Night @ The HUB and during Friday Night Onegs at the Abisror's house!
 
In addition, YEHUDI offers unique Fellowship programs traveling to Israel, Europe, and across the United States over winter and summer breaks.
summary: YEHUDI was born with a wish and a vision – a wish to offer Florida’s Jewish college students and millennial’s real Jewish content and refreshing experiences, and a vision to make it happen.

Throughout the academic year, we will host mutual aid events, support charity efforts on campus, and host various other volunteering events like these to engage our members in the activism process.

name: Young Life College
summary: Young Life College exists as a gathering place for students, regardless of their religious beliefs, to connect with each other, explore questions, seek answers, and be energized in a community that exists to pursue Jesus in real and authentic ways.

name: Young Poets' Society
description:
Established 2022, the Young Poets' Society (YPS) was created to foster the skills of poets, be it new or old. The club holds monthly meetings where members are encouraged to write and share poems in an inclusive and supportive environment. The club's social media channels allow prospective and returning members to keep up with meeting times, as well as club-sponsored events, such as performance opportunities, outings, and more. All are welcome at our socials and open mics.

For any questions, feel free to email us at ypsucf@gmail.com or DM an officer on our Discord!
summary: Young Poets' Society is UCF's first poetry and slam club! Our goal is to nurture and create an inclusive, amplifying writing community on campus through monthly meetings, submission and performance opportunities, and workshops.

name: Youth Evangelical Fellowship at University of Central Florida
description: The Mission of Youth Evangelical Fellowship at University of Central Florida” is to offer deep studies that would provide spiritual guidance for universities at different levels of their faith. All fellowship, prayer, and bible reading will give students a deeper understanding of the Word of God and their desire to live a life that truly honors the Lord. We want to give students the opportunity to also evangelize on campus throughout the week, become campus leaders in teaching the word, and contribute to the betterment of the UCF/Orlando area through community service events, hosting local retreats, and deep Bible Studies offered throughout the week during every semester.
summary: The Mission of Youth Evangelical Fellowship at University of Central Florida” is to offer deep studies that would provide spiritual guidance for universities at different levels of their faith. All fellowship, prayer, and bible reading will give students

name: Zeta Beta Tau Fraternity, Inc.
description:
ZBT prides itself on being an inclusive Jewish organization welcoming of any college man who understands and appreciates our Mission. ZBT will recruit and initiate men of good character — regardless of religion, race or creed — who are accepting of our Credo and Mission.

Founded in 1898, ZBT is the world’s first and largest Jewish Fraternity. Since our historic founding, more than 140,000 men have been initiated into our great Brotherhood. Again making history, in 1989 ZBT became the first fraternity to abolish pledging and all two-tier membership statuses. Our Brotherhood focuses on equal rights, privileges and responsibilities for all brothers. We firmly stand against all forms of hate in our communities, and we are working to create a safer and more inclusive college and community environment for all students.
summary: The Delta Iota chapter of ZBT was founded in March of 2005 as apart of the Interfraternity Council. The brotherhood is based off the precepts of integrity, social responsibility, intellectual awareness, and brotherly love.

name: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated
description: The Sophisticated Sigma Epsilon chapter graced the campus with its presence on April 5. 1978. Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc. was founded on the principles of Service, Scholarship, Sisterly love, and Finer womanhood. We are a community conscious action-oriented sorority. Zeta women are not only hard working for Zeta but their talents are shared with organizations at UCF and in the Orlando community.
summary:
Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated was founded on the principles of Service, Scholarship, Sisterly love, and Finer womanhood. 

 The Sophisticated Sigma Epsilon chapter graced the campus with its presence on April 5, 1978.
